loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro con su credikiva hizo compras a un mayor volumen y de contado, su negocio estaba colmado de artesanías, camisetas de futbol, artículos deportivo, bolsos y similares, que vendió rápidamente y esto se debió al dinero producto de su crédito y a su cercanía con el Estadio Metropolitano, cuna del balompié colombiano.  Hoy esta muy agradecida por este apoyo económico que le ha dado liquidez para hacer compras puntuales y tener mucho mas surtido su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará productos de bisutería, camisetas de la selección Colombia, calzado y bolsos aprovechando que en el Estadio ya mencionado se llevarán a cabo las eliminatorias del Mundial  de Brasil-2014. Su experiencia la potencialidad de la demanda de aficionados al futbol que disfrutaran los eventos, hace que la inversión de su credikiva, se proyecte con gran éxito.
texts.en: Álvaro used past Kiva loans to pay cash for wholesale supplies of the merchandise he sells.  His business was stacked to the ceiling with football shirts, sports equipment, bags, etc., all of which he quickly sold.  He says that he owes his good luck to your loans and the proximity of his business to Estadio Metropolitano, the home of Colombian football.  He wants to thank you for your help because your loans have provided the capital he needs to stock his business.  He is applying for a new loan now that he will use to buy merchandise--Colombia team football shirts, for example--that will be in great demand by Metropolitano football fans in the lead-up to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.  He's learned alot about the retail business and he expects this investment to be a great success.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a single mother of five children, and two of her children go to school. Sylvia doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling hardware and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of cement, nails and iron bars to stock her store. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Sylvia's major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to have a fully stocked hardware shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Sylvia's monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, nails and iron bars to sell

loans.name: Debbie

texts.es: Debbie de 60 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la actividad comercial, tarea que inició después de haber trabajado como empleada, e impulsada por su esposo decidir emprender una actividad generadora de ingresos, aprovechando su potencial de servicio no explorado. Así fue como poco a poco invirtieron un pequeño capital en la compra de mercancías y Debbie estructuró una clientela, con la que le fue muy bien y pasaron a ser  sus  fijos compradores. Gradualmente a su negocio fue agregando otros servicios, como el de telecomunicaciones vía celular e internet e impresiones. Sus ideas de negocio poco a poco han dado sus frutos, pues les ha acercado cada vez mas clientela y mas servicios con los que genera ingresos. Hoy ve la necesidad de ofrecer el servicio de fotocopiaje,  adicionar  una vitrina y comprar productos de papelería, para ubicarlos de manera ordenada en su exhibición.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y también tiene una cartera de cuentas por cobrar de mercancías,  entre su mas  efectiva clientela, que crece cada vez mas. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para hacer esta inversión y por eso  acude a un credikiva, primera financiación a la que aplica en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con la cual realizará todas las inversiones antes mencionadas. Su crédito será efectivo pues adicionará un servicio muy demandado por su clientela que genera dinero circulante de manera inmediata, así mismo agregará papelería que diversifica también su oferta y también es un producto que vende de contado y que ordenará desde un principio en una hermosa vitrina desde donde impactará en cada época como la que se acerca en la cual se celebra el día del amor y de la amistad que es una de las comercialmente mas rentables en el año,  donde las ventas se incrementan .
texts.en:
Debbie, 60, lives in the city of Barranquilla and works in commerce, a task she started after having been working as an employee and encouraged by her husband to start her own income generating activity taking advantage of an unexplored service potential.  This was how they gradually invested a little capital into buying merchandise and Debbie acquired customers she did well with and who later became regular customers.  

Gradually, the business added other services like mobile phone telecommunications, Internet access and photocopying services.  Her business ideas have gradually been bearing fruit for every day she has more customers and more services that generate income.  Today, she sees the need to offer photocopying services, to add a display case and to buy stationery supplies to display in an orderly fashion.  She sells for cash and also has a few merchandise credit accounts among her best customers which grow more every time.

At present her working capital is insufficient to make this investment which is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to make all the investments mentioned above.  Her loan will be effective because she’ll be able to add a service that has high customer demand and generates cash immediately.  In addition, she’ll add stationery supplies which will diversify her offer and it’s also a type of product that sells for cash and that she will be able to organize from the get-go in her beautiful new display case where she’ll be able to create an impact each season like the upcoming one when the Day of Love and Friendship is celebrated which is one of the year’s most profitable when sales increase.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier, a display case and stationery supplies.

loans.name: Leana Alexi

texts.es: Leana compró útiles escolares e insumos con los que fabricó uniformes de diario y de educación física, respondiendo oportunamente a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para fabricar bolsos y nuevos uniformes deportivos, así como también comprará útiles, escolares con los cuales planea aumentar su capital de trabajo y así mismo su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:“ Muchas gracias por su apoyo el cual ha sido de gran ayuda,  ya que ha permitido buscar nuevas líneas de productos, para ofrecer a la población escolar; espero continuar recibiendo su apoyo. “
texts.en:
Leana bought school supplies and supplies she used to manufacture every day and physical education uniforms thus responding to her customers in a timely way.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies to manufacture tote bags and new athletic uniforms as well as to buy school supplies to increase her working capital and her clientele.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you very much for your support which has been of great help because it’s made new production lines possible to offer to the school age population; I hope to continue receiving your support.”

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: La Perla Del Oriente Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LA PERLA DEL ORIENTE está  compuesto por doce integrantes once mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. María tiene 40 años, se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de harina por cantidad para la elaboración de variedad de panes  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. María va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, la Sra. María  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "La Perla del Oriente" is made up of 12 members, including 11 women and 1 man.  The president of the bank is Maria.  Maria is 40 years old, and has a business making and selling bread from a bakery located in her house.  This is Maria's first loan cycle with this institution.  Maria will use this loan to buy flour in bulk to make a variety of breads.  This way she will be able to provide better service to her customers and increase her earnings.  The reason she is requesting this loan is so that she can continue to improve her business.  Maria will use the profits to continue buying utensils and supplies for her bread-making business.  Maria is a very hardworking person who feels happy about the opportunity being provided to her and her fellow group members, because some those members are the sole support of their families.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Rina Carmela

texts.es: La Sra. Rina tiene 40 años, casada con tres  hijos que son de las edades de 13, 11 y  9 años todos se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Rina  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan empanadas y variedad de repostería, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona Vino Tinto,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de harina, manteca y azúcar por cantidad ya que tiene  un horno de mayor capacidad y quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes  Sra. Rina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad, la Sra. Rina con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, ella  es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Rina, 40, is married and has three children whose ages are 13, 11 and 9; all are school age.  Rina works baking read, turnovers and assorted pastries.  Her bakery is located in the Vino Tinto zone.  This loan is her fourth sequence in the institution and Rina will use this loan to buy flour, shortening and sugar in quantity because she now has a larger capacity oven and she wants to increase production to meet customer demand.

The business challenge Rina faces is competition from a bakery that produces in larger volume.  With this loan, Rina will improve her profits.   She’s a person who very much wants to improve and feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided since it’s the only source of income she has to support her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials at wholesale.

loans.name: Giannina Paola

texts.es:
Giannina es una joven de 24 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se encuentran playas hermosas y sobre todo es conocida porque sus pobladores tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos ya que los hacen de manera muy deliciosa. Cuando Dispone de un tiempo libre a Giannina le gusta mucho ver televisión ya que la distrae un poco, asimismo le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Ella estudio la carrera Técnica de contabilidad y es algo que la llena de alegría.

Día a día Giannina trabaja como obrera en un vivero de su ciudad desde hace un año, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas diarias; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Giannina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en el cuarto donde vive, ya que es alquilado, ella realizara la construcción de una cerca de material noble, de esta manera ella tendrá mas seguridad y podrá seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder tener un mejor empleo”.
texts.en:
Giannina, 24, lives in Chincha, a city famous for its warm and pleasant climate, its beautiful beaches and, above all, its people's gift for preparing the region's traditional dishes, known far and wide for being the best.  

In her spare time, Giannina likes to watch television--a welcome distraction, she says--and make "arroz chaufa", a traditional rice dish that's a great favorite of hers.  She studied accounting in school and says that she liked it very much.  She has worked as a laborer in a "vivero" (could be a plant nursery, but not clear) for a year now.  She works 8 hours a day.  She says that the job is going well because she is responsible and, above all, because she is driven to get ahead.  

Giannina wants to thank Kiva lenders because your past loans have provided the funds she's needed to make improvements to the room where she lives.  It's a rented room but she wants to make additional improvements with materials that will make the space safer and more comfortable.  She says that she will continue to work hard to fulfill her dreams, "To have a house of my own and a better job".

loans.use: to pay for house improvements.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother of three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). Annet has a business selling local gin and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin. Annet works at the market seven days a week and sells both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow enough so that she can buy a delivery van to ease transportation. She would also like to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin to sell

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman with three children. All of the children are enrolled in school. Mejumaa operates a tailoring business and sells her goods in the shop. She has worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbors and town dwellers. Her greatest challenge is caused by seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mejumaa will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy clothing materials and sewing thread. She aspires to expand her business in the future. Her aim is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and sewing thread.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El Sr. Gerardo esta solicitando el segundo crédito para realizar la compra de útiles escolares, uniformes, e inscripciones de sus hijos. El Sr. Gerardo es casado y comenta que este tipo de crédito es de mucha ayuda para ellos están agradecidos con la institución y les gusta que sus pagos son mensuales porque así se organizan para poder juntar el pago con tiempo.
texts.en: Gerardo is asking for the second loan to buy school supplies, uniforms and to pay tuition for his children.  Gerardo is married and comments that this type of credit is very useful for them.  They are grateful to the institution and they like that the payments are monthly because they can organize themselves and be able to save up to make their payment on time.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, uniforms and pay tuition.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: La señora Ana Luz, de 43 años de edad, vive en Olanchito, Yoro, junto a sus 4 hijos y su  esposo. Ella hace dos años y medio que decidió dedicarse al negocio de cría y venta de cerdos. Anteriormente tenía una pulpería y miro que este negocio es más rentable. Ahora quiere hacer crecer el negocio aumentando la cantidad de animales. Ha solicitado varios préstamos a ODEF para mantener el negocio. Actualmente el que solicita de 10,000 Lempiras es el quinto préstamo otorgado con el cual va comprar más cerdos para cría y venta y también su alimentación como el concentrado. Espera incrementar la cantidad de animales y poder recibir más ganancias, ya que su meta es sacar adelante a su familia y que tenga una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ana Luz, 43, lives in Olanchito, Yoro, with her four children and her husband.  Two years ago she started raising pigs to sell.  She used to have a grocery store but she noticed that this business is more profitable.  Now she wants to make the business grow by increasing the number of animals.  

She has asked ODEF for several loans to stay in business.  She is currently requesting 10,000 lempiras which is the fifth loan granted that she will use to buy more pigs to raise and sell and also to buy feed like concentrate for them.  She expects to increase the number of animals in order to earn higher profits since her goal is to move her family forward so that they will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina tiene 50 años y tiene  2 hijos que ya son independientes, ella  vende calcetines para varones, mujeres, niños y niñas además de ropa interior lencería, su puesto se encuentra en un ad las calles más concurridas  de la ciudad de La Paz este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Catalina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una sombrilla y más mercadería para su negocio su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería le gusto mucho la atención que le dimos y la forma en que Kiva trabaja, la Sra. Catalina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son solo puede salir a vender en las noches ya que la alcaldía le prohíbe vender en el día, aun así no pierde ánimo para sacar adelante a su familia,  va a utilizar los beneficios comprando mas calcetines para niños debido a que se acercan las fiestas patrias y por los desfiles escolares, habrá más demanda, lo  único que ella quiere es que sus hijos progresen y estén sanitos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 50 and has two independent children. She sells men's, women's, and children's socks, underwear, and lingerie. Her stand is located on a busy street in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Catalina will use the loan to buy an umbrella and more merchandise for her business and needs the loan because she lacks working capital to make these purchases. She loves the attention she receives from the institution and the way that Kiva operates.

Catalina faces a business challenge: the mayor's office prohibits her from selling during the day, so she can only sell in the evenings. However, that has not discouraged her from providing for her family. She will use the loan to buy more children's socks since the upcoming national holidays and student parades will increase demand. Her only wish is that her children thrive and are healthy.

loans.use: to buy an unbrella and more merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Luis de 37 años de edad es divorciado y vive con su mama mientras repara su casa. El trabaja en una agencia de seguridad de la localidad como guardia, su mama es la única dependiente económica y ella comenta que el ha sido de gran ayuda, es un hijo ejemplar y un hombre trabajador a pesar del hecho de que su esposa lo abandono eso no lo ha detenido ni le ha quitado sus ganas de seguir adelante superándose día a día. El está solicitando de nuestra ayuda para colocar el portón en su domicilio y así poderla habitar ya que la inseguridad en nuestra ciudad ha ido en aumento. Juan Luis agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Juan Luis, 37, is divorced and is living with his mother while he repairs her house.  He works as a guard for a security agency in his town.  His mother is his only dependent, and she comments that he has been a great help to her and that he is an exemplary son and a hardworking man who, in spite of the fact that his wife left him, has not let that stop him or diminish his desire to get ahead and succeed.  He is requesting our help to put a gate around his house so that he can live more securely, because the insecurity has been increasing in his city.  Juan Luis appreciates the help that is being provided.

loans.use: to build a gate around his house

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es: Emilce  de 41 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 15 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en profesionales de éxito y son ellos su mayor sueño por el cual trabaja esforzadamente, con tal de aportarles a su bienestar. Emilce tiene un pequeño taller donde  confecciona ropa femenina, como faldas, vestidos, blusas y pantalones, mediante las operaciones de diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas, desde hace 12 años, cuando trabajó como operaria, para solo después de realizar 3 cursos de perfeccionamiento de la técnica confeccionista,  decidió emprender su propio negocio, comprando su primera máquina, trabajando sobre medidas y gradualmente   incursionado con la modalidad  de “a todo costo”. Su meta mas adelante es exportar sus productos en países latinos y continuar dándoles estudios profesionales a sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es tener un flujo de efectivo, que le permita hacer compras de contado y obtener precios de oportunidad, mientras realiza las ventas de dos maneras, a crédito cuando las hace a todo costo y de contado cuando ofrece el servicio, con este esquema ha logrado responder a las necesidades de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  materias primas e insumos, pues desarrollará ropa femenina que ha encargado  su creciente clientela y a ella quiere continuar fidelizándola.
texts.en:
Emilce, 41, is married and has two children who are 10 and 15 years old who she dreams becoming successful professionals; they are her greatest dream and for whom she works hard to provide with wellbeing.

Emilce has a small sewing workshop where she manufactures women’s clothes like skirts, dresses, blouses and pants.  She designs, cuts, prepares, assembles and finishes the pieces.  She started out 12 years ago working as an employee and then took three courses to perfect her dressmaking techniques and decided to start her own business.  She bought her first machine and worked to order gradually moving into working in the ‘all included’ modality.  Her goal for later on is to export her products to other countries in Latin America and to continue providing her children with professional studies.  

Her greatest challenge is having cash flow that will allow her to make cash purchases thus obtaining special prices.  She sells in two ways: on credit when she provides the all-included and for cash when she does the sewing only.  This way of operating has allowed her to meet her customers’ needs.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy raw materials and supplies because she will make women’s clothes ordered by her growing clientele that she wants to continue to retain.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Maria Juana, soltera con 59 años de edad con 4 hijos mayores de edad, independiente, tiene actividad económica una pulpería desde hace 9 años, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable a pesar de su edad y problemas se salud quiere seguir trabajando para seguir siendo independiente económicamente, Maria Juana necesita el financiamiento para comprar productos de consumo diario como:  arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, jabón, leche, detergente, frescos naturales, jugos enlatados, cuajadas, entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Juana, 59, is single.  She has 4 grown children, all independent now.  She has operated a general store for 9 years.  She is a responsible, hard-working woman and, despite her age and health problems, wants to continue working so that she won't have to rely on help from others.   Maria Juana will use this loan to buy merchandise--rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, bread, soap, milk, detergent, canned and fresh juices, etc.--to stock her business.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Bignona Bassene Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 28 Mars 2002. Les deux membres sont liées par la caution solidaire. Leur activité principale est le commerce de détail.
Mme Aïda est l'emprunteur vedette du groupe. Sur la photo, elle est gauche, levant la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants âgés entre 31 et 15 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un village environnant.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage de renforcer son activité et les bénéfices serviront à augmenter son niveau d'épargne et aider son mari à la prise en charge des enfants pour la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was created on March 28, 2002.  The two members are bound by a mutually enforceable guarantee.  Their main commercial activity is retail sales.

Aïda is the featured borrower of this group.  In the photo, she is on the left with her hand raised.  She is married and is the mother of nine children between the ages of 15 and 31.  She purchases her supplies from a nearby village.  With this loan, Aïda plans to strengthen her business. She will use her income to increase her savings and to help her husband in providing food, healthcare and education for their children.

loans.use: to buy fish, peanut butter and other products for resale

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol de 52 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 28 años, allí tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos, bebidas y artículos en general de la canasta familiar. Ella emprendió su negocio desde el año 1986, inicialmente vendiendo artículos de manera ambulante y posteriormente cuando se le presentó la oportunidad de aprovechar la clientela de una vecina que cerró su tienda, ella  emprendió su propia aventura,  comprando los artículos de mayor rotación en la canasta familiar, como arroz, aceite, carnes tubérculos, verduras etc. y poco a poco fue agregando otros productos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado de lunes a domingos y desde las 6 de la mañana abre sus puertas a la clientela,  hasta las 9 de la noche; sus principales clientes son las amas de casa del sector y vecinos en general, que encuentran en su tienda,  la solución a sus necesidades e intereses de compra. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, crédito # 11 que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores financiamientos  ha logrado aumentar sus utilidades  y tiene un sueño de prosperidad que es ampliar su negocio hacia el ramo de la ferretería y muy seguramente con su disciplina lo logrará. Con su credikiva comprará Bebidas y víveres que son los productos que presentan mayor rotación y requiere tener muchos de ellos entre sus inventarios, para rotar así mismo su capital y lograr mayores ingresos y esto es justamente lo que logrará con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Marisol, 52, lives in the southwest of the city with her four children whose ages range from 19 to 28 years.  She has a store there where she sells snacks, foodstuffs, soft-drinks, beverages and general staple items.  She started her business in 1998 initially selling from place to place and then when the opportunity arose to take over clientele from a neighbor’s who was closing her store she started her own business venture buying basic staples like rice, oil, meat, tubers, vegetables, etc. at wholesale gradually adding other products.

She sells for cash Monday through Sunday from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.  Her main customers are housewives in the area and neighbors in general who find in her store what they need and are looking for to buy.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the 11th loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She used previous loans to increase her profits and her dream is to prosper and expand the business into hardware; she’s disciplined enough to accomplish this.

She will use her Kiva loan to buy beverages and foodstuffs which are the products that sell the most and she needs to have many of them in inventory so that her capital will turnover and her income will be greater which is what the Kiva loan will make possible for her to accomplish.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married woman. She has one child, who is a source of her joy and motivation for her hardwork. 

Subira operates a beauty salon. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are area residents and passersby. Her family's other source of income includes income from her spouse. Subira’s highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor water. 

Subira will use the 15,000 KES loan to fund her business by buying a salon dryer and beauty chemicals. She aspires to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a salon dryer and beauty chemicals

loans.name: Julia Matilde

texts.es: Julia  es su pequeño taller ubicado al sur occidente de la ciudad,  elabora bolsos de telas, correas, cosmetiqueras, pequeñas carteras  y gorras deportivas, arte que aprendió de su hermana   dedicada a la misma actividad. Julia  vende directamente a sus consumidores, integrados por   compañeros de trabajos, vecinos y referidos por estos mismos compradores.   Sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes especializados en insumos de confecciones y los vende recibiendo de sus clientes un 50% de contado y el otro a crédito; ella trabaja  de lunes a domingo durante las horas de la tarde, pues también genera ingresos como empleada.  En la actualidad quiere aumentar la calidad de sus productos y para ello requiere una máquina plana semiindustrial, con la que ofrecerá un mejor acabado en los artículos que fabrica; así mismo comprará meterías primas e insumos, para comprar telas, accesorios como hebillas correderas, hilos y botones. Con su inversión logrará aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y obtener un mejor ingreso y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Julia has a small workshop located in the southwestern area of the city, where she makes cloth handbags, straps, cosmetic bags, small wallets, and sports caps. She learned the trade from her sister, who is also in this line of work. 
Julia sells directly to her customers, who are coworkers, neighbors, and people referred to her by these buyers. She makes her purchases in cash at establishments specializing in sewing supplies and charges her customers 50% cash and 50% credit. She works Monday through Sunday in the afternoons, since she also generates income as a housekeeper.
She currently wants to increase her amount of products and, in order to do so, she needs a semi-industrial flat sewing machine, which will allow her to obtain a better finishing on her products. She will also purchase raw materials and supplies. She will buy fabric, accessories such as sliding buckles, thread, and buttons. Her investment will allow her to increase her sales volume and obtain better income, which is precisely her goal for this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, accessories such as sliding buckles, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a business selling green bananas. She has been in this business for six years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis and works from her home. She generates additional income by selling charcoal.

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 29 años, tiene dos hijos: Almendra y Ángel. Juntos viven en una casa que alquila desde hace 7 años. 
Ella posee terrenos de cultivo propios que se ubican a dos horas de caminata desde su localidad, y además alquiló otros terrenos agrícolas donde pueda sembrar mayor cantidad. Produce papa, maíz y alverja y en sus 3 años de experiencia en esta actividad ha vendido sus cosechas en la feria de la ciudad, con esas ganancias puede brindar alimentación y educación a sus hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues disfruta del campo y de vivir allí; la dificultad es cuando los precios bajan, “a veces son inestables los precios en el mercado, se gana menos”, comenta. Ahora desea mejorar e incrementar sus sembríos para obtener buenas ganancias. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de un año) obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su actividad, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, donde todas las personas son responsables.
Jackeline invertirá este dinero en la compra de 120 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 29, has two children, Almendra y Ángel, with whom she lives in the house she has rented for 7 years. She owns farmland that is a two-hour walk from her house. She also rents some higher quality plots. She grows potatoes, corn, and vetch. During her 3 years working as a farmer, she has sold her harvests in the city fairs and used the proceeds to feed and educate her children. She loves to work and would like to live close to the fields. When prices drop, things become difficult. "Sometimes market prices are unstable, and you earn less," she says. She would like to increase and improve her plantings to achieve higher profits. 

She belongs to the communal bank “Nuevo amanecer” [New Dawn], and this is her third loan cycle with MFP. During this time (over a year), she has received the money she needed to invest and develop her business, and, therefore, she promises to make her payments. She is also happy to belong to her group, whose members are responsible. Jackeline will use the loan to buy 120 sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on her corn plantings.

loans.use: to buy 120 sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on her corn plantings.

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es: Claudia de  58 años de edad casada, con dos hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad económica la venta, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería  y un kiosco, la pulpería la tiene en su casa de habitación y el kiosco en la Terminal de buses de la localidad, tiempo de dedicarse al pulpería 20 años, ella tiene varios años de trabajar con Fundación la cual le ha ayudado a crecer poco a poco invirtiendo en capital de trabajo en la actualidad con las ganancias es que pudo comprar el kiosco  y lo abastece con  los proveedores que le ofrecen desde hace varios años, su sueños y metas es incrementar un poco mas su inventarió y terminar de pagarles los estudios universitario a su hijo menor el cual depende totalmente de ellas objetivo que esta a punto de lograrlo ya que su hijo pronto culminara su carrera. con el financiamiento comprara productos de consumo diario como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan, azucar, galletas, gaseosas, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: Claudia, 58, is married and has two grown children.  She owns a corner shop that she has operated from a space in her house for 20 years and a kiosk that she set up more recently at a local bus terminal.  She is a long-standing client of Fundacion and says that they have helped her grow her business.  She invested a bit at a time over the years, buying merchandise for her corner shop and eventually saving enough to buy the kiosk.  She says that she wants to add new products and earn enough to pay her youngest son's university fees.  He's almost finished with school now, so she's very close.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise--rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, sugar, snacks, cold drinks, etc.--that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah  is married with five children, and only one of her children goes to school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Deborah has a restaurant. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more foodstuffs like beef, chicken, cassava, sweet potatoes and bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells to all categories of people on retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices for food. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like beef, chicken, cassava, sweet potatoes and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Mangoase Group

texts.en:
Mangoase Group is made up of one man and one women. They sell firewood and fish.They are both married and their average age is 54.They live with their families at Teshie.

Tawiah is a 62-year-old women who sells fish. She has been doing this job for 20 years. She buys the fish from the fishing harbor and sells it to customers. She is married to a carpenter who is 51 years old. Currently, all three children are grown and fully taking care of themselves. Tawiah helped her husband to pay for their school fees through the sale of fish. 

This is Tawiah's fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana. She took a third loan amount of 600 Ghana cedis and paid it back successfully, completing payment on 04/07/2012. She now needs a loan of 800 Ghana cedis so that she can buy more fish to supply to her customers because demand for fish has gone up.

Together, the members of Mangoase Group need a total amount of 1,100 Ghana cedis to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fish to supply to customers.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 63 años, está casada con Jorge, con quien tiene seis hijos, de los cuales ahora sólo viven con uno de ellos: Alexander. Su casa es propia, la heredó de su madre.
Ella trabaja junto a su esposo, todas las mañanas se dirigen a sus terrenos agrícolas, ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en la siembra de maíz, papa y cebada, los que comercializan en la ciudad durante la feria de los domingos. Sus terrenos agrícolas son propios, pues durante todos estos años de trabajo duro pudieron ahorrar lo necesario para tener una vejez segura. “Me gusta sembrar, es lo que aprendí desde pequeña, mis padres me enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella”, afirma. Es por esa razón que desea mejorar su producción y continuar con las mismas fuerzas para seguir sembrando.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de 2 años) obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en su desarrollo, por lo que promete ser puntual el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, donde todas las personas son responsables y solidarias.
Fortunata invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 63 years old and is married to Jorge. They have six children together, and currently only one, Alexander, lives with them. She owns her home, which she inherited from her mother.

She works with her husband. Every morning they head out to their plots of farm land. She has five years of experience growing corn, potatoes, and barley, which they sell in the city at the Sunday market. They own the plots of land they farm, since over all these years of hard work they were able to save up what they needed in order to have security in their old age. “I enjoy farming. It is what I learned as a child. My parents taught me how to work and live off the land," she says. That is why she wants to improve her production and continue on with the same energy so that she can keep farming.

She belongs to the solidarity group Nuevo Amanecer, and this is her fifth loan with MFP. During all this time (over two years) she obtained the money she needed to invest in her development, so she promises to pay her installments timely. She also enjoys being a part of her group, where all the members are responsible and supportive people.

Fortunata will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of ten sacks of natural fertilizer, which she will use on her crops of corn.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of natural fertilizer to use on her crops of corn.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en: Gaspard is 60 years old and is married. He has three children who are between 3 and 6 years old. Gaspard sells various goods such as lotions, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He has three years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. Gaspard has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to increase his business and he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as lotions, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  is married with five children and only one of her children goes to school.  She doesn’t’ take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, and sweet and Irish potatoes.  Besides this restaurant business she generates additional income through selling mobile phone airtime.  

Susan's major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into  a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more  bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Bessy Carolina

texts.es:
Bessy de 32 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. 
Ella hace tres años consiguió un puesto de venta en el mercado para establecer su propio negocio, donde vende todo tipo de medicinas naturales, vitaminas, ungüentos y suplementos alimenticios. Atiende su negocio todo el día, es muy trabajadora. Esta solicitando un préstamo a ODEF para surtir el negocio y tener una mejor solvencia económica, comprara hierbas naturales y vitaminas. Con esta inversión espera incrementar las ventas y hacer crecer el negocio. Su meta es tener un fondo de ahorro y hacer mejoras en el hogar para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Bessy, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  She got a sales stand in the market three years ago to open her own business; she sells all types of natural medicines, vitamins, unguents and nutritional supplements.  She tends to her business all day; she’s very hardworking.

She’s asking ODEF for a loan to stock her business in order to attain better economic solvency.  She will buy natural herbs and vitamins.  With this investment she plans hopes to increase sales and make the business grow.  Her goal is to have savings and to make some home improvements in order to live better.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 22 years old and married without children. He sells various goods such as dishes, clothes, soap, etc. Steven employs two people to help him and he works from 6 am until 9 pm every day of the week with five years of experience.

Steven has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more dishes, clothes, soap, lotion, etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as dishes, lotions, soap, clothes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Winifride

texts.en: Winifride is 28 years old and is married. Winifride sells various goods such as cassava flour, sugar, soap, salt, etc. She has ten years of experience in this work with two employees to help her. Winifride has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cassava flour, sugar, soap, salt, etc., for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more cassava flour, rice, sugar, milk, soap, salt etc.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 23 años, está casada con Marcos, todavía no tienen hijos. Viven, desde hace 3 años, en una casa alquilada.
Desde que unió con su esposo emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de llantas, pues notaron que en su zona no existen tiendas que vendan repuestos para autos. Es así que hace 2 años comenzó con el negocio, ya tiene clientes fijos que le piden cada mes un par de llantas; “el ingreso es constante, pues las carreteras no son asfaltadas, solo son de tierra y piedras, por lo que las llantas se desgastan constantemente”, afirma. En cada venta de una llanta llegan a ganar un promedio de 50 soles, por par 100 soles. Sus clientes son fijos, por eso Betty desea abrir su propia tienda de llanta al por mayor, ya se encuentra juntando el capital necesario para lograr su objetivo.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP,  por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación donde todas las personas son responsables. 
Betty invertirá este dinero en la compra de más llantas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Betty is 23 years old and is married to Marcos. They don't have children yet. They have lived for three years in a rented house. Since they married, she has started a business buying and selling tires, because they noticed that in their area there are no stores that sell spare parts for cars. That's why she started the business two years ago. She now has regular customers who order a pair of tires from her every month. She says, "The income is constant, because the roads are not asphalted. They are made of earth and rocks, which means that tires wear out constantly." For each tire sale, they earn an average of 50 soles, or 100 soles for a pair. Her customers are regular, so Betty wants to open her own store for wholesale tires. She is already gathering the necessary capital to achieve her goal.

Betty belongs to the solidarity group Nuevo Amanecer and this is her third credit with MFP, so she promises to be on time with her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her group where all the people are responsible. Betty will invest this money in buying tired to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy more car tires to supply her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline designs and crafts jewelry with Andean silver and colorful gemstones. She would like to expand production by investing in a bulk purchase of raw materials.

Jacqueline has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Jacqueline owes her artistic inclinations to her mother, a fashion designer. "I used to go to nearby markets for a necklace or a bracelet, but I was never satisfied with what I saw. So, I used to buy more than one, tear them apart, and make one piece according to my own design. Eventually I decided to learn about design and silversmith techniques, visiting several workshops and learning from those who would have me around. I haven't stopped ever since. My jewelry designs fill me with satisfaction. My motivation comes from knowing that someone might feel happy when they wear my designs. My inspiration comes from my children, a daughter and a son, who fill my house with happiness and give me strength to try new things every day."

"I'd like to thank you in advance for the help you're giving me. I hope to have good sales for the holidays, and need capital to get ready. I also want to develop new designs. Many thanks for your support."

Use the link below to view Jacqueline's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5957

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk for the crafting of her jewelry designs

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet  is a single mother of four children and two of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  She has a business selling cameras, batteries and film and accessories.  She has been in this business for eight years and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. 

Harriet has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of batteries, cells, and camera film.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked shop of camera batteries and film.    She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cameras, batteries, cells and film

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 27 years old and is married with two children. He sells various goods such as: lotions, salt, soap, sugar, clothes, etc, from a store which operates from 6 a.m.until 8 p.m. six days per week. He currently employs three people to help him and he has three years of experience in this work. 

Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: lotions, salt, soap, sugar, clothes, etc. to resell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, sugar, clothes, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Neudis

texts.es: Neudis de 26 años de edad se dedica ofrecer  servicios de mejoramiento personal, aplicando técnicas de belleza y estética a una clientela que ha ido conquistando poco apoco con su excelente servicio personal. Ella es casada y madre de un pequeño que tiene 4 años, motor de la vida de ella y su esposo, por el cual trabajan para generara cada día mas bienestar familiar. Neudis antes de iniciar su negocio, trabajó en un spa mientras estudiaba, allí adquirió toda su experiencia e inició su oferta inicialmente a domicilio y posteriormente se instaló en un local,  donde aun ofrece tratamientos corporales y de belleza, en sus instalaciones y también hace domicilios programados.  En la actualidad para hacer tratamientos corporales, arrienda el equipo y esto le sale cada vez más costoso, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un equipo para tratamientos corporales y también insumos para aplicar masajes.  Su meta mas adelante es aumentar su equipamiento para atender cada vez con mayor calidad y mas eficientemente.
texts.en: Neudis, 26 years old, works offering personal improvement services, applying beauty and aesthetic techniques to her clientele that she has won little by little with her excellent personal service. She is married and a mother to a little boy who is four years old, the driving force in her life and the life of her spouse. Therefore, she works to improve her family's life every day. Neudis, before opening her business, worked in a spa while she studied. There, she acquired all of her experience. She started her business going to customers' houses and later moved it to its own location, where she still offers physical and beauty treatments. She also still goes to customers' houses. Currently, in order to give more physical treatments, she rents the equipment, which is getting more and more expensive. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase equipment for physical treatments and supplies to give massages. Her goal is to add to her equipment in order to attend to more and more clients with better quality and efficiency.

loans.use: to buy equipment for physical treatments and supplies to give massages.

loans.name: Jennifer Elieth

texts.es: Jennifer Elieth, de 31 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad la venta de golosinas, la cual distribuye de forma ambulante, desde hace 3 años, negocio que inicio por la necesidad de tener un fuente de ingresos y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. El financiamiento lo quiere para compra golosinas como: meneitos, caramelos, chicles, bombones, chocolates, tortillitas, huevitos, galletas, paletas mérmelos entre otros.
texts.en: Jennifer Elieth, 31, is married and has two minor children.  Her activity for the last three years has been selling snacks from place to place, a business she started because she needed to have a source of income to help her husband with household expenses.  She needs the loan to buy such sweets as: maneitos, [corn puffs], caramels, chewing gum, bonbons, chocolates, potato chips, cookies, lollipops, etc.

loans.use: to buy assorted candies and chewing gum.

loans.name: Modesta Alicia

texts.es: Silvia Modesta de 80 años de edad, soltera con un hijo mayor de edad independiente totalmete , tiene por actividad economica la venta de cosa de horno , desde ha 29 años, Silvia expresa sus ganas de serguir trabajando para sentirse util e independiente economicamente , a pesar de los problemas de salud a los que enfrenta, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion , el financiamiento lo  quiere para compra productos para la elaboracion de cosa de hornos como: maiz, leña, azucar, queso, arroz, frutas, leche, canela, entre otros.
texts.en: Silvia Modesta, 80, is single and has an adult son who is completely independent.  Her economic activity is selling baked goods; she’s been in business 29 years.  Silvia says that she wants to continue working to feel useful and be economically independent despite the health problems she faces.  Her business is located at home and she needs the financing to buy products like corn, firewood, sugar, cheese, rice, fruit, milk and cinnamon among others to produce baked goods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Makhabat

texts.ru:
Махабат 45 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей, младшему из которых 9 лет. Махабат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  2 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Махабат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 3 дойных коровы с приплодом, 9 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1,3 га орошаемой земельной доли с репчатым луком и морковью.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров для увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса за счет посадки перца, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить обучение для детей.
texts.en: Makhabat is 45 years old, married and has five children, the youngest of whom is nine years old.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Makhabat has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for two years, having started this business with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains three dairy cows with offspring, nine small livestock and 1.3. hectares of irrigated land plot with onions and carrots.  In order to further develop her business, Makhabat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business by planting pepper in order to have an ability to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is single and has three children.  She takes care of additional family members (cousins). She sells tomatoes, which she has been doing for 15 years. She works seven days a week and works at the market on retail. She does not have any other income-generating activity.   

Agnes is requesting a loan for 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes.  Her major business challenges Include seasonality and defaulters.  She would like to expand her business so that she can start growing tomatoes herself.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 26 años, está casada con Carlos, tienen un hijo de 10 años, Kener.
Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy valiente, ella se dedica al trasporte de pasajeros, maneja un motocarro desde su anexo a la ciudad. Ella es una de las pocas mujeres que desarrollan esta actividad, pues la mayoría de choferes son varones. Pero también distribuye su tiempo con trabajos eventuales, como la limpieza de jardines y veredas para la municipalidad. Le gusta estar ocupada, por ello constantemente también ayuda a su cuñada a ordeñar sus vacas, con ello puede obtener leche fresca para a su hijo. Por su parte, su esposo trabaja como albañil en una empresa constructora donde recibe un sueldo mensual. El deseo de Yessica es adquirir otro motocarro para poder aumentar sus ganancias.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Yessica invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar sus ahorros para comprar un motocarro.
texts.en:
Yessica is 26 years old, married to Carlos, and has one 10-year-old son named Kener.

She is a very brave woman who works transporting passengers. She drives a motorcar from its enclosure in the city. She is one of few women who do this, since the majority of chauffeurs are men. But she also holds some temporary jobs, such as cleaning the gardens and paths of the city. She likes to stay busy, so she is always also helping her sister-in-law milk her cows, which gives her fresh milk for her son. For his part, her husband works as a bricklayer in a construction company where he receives a monthly salary. Yessica's wish is to get another motorcar to increase her earnings. 

This is her third loan with MFP, where she is waiting on a small loan so that she can complete her objectives. She promises, once again, to pay the payments on time. She is pleased to be part of her group because all of its members are responsible and supportive.

Yessica will invest the loaned money to complete her savings to buy a motorcar.

loans.use: to complete her savings to purchase a motorcar.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos Mauricio y Daniel en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la confección de diferentes prendas de vestir, vestidos, blusas, faldas, pantalones, entre otros todo para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene varios años con el negocio que esta ubicado en su vivienda y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que la ropa esta a la vanguardia, es elaborada con material de primera calidad y al gusto del cliente pero sobre todo a un precio accesible, es caracterizada por su gran amabilidad y el buen servicio,  adicional a la confeccion vende productos por catalogo para completar los gastos del hogar; Irma es una mujer emprendedora, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta dispuesta ha aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan pues sabe que eso le abrirá camino al éxito, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda de sus servicios y necesita invertir en materia prima para aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital para lograrlo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor, agujas, hilos y productos de catalogo. Irma tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma, 48, lives with her two children, Mauricio and Daniel, in her own house.  She works sewing various articles of clothing like dresses, blouses, skirts and pants among others for women, men and children.  She’s been in business several years and it’s located at home.  She has a large clientele because people know her clothes are cutting-edge, made with top quality materials and her service is good.  In addition to sewing, she also sells merchandise via catalogue to earn enough for household expenses.

Irma is an enterprising, active woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s always ready to take advantage of opportunities that arise because she knows that this will open paths to success for her.  Demand for her services has increased lately and she needs to buy raw materials for production but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fabric at wholesale, needles, thread and catalogue merchandise.  Irma has good payment references and is sure she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale, thread and catalogue items.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra con su anterior creikiva compró artículos para el hogar, accesorios domésticos, juveniles, ropa, cosmético y calzado; con ello logró buenas ventas y reinvertir en su negocio, ampliando su capital de trabajo un poco mas.  Ella está muy satisfecha con su inversión y está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará cosméticos, vestidos y calzado, pedidos que ha tomado de su clientela  en su actividad  de preventa, para que su clientela se sienta complacida y regrese a comprarle, pues ellos son la razón de ser de su negocio y eso Mayra lo reconoce y es justamente lo que constituye el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en: Mayra used her previous loan to buy household items, domestic accessories, juvenile products, clothing, cosmetics and shoes. She succeeded in having good sales and reinvesting in her business by increasing her working capital a little more. She is very pleased with her investment and is applying for a new loan with which she will purchase cosmetics, dresses and shoes, all customers’ orders she took at her pre-sale. She wants her customers to feel satisfied and to return to buy from her since they are the reason she is in business and Mayra recognizes that and this is just what makes Kiva such a success.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, dresses and shoes.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru:
Кундуз 54 года, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. Кундуз работает социальным работником в сельской управе  «Долоно» и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  5 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с группового кредита от Бай Тушум. Благодаря упорному труду Кундуз в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS). Также Кундуз обрабатывает 1,8 га земли, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров в целях увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством постройки сеновала, а в дом планирует провести паровое отопление.
texts.en: Kunduz is 54 years old, a widow and raised six children.  She works as a social worker at the village "Dolono" council and, to provide additional source of income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for five years, having started this business with a group loan from Bai Tushum.  Thanks to Kunduz's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring, fifteen small livestock and one horse, and the monthly profit from the business amounts to about 4,000 som (KGS).  She also works on 1.8 hectares of land, where she grows beans, potatoes and perennial herbs.  In order to further develop her business, Kunduz requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business by building a hayloft and plans to install steam heating for her house.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto de 36 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, visitado por turistas usualmente los fines de semana, para lograr descanso y diversión en sus playas. Heriberto dio apertura a un estadero hace 6 años,  aprovechando que su residencia está frente a una cancha,  donde se practica futbol. Sus ventas se incrementan los fines de semana,  con la práctica deportiva que ocurre frente a su negocio, en el cual   vende cervezas, refrescos, jugos naturales y mecatos. Él además tiene otro negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, actividad donde es apoyado por su esposa. Heriberto es un joven emprendedor que siempre se encuentra explorando nuevas oportunidades de negocios, recientemente se asocio con un amigo y está en la tarea de vender teléfonos celulares de gama baja y media, además invirtió en 2 motocicletas que las tiene trabajando como medio de transporte en el pueblo y recibe una renta diaria. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,   pues requiere comprar un enfriador para ofrecer bebidas y refrescos en su punto máximo de enfriamiento y también invertirá en cajas de gaseosas y cervezas, para hacer de cada fin de semana, una oportunidad de generar ingresos con la satisfacción de su clientela  y planear el crecimiento futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Heriberto, 36, lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, a spot located on the shores of the Caribbean, that’s visited by tourists on weekends to rest and enjoy the beaches.  Heriberto opened a snack bar six years ago taking advantage of the fact that his house is across from a soccer field.  His sales increase on weekends with all the teams practicing across from his business.  He sells beer, soft-drinks, fruit juices and packaged snacks.  He also has another business selling varied merchandise that his wife helps him with.

Heriberto is a young entrepreneur who is always exploring new business opportunities.  He recently partnered with a friend and is in the low to medium price mobile phone sales business.  He also invested in two motorcycles that he has working providing transport in the town that produce a daily rental fee for him.  

He’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because he wants to buy a cooler to be able to offer beverages at their coldest possible; he will also buy cases of beer and soft-drinks so that every weekend will be an opportunity to generate income by satisfying his customers and he can plan for his family’s future growth.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Rita Morena

texts.es: Rita Morena de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia; ella posee una panadería y elabora pan en variedad dulce y salado, quesadillas, semita, tortas, pastelitos, pan francés, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener el mejor pan con un sabor exquisito, el negocio esta ubicado en el lugar donde vive ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque su producto es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Rita es una mujer muy trabajadora desde muy temprano empieza su labor y pone cada día todo su esfuerzo y dedicación pues sabe que al final de la jornada de trabajo podrá compartir un momento con lo mas importante para ella su familia, como toda comerciante quiere acrecentar su negocio pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, etc. Rita Morena tiene buen record de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrece llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rita Morena, age 53, lives with her two children in her own house.  She has a bakery, and she makes a variety of bread.  She makes sweet breads, rolls, quesadillas, tarts, cakes, pastries, and French bread, among others.  She has been in this business for several years, and this has gifted her with a lot of experience.  This allows her to get better bread with an exquisite taste.

The business is located in the place where she lives, and she already has a lot of customers.  People prefer her because her product is first class at accessible prices.  However, above all, they prefer her excellent service.  Rita is a very hard-working woman.

She starts her work very early, and she puts forth all of her effort and dedication every day.  She knows that at the end of her work day she will be able to share time with what is most important to her, her family.

Like all merchants, she wants to increase her business.  However, she does not have the capital to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and milk, etc.  Rita Morena has a good payment record, and she is sure that she will be able to settle her debt and also provide her household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and milk.

loans.name: Katiana Paola

texts.es: Katiana con su anterior credikiva compró artículos de tocador indispensables para el ejercicio de su actividad y realizó adecuaciones locativas, para ofrecer una mejor atención a su numerosa clientela, a quien le ofrece servicio de mejoramiento de su imagen personal, manicure, pedicure etc. Con su credikiva anterior sus ventas se incrementaron y su clientela se encuentra muy satisfecha. En la actualidad Katina está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos de alta rotación como cremas, perfumes, y continuará sus adecuaciones locativas hasta lograr el confort que sus clientes  requieren, porque este es su sueño de prosperidad. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por hacer cumplir mis sueños para seguir creciendo como persona y empresaria “.
texts.en:
Katiana used her previous Kiva loan to buy indispensable dressing table items for her activity and did some physical improvements to the site to offer better service to her numerous clientele who she offers personal image improvement services, manicures, pedicures, etc.  Thanks to her previous Kiva loan her sales increased and her customers are very satisfied.

Katiana is currently applying for an new Kiva loan to buy more of the products that are her best sellers like creams and perfumes and will continue doing physical upgrades to her space to provide the customer comfort they require because this is her dream of prosperity.

Her message to Kiva lenders is: “Thank you for making my dreams a reality to continue growing as a person and as a businesswoman.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to do physical improvements to her salon.

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en: Nitu is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 8.  In 2007, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Nitu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Makhburat

texts.ru: Махбурат 40 лет, воспитывает 4 детей.  Махбурат в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством  и растениеводством.  Начатое 13 лет  назад со стартовой суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство имеет на сегодня  1 дойную корову с приплодом, 2,04 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает хлопок, кукурузу и рис. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махбурат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения надоев молока и повышения продаж молочной продукции. Доходы Махбурат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить учебу для детей.
texts.en: Makhburat is 40 years old and raising four children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  The business, started thirteen years ago with an initial sum of 1,000 som (KGS), today contains one dairy cow with offspring and 2.04 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows cotton, corn and rice.  The monthly profit from the business amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Makhburat requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes and sales of dairy products.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business in order to have an ability to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Godfred specializes in hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, metal plates, and paints to increase his production.

Godfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"As a child, I used to make boats with worn-out metal utensils, which I would float in water. Due to financial constraints, my parents could not further my education, so I had to drop out of school and join my uncle, who was a wood carver. Thanks to the woodcarving, I've been able to educate my four children, and I know that with constant sales, I'll be able to give them a brighter future than I had. This motivates me to wake up each day to carve! I have trained about 30 people to carve and some of them have now set up their own workshops. I currently have five people working with me. My dream is to one day have a big workshop to train a lot of people – especially school dropouts who think life has ended because their parents couldn't further their education. Their success in the art of carving would be my legacy."

"I thank you for your support through this microcredit; it will help me so much! I will be able to increase my production, which in turn means I will have more to sell."

Use the link below to view Godfred's masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7252

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, metal plates, and paints to increase his production

loans.name: Berta Santos

texts.es: Berta Santos de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia; Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado muy buena experiencia en las ventas, comercia de forma ambulante y desde su vivienda, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por su producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Berta es una mujer emprendedora, enérgica, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le abran puertas a un futuro mas prospero y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzarlas; en los últimos meses tuvo perdidas y desea recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, desodorantes, etc. Berta tiene buena calificación de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo ofrece darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Berta Santos, 42, lives with her life companion and their three children in her own house.  She sells personal use items like creams, deodorants, perfume, among others.  She’s had this small business for years and it’s provided her with good sales experience.  She sells from place to place and at home.  He has a large clientele because people prefer her because of her quality products, her accessible prices and above all for her excellent service.  

Berta is an enterprising, energetic woman who very much wants to get ahead and is always looking for alternatives that will open doors to a more prosperous future and she does not plan to give up until she reaches it.

She had some losses the last few months and wants to recuperate but does not have enough capital for the investment so is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.  Berta has good payment record and is very responsible.  She is sure that she will be able to repay the loan as scheduled while offering her family a full life at the same time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 55 años, está casada con Sergio, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con uno de ellos. Su casa es propia, la compraron hace 25 años.
Ella posee una carretilla desde hace 4 años, con la que vende frutas y flores, de forma ambulatoria. “Todo depende del mes, por ejemplo en el mes de mayo y noviembre vendo flores, los demás días del mes vendo frutas”, comenta.
