loans.use: to erect pillars.

loans.name: Momodu

texts.en: This is Momodu, who is 50 years old, married and the father of two grown children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him and works as a sales assistant. In 2007, Momodu established a spare parts business as a way to earn money to care for his family. He works seven days a week, nine hours a day, and earns about Le 1,000,000 every month. He is requesting a loan for Le 5,000,000 to buy spare parts to sell to his customers. In the future, Momodu plans to erect a house and open another shop.   He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: El señor Silverio tiene 29 años de edad conviviente con la Sra. Isabel hace 6 años tienen 2 hijos dependientes, toda la familia se dedican a la actividad agrícola es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, locoto cultivando en terreno de 2.1 has con rotación de cultivos en la comunidad de Corani Pampa Duraznos, Silverio tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad agrícola, ellos están a 82 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, silverio y su esposa nos comentan que necesitaban dinero para comprar un terreno agrícola que esta en venta de urgencia al lado de su parcela, el ahorro que tenían gastaron en la compra antena de una antena parabólica para televisión y motocicleta que era de mucha necesidad, Don Silverio es una persona joven y emprendedor, nos comenta con el préstamo comprara el terreno y ampliara su producción agrícola para que tengan mejor ingreso económico y garantizando  la seguridad alimentaria para su familia.
texts.en: Silverio is 29 years old and has lived with Isabal for six years. They have two dependent children. The whole family works in agriculture and it is their source of income. They produce potatoes and peppers using crop rotation, growing on 2.1 hectares of land in the community of Corani Pampa Duraznos. Silverio has a lot of experience in agriculture. They are 82 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. Silverio and his wife told us that they need the money to purchase farm land next to their parcel that is being urgently sold. They spent the savings they had on a parabolic antenna for television and a motorcycle that they really needed. Silverio is a young and enterprising person. He tells us that with the loan, he will buy the land and increase his agricultural production so that they have a better income and guarantee food security for the family.

loans.use: to buy farm land

loans.name: Lecheritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LECHERITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamata, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lorenza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de zanahorias, producción de leche, compra y venta de ganado, venta de zanahorias, producción de hortalizas

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lorenza es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche; cuenta que desde hace seis años que trabaja en esta actividad, conjuntamente su esposo, ya que ambos iniciaron este emprendimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento ampliación de capital (compra de ganado) mismo que comprará de una comunidad aledaña, posteriormente lo criará. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito ágil.
texts.en:
The community bank "Lecheritas" is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, working through the institution's regional office in Patacamata.  The group is comprised of eleven members, and is overseen by a board of directors, of which Lorenza is the president.

The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, including growing and selling carrots and other vegetables, dairy farming, and buying and selling livestock.

This loan will benefit these small micro-businesses, including that of Lorenza.  She reports that this is the first time the group is working with Pro Mujer.  She was invited by a member of Pro Mujer who went to her house to visit her.  Currently she has a milk production business.  She has been doing this work for six years, along with her husband.  They started the business together.

She will use her portion of the loan funds for working capital to purchase livestock.  She will buy the livestock in a nearby community and will then raise the animals.  This work will allow her to generate income to support her family as much as possible.  She is married and has four children.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the ease with which a loan can be obtained.

loans.use: Compra de ganado

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plastic items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu, forty, is married, and has two children aged eighteen and fourteen. In 2007 Memunatu started selling fish to add to her family’s income. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL in profits every month.

Memunatu is applying for a 4,000,000 SLL loan from ARD. She will use it to buy different types of fish to meet the demands of her customers. This will certainly increase her profits.

In the future Memunatu plans to be a fish agent supplying fish to the provinces. With her profits she is planning to build a house and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of fish to sell.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Isata. She is married and has four children aged three, four, fourteen and 25. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help with the household chores.

In 1999 Isata started selling textiles to add to her family’s income. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 2,537,000 SLL every month.

Isata is applying for a 4,000,000 SLL loan from ARD. She will use the loan to improve her trade in Ghanaian batiks. She estimates this loan will help her increase her monthly profits by about 507,400 SLL.

Isata’s future plans include increasing her textile stock, expanding her trade and educating her children as high as possible. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more textiles to sell.

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE ALEGRES” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de helados, venta de papa y chuño, tienda de barrio, venta de ganado vacuno, venta de ganado ovino, venta de comida

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que hace años ella estaba en muchos problemas económicos por ello inicio un negocio de venta en su domicilio que dio bueno réditos, el primer crédito que se tuvo apoyo a ampliar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento incrementar de capital (compra de galletas, refrescos, etc.) mismo que comprará de la Ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.
texts.en:
The community bank "Siempre Alegres" is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, working through the institution's regional office in Patacamata. The group is comprised of eight members, and is overseen by a board of directors, of which Victoria is the president.  The members are engaged in a variety of businesses, including production of ice cream, the sale of sheep and cattle, and the sale of potatoes, potato starch and other food items.

This loan will benefit these small micro-businesses, including that of Victoria. She reports that the group has been working with Pro Mujer for one year. She was invited by a representative of Pro Mujer who went to her house to visit her. Currently she has a neighborhood grocery store.  She reports that in the past she had a great deal of financial problems.  For this reason she started a home-based business that generated good profits.  The first loan that she took helped her to grow her business.

Victoria's portion of the loan proceeds will serve as working capital to buy cookies, sodas and other items.  She will buy these items in the city of La Paz, and then sell them them in her community.  This will allow her to generate income to support her family in the best way possible, since she is married and has five children.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the attention she receives.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sodas and other items.

loans.name: Abejitas De Tilata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ABEJITAS DE TILATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de salchipapa, venta de cerveza, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de mochilas chilenas, venta de gallinas, venta de dulces, venta de telas, venta de chatarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es una integrante, ella indica que es hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a que este negocio lo adquirió de su madre desde hace quince años, ya que fue un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud.
texts.en:
The “Abejitas de Tilata” (Tilata Little Bees) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Miriam, President.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which we have: salchipapa [fried sausage and fried potatoes] sales, beer sales, baby clothes sales, Chilean backpack sales, chicken sales, candy sales, fabric sales and sale of recyclables.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit the small micro businesswomen of which Miriam is one.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling candy, a business she got from her mother fifteen years ago since it had been a family business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy candy in street markets in the city of El Alto to then resell in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income needed to support her family the best way possible since she lives in a common law relationship and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata, 35, is married and has a son aged eight. She has two additional dependents living with her who help as sales assistants in her business.

  In 2002 Aminata began selling household utensils because she wanted to become more independent. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month.

She is applying for a 5,000,000 SLL loan from ARD. With the loan she will travel to a neighboring country to buy household utensils at a cheaper rate, then sell them at home at a profit.

Aminata’s future plans include building a house and sending her son to the university. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: To buy more household utensils abroad.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 31 years old, married and has three children. To help support the family Jonah sells a variety of dried and salted fish. She earns about 5000 PHP each month doing so.

Jonah has been a member of PMPC for a year. She is applying for a 120,000 PHP loan to buy more fish to sell. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried and salted fish to sell.

loans.name: Merelita

texts.en:
Merelita is married with one child. She is 51 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Merelita owns rice fields to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for her rice fields.

Merelita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her rice fields.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia, 53, is married and has four children. For the past twelve years she has run a sari-sari (general store) to help support her family. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP from the shop.

Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for two years. She is applying for a 14900 PHP loan to buy additional stock for her store. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en:
Illuminada, thirty, is married and has three children. For the past twelve years she has sold generic medicine to help support her family. She earns 10,000 PHP a month doing so.

Illuminada has been a member of PMPC for two years. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional medicine to sell. She hopes this will serve to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional medicine to sell.

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ma. Betty

texts.en:
Ma. Betty is married with two children. She is 37 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ma. Betty sells spices to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 20,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more spices to sell/repack and retail.

Ma. Betty has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future,  she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell/repack and retail.

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda is married with three children. She is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Winefreda owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.

Winefreda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 43 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Nita has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,900 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used in purchasing feed for her hog fattening business. 

Nita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Amanda Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Amanda tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida desde hace 10 años, con quien conforman una bonita familia  junto a sus 3 hijos varones (uno de 9 y dos de  7 años respectivamente). Ella se dedica a la venta de pan artesanal y venta de chocolate en tablillas y el esposo al cultivo de tomate y chile verde.

Esta familia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan  artesanal especialmente (tustacass, totopostes, entre otros); también, procesa de forma artesanal el cacao para vender el chocolate en tablillas. La venta de pan la realiza dos veces por semana y la venta de chocolate (tablilla) la realiza dos veces por semana. Esta actividad la hace desde que tiene 10 años de edad, manifiesta que su abuela y su mamá se dedican a realizar lo mismo y que esta actividad les genera un estatus y reconocimiento en su comunidad, por la calidad de sus productos. Al mismo tiempo le permite ganar y mantener a sus clientes. La señora Amanda, manifiesta con orgullo que sus productos gustan  y son comercializados  en  Estados Unidos.  A través de personas que se dedican a llevar encomiendas,  familiares y amigos que regresan a la comunidad  a visitar a sus familiares y luego se regresan a trabajar. Actualmente emplea dos mujeres a la que les paga el 20% de las ventas que realizan.

Toda la materia prima que utiliza la adquiere de contado en el mercado municipal, lugar donde va a comercializar sus productos una vez por semana, este se encuentra a 6 kilómetros de su casa.
 De su casa hasta donde toma el bus camina con los huacales cargados en su cabeza aproximadamente un kilómetro por medio de calle balastada. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan, materiales de construcción para elaborar el techo de la galera que protege el horno de la lluvia y el sol. Además comprara fertilizantes para el cultivo de tomate; posee, 2500 plantas en semillero, las que dentro de una semana transplantará al terreno de cultivo.

La inversión servirá para el mantenimiento y protección de la infraestructura de producción (horno artesanal), capital de trabajo para la elaboración de pan y chocolate en tablilla, especialmente en este rubro donde la cliente piensa crecer en ventas considerando que empleará a otras dos  mujeres en la venta y en la compra de insumos agrícolas especialmente fertilizantes e insecticidas para el cultivo de 2500 plantas de  tomate.

Considera que sus productos poseen buena aceptación por sus clientes y ellos le recomiendan con otros, por lo que desea procesar mas para emplear otras mujeres de la comunidad especialmente en ventas y así mejorar su condición de vida. Espera que la cosecha de hortalizas sea buena, considera que producir no es muy difícil, si la comercialización en la que ella se involucra  directamente debido a que se considera con mejor habilidad que su compañero de vida.
texts.en:
Amanda, 37, has lived with her life companion for ten years.  She forms a beautiful family with him and their three sons, a nine-year-old and two seven-year-olds.  She sells artisanal bread and chocolate in tablets and her husband grows tomatoes and green chilies.

This family works baking and selling artisanal bread especially tustacas [sweet cookies with raw sugar topping] and totopostes [cheese and corn cookies], among others.  She also processes cocoa beans to sell chocolate in tablet form.  She sells the bread twice a week and the chocolate tablets twice a week.  She’s been doing this since she was ten-years-old.  She says that her grandmother and her mother do the same thing and this activity gives them status and recognition in their community because of the quality of their products.  At the same time it makes it possible for her to generate and retain customers.  Amanda states proudly that her products are well-liked and sold in the United States by means of people who take them there and by family and friends who return to the community to visit their families and then return [to the USA] to work.  She currently employs two women she pays 20% of sales.

She pays cash in the municipal market for all of the raw materials she uses and she also sells her products there once a week; it’s located six kilometers from her house.  From her house to the bus stop she must walk for about one and a half kilometers along gravel roads with the loaded crates balanced on her head.

The loan will be used to buy raw materials to make bread and building materials to roof the galley protecting the oven from the rain and the sun.   In addition, she will also buy fertilizer for the tomato crops.  She has 2500 plants in seed boxes that will be transplanted in about a week.

The investment will serve for maintenance and protection of the production infrastructure (artisanal oven), for working capital for making bread and chocolate tablets.  With respect to this latter activity in particular, she is planning on hiring two more women to sell it.  Finally, it will help to buy farm supplies especially fertilizer and insecticide for the 2500 tomato plants.

She believes that her products are well-received by her customers and they refer her to others which is why she wants to process more to employ more women from the community especially to sell thus improving their living conditions.  She hopes that the tomato harvest will be good.  She believes that producing isn’t difficult but the selling is and she gets directly involved in it because she believes she’s better at it than her life companion.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies, building materials and fertilizer.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is married with two children. She is 62 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Isabel owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 for additional capital to buy more groceries to sell. 

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with four children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lolita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Luzmenda

texts.en:
Luzmenda is 57 years old and lives in Malintiboan, Labason, Zambonaga del Norte. She is married and has seven children.

Luzmenda works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase kilos of fishes to resell.

Luzmenda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of fish to resell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Justina is providing habal-habal, or motorcycle, services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

Justina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one children. 

Geralyn has a retail and food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Geralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to support the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar tiene 48 años, tiene dos hijos y viven en la casa que heredó de su mamá hace 10 años. 
Años atrás se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero luego tuvo una nueva idea de negocio y alquiló un puesto céntrico en el mercado de la ciudad donde ahora vende carne de pollo. Su trabajo lo realiza con el apoyo de su hermana, quien le ayuda en atender a los clientes. “Me va bien, comienzo a vender desde muy temprano, para el medio día terminó con todo los pollos que llevo, además durante las festividades vendo mucho más”, comenta. Ahora desea aumentar su capital para poder obtener más ganancias.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
María del Pilar invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios pollos para su venta.
texts.en:
María del Pilar, 48, has two children and lives in the house she inherited from her mother ten years ago.  Years ago she worked in agriculture but then got a new business idea and rented a centrally-located stand in the city’s market where she now sells chicken.  She does her work with help from her sister who helps her take care of customers.  “I do very well.  I start selling very early and by noon have sold all the chickens I bring.  During festivals I sell much more,” she comments.  Now, she wants to increase capital in order to earn higher profits.

She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” (The Enterprising Ones) communal bank and this is her third MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support that will help her reach her objectives.  On the other hand, she promises to make her payments.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because she’s known them for many years.  María del Pilar will use the requested money to buy several chickens to resell.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Diosnell

texts.es: El Sr. Diosnell tiene 33 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 11 años se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Abapo,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Diosnell va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Diosnell enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Diosnell, 33, has an 11-year-old son.  He works in agriculture growing a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes and manioc on his parcel of land located in the community of Abapo.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution.  Diosnell will use this loan for his corn crop which implies preparing the soil.  The reason for requesting the loan is to have the necessary resources for planting and subsisting.  The business challenge Diosnell faces is inclement weather which often ruins crops.  He will use profits to improve his and his family’s quality of life since he’s responsible for all household expenses.  He’s a responsible, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 40 años, tiene dos hijos: Devid y Jack, con los que vive.
Ella es una mujer admirable, pues hace poco se separó de su esposo, teniendo que afrontar la educación y crianza de sus hijos sola. Para ello trabaja sin descanso en el mercado de la ciudad, donde vende carne de gallina. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esto y es muy conocida por sus clientes. Por las tardes, abre las puertas de su tienda, la cual acondicionó en su casa hace un año, allí también vende carne, pero junto a otro tipo de comestibles y abarrotes. Paralelo a esto, también cría vacas, cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y pavos, los que comercializa cuando los engorda. Y como si fuera poco, junto a una socia, invierte en sus tierras para la elaboración de ladrillos; ella pone la tierra y su socia la arcilla y la chala para quemar los ladrillos. Todas sus ganancias le sirven para mantener los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su crédito número 14 con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Silvia invertirá este dinero en la compra de más carne de gallina para su negocio, además de productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Silvia, 40, has two children, Devid and Jack that she lives with.  She’s an admirable woman because she’s recently separated from her husband and now has to face her children’s education and support by herself.  To do so, she works tirelessly in the city market selling chicken meat.  She’s been in this business for four years and is very well-known among her customers.  In the afternoons she opens the doors to her store that she’s had for a year at home.  She also sells meat, chickens and turkeys there that she sells after she fattens them up.  And if that weren’t enough, along with a partner she invests in her land to manufacture bricks.  She puts in the land and her partner the clay and wood chips to bake bricks.  All her profits are used to cover expenses at home and of her children.

She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” (The Enterprising Ones) communal bank and this is her 14th MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support she’s gotten to reach her goals.  She promises to make her payments.  Silvia will use this money to buy more chicken meat for her business as well as products for her store.

loans.use: to buy more chicken meat.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Merlyn has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 28 años, está casada con Pablo, su esposo desde hace 3 años, tienen dos hijos: Rosa y Josmel. La casa donde viven es propia. 
Mientras su esposo trabaja en una empresa de transporte de carga como chofer, ella se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, los cuales vende cada tres meses según pedidos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio logró obtener 200 ejemplares, los cuales aumenta con facilidad, pues sabe cómo los separa de acuerdo a parentesco, embarazo y edad, de esta manera obtiene mejor resultado en la crianza. Además tiene cuatro toros pequeños que está criando para venderlos. Su secreto es sembrar alfalfa, de esa manera puede brindarles un buen alimento y minimizar costos. Asimismo, por las mañanas, se dedica a la venta de carne en un puesto que alquila en el mercado central de la ciudad. Lo que desea ahora es mejorar su granja e implementarla mejor.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su crédito número 14  con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Evelyn invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más carne para la venta y comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old and is married to Pablo, who is her husband of three years. They have two children: Rosa and Josmel. The house where they live is their own. 

While her husband works in a freight company as a driver, she raises guinea pigs, which she sells every three months by order. Thanks to her effort and sacrifice, she managed to get 200 animals. She increases them with ease because she separates them according to kinship, pregnancy and age, so she gets better results in the breeding. 

Additionally, she has four young bulls that she is breeding to sell. Her secret is to plant alfalfa, thus she can provide them with good food and minimize costs. Also, in the mornings she sells meat in a stall that she rents in the central market of the city. What she wants to do now is to improve her farm and deploy it better.

She belongs to the solidarity group "Los emprendedores" and this is her loan number 14 with MFP. She is grateful for the support they give her to meet her objectives. She promises to meet her installment payments. Also, she likes to be part of the association, since she has known them for many years. Evelyn will invest the requested money to buy more meat to sell and animal feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her animals and more meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Ledy

texts.es: Ledys  de 62 años de edad  espera la segunda temporada del año para hacer su mejor venta del año; su experiencia de 32 años de ser comerciante, le ha enseñado como trabajar en cada época y esta es en la que invierte su mayor esfuerzo  y todos los recursos de capital de trabajo, para lograr incrementos en sus ingresos, que generen bienestar para su familia. Entre los productos que mas vende están el calzado, los cosméticos y la fantasía femenina, gran parte de ellos los vende a crédito, entre clientes que ha ido ganando a lo largo de su vida empresarial. Desde hace mas de 20 años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde ha recibido 20 financiamientos, que le han permitido progresar en todos los sentidos, personal, familiar y empresarial. Su meta es continuar ampliando su capital de trabajo y esta es la época para hacerlo, por eso se ha acercado a solicitar un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, perfumería, fantasía y electrodomésticos menores, sobre pedidos y también para tener en existencia, antes de que aumenten sus precios de fin de año. Con su credikiva ganará el costo de la oportunidad y   tendrá mercancía a un buen precio, pues se ha anticipado al incremento de estos y así logrará satisfacer a su fiel clientela, a quien se debe su negocio.
texts.en:
Ledys, 62, is waiting for the second season in the year when sales are best.  Her 32 years’ experience as a merchant have taught her how to work each season and this is the one she puts her greatest effort and all working capital into in order to attain higher income that will generate family wellbeing.  

Among the products she sells the most are footwear, cosmetics and women’s costume jewelry.  Large part of what she sells she does so on credit among customers she’s won over during her career as a merchant.  She’s been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for more than 20 years and she’s gotten 20 loans that have made it possible for her to grow in all aspects: personal, family and business.  

Her goal is to continue expanding her working capital and this is the season to do so which is why she’s come by to request a Kiva loan to buy clothes, footwear, perfumery, costume jewelry, small home appliances based on prior orders and also to have on-hand before end-of-year prices rise.  With her Kiva loan she will be able to qualify for advance purchase pricing and will have merchandise for a good price because she’s anticipated their rise in price and will be able to keep her customers to whom she owes her business satisfied.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: El señor Filemón tiene 36 años de edad conviviente con la Sra. Simona la familia se dedican a la agricultura que es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, haba, oca con la práctica de rotación de cultivos en terreno de 1,5 Has que es herencia de su padres, una parte propia, tienen bastante experiencia en cuanto manejo de los cultivos, tratamientos fitosanitarios, cosecha y mercadeo, ellos viven en la comunidad de Cotani Bajo Churú a 48 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, don Filemón necesitaba dinero para comprar material de construcción (ladrillo, cemento y teja y otros)  la vivienda que tienen es muy precaria, Don Filemón nos comenta que ahora construirá y tendrá una vivienda nueva y cómoda con los servicios básicos.
texts.en: Filemón, 36, lives with Simona.  The family works in agriculture which is their source of income; they grow potatoes, lima beans, oca [a tuber].  They rotate their crops in a 1.5 hectare parcel of farmland he inherited from his parents and part of it of his own.  They have quite a bit of experience managing crops, fertilizing them, harvesting and merchandising.  They live in the community of Cotani Bajo Churú, 48 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  Filemón needed money to buy building materials (brick, cement and roofing tiles, among others).  Their house is very precarious and Filemón comments that now he will build and have a new, comfortable house with all basic services.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 64 años, está casada con Andrés desde hace 45 años, tienen ocho hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos. Su casa es propia, la adquirieron hace 34 años, como es muy amplia pueden vivir sus hijos independientemente, así no se siente sola con su esposo.

Su actividad principal es la tienda de comestibles que tiene hace 21 años. También cuenta con cuatro vacas, un toro, gallinas y cuyes, los cuales vende o consume de acuerdo a su necesidad. Así también, siembra maíz, cebada y alfalfa, pero esta última es para el alimento de sus animales. Sus cosechas las vende a un comerciante mayorista que la visita muy seguido, ya que conoce de la calidad de sus tierras. Ahora desea mejorar su tienda de comestibles, pues sabe que no tendrá la misma fuerza cuando envejezca más y solo tendrá que dedicarse a ese negocio.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su crédito número 18  con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.	María invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de arroz y azúcar, por sacos, para su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old and has been married to Andrés for 45 years.  They have eight children, but now only two of them live with them. Her house is her own, she acquired it 34 years ago. As the house is extensive, her children can live independently, so she does not feel alone with her husband.

María's main activity is the grocery store that she has had for 21 years. She also has four cows, a bull, chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells or eats according to her need. Also, she plants corn, barley and alfalfa, but the latter is for food for her animals. She sells her crops to a wholesaler who visits often and knows the quality of their land. Now she wants to improve her grocery store, knowing she will not have the same strength when she ages more and will have to work alone in that business.

María belongs to the solidarity group,"Los emprendedores (Entrepreneurs)," and this is her 18th loan with MFP.  She is so grateful for the support they have given her to meet her objectives. On the other hand, she promises to meet her payments on time. María will invest the requested loan to buy rice and sugar by the bag for her store.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar by the bag for her store.

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REY DE REYES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teofila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de medicina natural, venta de pescado crudo, tejido y venta de chompas, venta de pollo a ala broster, tejido de chalina y mantilla, venta de Hebalife.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teofila es una integrante, ella indica que es la segunda vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado crudo; nos cuenta que este negocio lo adquirió de sus padres desde niña, ya que ellos son pescadores.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de red de pesca) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo adecuara en negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los desembolsos.
texts.en:
The “Rey de Reyes” (King of Kings) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Teófila, President.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which we have the sale of natural medicines, raw fish sales, knitting and selling sweaters, Broasted chicken sales, veil and shawl knitting and Herbalife sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesses.  Teófila’s is one of them and she indicates that this is the second time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently sells raw fish.  She relates that she acquired this business from her parents since she was a girl; they are fishermen.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fishing net in the city of El Alto’s street market that she’ll then adjust for her work.  This way of working allows her to generate income needed to support her family the best way possible since she’s single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the disbursements.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años, hace 24 años enviudó, desde entonces cuida de sus cuatro hijos sola. Actualmente sólo vive con tres de ellos, en la casa que compró hace 5 años. A pesar de que sus hijos son mayores y ya conformaron su familia, ella continua viviendo con ellos, pues siempre soñó con criar a sus nietos.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles que acondicionó en su casa, pero no es la única actividad que realiza pues también cría de ganado vacuno, tiene cinco vacas, de las que extrae la leche que producen y la vende a sus vecinos. También tiene ovejas y gallinas, pero para su propio consumo, pero cuenta que si tiene cualquier eventualidad las vende en el mercado. Pero la actividad que le ayudó a solventar los gatos de sus hijos cuando eran pequeños fue el bordado de fustanes típicos, el precio de estas prendas es alto porque tarda mucho tiempo en terminarlas. Ahora solo realiza uno al mes, porque ya no tiene la necesidad económica de antes. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece el que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
María invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bebidas por cajas para su tienda de comestibles y si el dinero le alcanza comprará alimento balanceado para sus animales.
texts.en:
María, 48, was widowed 24 years ago.  Since then she’s cared for her four children alone.  She currently lives with only three of them in the house she purchased five years ago.  Despite her children being adults now and with families of their own, she continues to live with them because she always dreamed of raising her grandchildren

She has a grocery store at home but this isn’t her only activity for she also raises cattle; she has five cows that produce milk she sells to her neighbors.  She also has sheep and chickens but only for her own consumption though she does relate that if she has any unforeseen need she sells them in the market.  But the activity that helped her cover her children’s expenses when they were little was embroidering traditional skirts.  The price of these garments is high because it takes a long time to finish them.  Now, she only makes one a month because she does not have the same economic need she did back then.

She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” (The Enterprising Ones) communal bank and this is her fifth MFP loan.  She is grateful because they help her reach her objectives.  She promises to make her payments.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because she’s known them for many years.  María will use the requested money to buy beverages by the case for her grocery store and if the money goes far enough she will also buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft-drinks and  if possible, animal feed.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Perlita has a video-k shop that offers different kinds of songs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of her video-k machine (karaoke machine). Perlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her video-k machine

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida, con quien convive desde hace 3 años, se dedica a trabajar como empleado de vigilancia. Su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos y a la administración de su pequeña tienda.

David trabaja  como empleado de vigilancia en una empresa desde el 27 de  septiembre del  año 2009. En este lugar trabaja un día de por medio, es decir, en turnos de 24 horas. En su tiempo libre aprovecha para dedicarse al cultivo de maíz en pequeñas parcelas de producción de 1 manzana (7,000 metros cuadrados) esto lo hace con el apoyo de sus familiares en su lugar de origen que esta a 50 kilómetros aproximadamente de la ciudad.

La tienda, es administrada directamente por la señora, funciona desde hace dos años, se dedicó a este negocio debido a que dejó de funcionar la empresa para la que trabajaba, debido a la experiencia adquirida en la manejo de tienda, lo que aprendió cuando vivía con su madre,  decidió iniciarla con fondos de la indemnización recibida. 

La mercadería que oferta en su local de venta, la compra en el mercado municipal  y  centros comerciales en la ciudad donde reside  que esta a 1.5 kilómetros de distancia de su vivienda.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para la tienda  y $120.00 para la compra de fertilizantes para  el cultivo de maíz

El préstamo servirá para que mantengan sus iniciativas y deseos de progresar, al incrementar el volumen y diversificación de productos de primera necesidad  a ofertar en la tienda y para mejorar la productividad del área de cultivo de maíz.

Confía  en  su experiencia y capacidad de administración, desea hacer crecer su negocio, manifestando que prefiere el auto-empleo, débido a  que le permite dedicarle mayor tiempo a su familia y mejorar su relación, a la vez sus ingresos son mejores que el salario mínimo al que podría aspirar al desempeñarse como empleada. Desea procrear hijosr y poder cuidarles de forma personalizada.
texts.en:
David, 29, lives with his life companion that he’s lived with for three years.  He works as a security guard and his wife does domestic chores and runs their small store.  David has been working for a security firm since September 27, 2009.  He works 14-hour shifts, a day on and one off.  In his spare time he cares for his corn crop in small parcels on one manzana (7,000 square meters).  Family members help him with this work which is located in his place of birth fifty kilometers approximately from the city.

The store is run directly by his wife.  It’s been in operation two years.  He went into this business because he stopped working for the firm he’d been working with.  Because of the experience he’s gained working managing a store when he still lived with his mother he decided to open his store with the money he got from his severance pay.

He buys the merchandise he sells in his store at the municipal market and in shopping centers in the city where he resides that’s 1.5 kilometers from home.  He will use the loan to buy merchandise for the store and $120 to buy fertilizer for the corn crops.

The loan will help him maintain his initiatives and desire to make progress by increasing volume and diversification of basic staples available for sale in his store and to improve the productivity of his corn crops.

He trusts that his experience and management ability.  He wants to make his business grow because he prefers to be self-employed because it allows him more time to spend with his family and to improve his relationship.  At the same time, his income is higher than the minimum wage he’d be able to hope for working as an employee.  He wants to have children and be able to give them personalized care.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store and farm supplies.

She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, fish, and Irish potatoes.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 36 años, tiene dos hijos: José y Janeth, a los que cuida en la casa que adquirió hace 6 años. 
Ella es una mujer admirable, pues cuida de sus hijos sola, se las ingenia para poder ganar el dinero necesario, ya que su único sustento es la crianza de cerdos. Cuenta con 15 ejemplares que engorda y cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que vende su carne por pedidos y en ocasiones se los compran vivos; “todo depende del cliente”, afirma. Le va muy bien en este negocio, obtiene buenos ingresos que le permiten criar a sus hijos, pero para llevar un ingreso extra al hogar también trabaja como peón en diferentes chacras durante la cosecha, y también trabaja en las ladrilleras de su localidad. Su deseo a futuro es abrir un restaurante en su casa, ya que no existe ninguno en su zona.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos. 
Julia invertirá el dinero de este préstamos en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old and has two children, Joseph and Janeth, whom she cares for in the home she bought six years ago.
She is a remarkable woman; she cares for her children alone and she manages to earn sufficient money through raising pigs.  This is their only income. She has 15 main pigs whom she fattens and takes care of with a great deal of dedication.  She sells their meat to order and sometimes sells the pigs live. "Everything depends on the client", she says. She is doing very well in this business.  She has a good income which allows her to raise her children, but to bring home extra income she also works as a laborer in various fields during the harvest, and as a brick layer in the nearby area. Her wish for the future is to open a restaurant in her home, as there are none in her area.

She belongs to the solidarity group "The Entrepreneurs" and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the support they give her to meet her goals. She promises to comply with the payments of her loan and also enjoys being associated with them since they have known each other for many years.  Julia will invest the money from this loan in buying nutritionally balanced food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced food for her animals.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es: La Sra. Aleja tiene 37 años tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 9 y 15 años,  ella se dedica  a la  venta y  crianza de cerdos en la localidad de Abapo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Aleja va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de cerdos, la Sra. Aleja enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Aleja is 37 years old and has two children, ages 9 and 15. She works raising and selling pigs in the town of Abapo. This loan is her first within the institution. Aleja will use this loan to buy pigs for her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of capital to buy pigs. Aleja confronts challenges in her business, such as improving her quality of life and she is going to use the profits to improve the quality of feed for her pigs. Her wish is to be able to have a farm where she can raise a number of pigs to be able to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business

loans.name: Tilateñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TILATEÑAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ignacia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de coca, transporte público, venta de carne, tienda de pulpería, venta de comida, venta de carne de cordero, servicio de transporte público, ayudante de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ignacia es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cordero; nos cuenta que este negocio lo adquirió de sus padres desde niña, ya que este es un negocio familiar y con el pasar del tiempo ella lo trabaja sola.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cordero) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “Tilateñas" communal bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Villa Adela regional office. It is made up of nine members, led by a board of directors of which Ignacia is the chairperson. 

The businesses that the communal bank members carry on are varied, and include: sale of coca leaves, public transportation, sale of meat, grocery store, sale of food, sale of lamb meat, and construction helper.

The loan they will be taking out will benefit small business owners including Ignacia. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, becoming a member at the invitation of a field worker of the institution, who came to her house. 

Currently she has a business selling lamb. She tells us that she learned this business as a small child from her parents, as this is a family business. With the passage of time, she runs it on her own. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase working capital, through the purchase of lamb, which she buys at the markets in the city of El Alto and will later sell at her business. This livelihood allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can, since she is married and has six children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training in credit and health.

loans.use: To buy lamb.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/rbr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere / Rbr. Le nom du groupe signifie « Améliore le niveau du travail ». Il a 36 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 1 ans à 13 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.
Jean Bosco est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour renforcer son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the Twitezimbere/Rbr group. The group’s name means “Increasing the level of work.” He is 36 years old, married, and has six children ranging from one to 13 years of age. Three of his children attend school. Jean Bosco's education level is eight years of elementary school.

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

In order to expand his business, his strategy is to keep taking out other loans to strenghten his farming activity. In the  years to come, Jean Bosco would like to become an important rice producer in his region. With the profits, he plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

Eric  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. He has had this business for four years.  He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is involved in agriculture. She keeps hens, cultivates wheat, and grows apple trees. Anahit would like to renovate the old greenhouse in her orchard which is why she has applied for this loan. This will allow Anahit to grow larger variety of vegatables. Anahit will also purchase a polyethylene cover and wood to heat the green house during the winter. Besides, she plans to purchase fertilizer and medicine for the cultivation of land. This loan will help Anahit to implement these goals and earn more profit from the farm.

loans.use: to pay for wood, green house renovation, fertilizer, medicine and a polyethylene cover

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en:
Nubar lives in Uyts village with her two sons: 8-year-old Artak and 15-year-old Artyom. 

Nubar earns her income from farming and cattle breeding. She raises hens, keeps beehives, cultivates wheat, potatos, and cabbage, and grows fruit trees. 

As it's difficult for Nubar to do all the sowing process alone, she has to hire workers to it.  Nubar also plans to buy two calves and get more profit by gathering milk.  She also needs to purchase seeds for the autumn sowing. In order to implement all these plans, Nubar has applied for this loan to get necessary funds. 

Agriculture is the main source of income for Nubar.  Ongoing investments in its development are vital for her to cover her family's rising costs.

loans.use: to buy two calves, seeds, fuel, and sowing and transportation services

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is involved in retail. She rents a little booth in one of the markets in Yerevan, where she has been trading in clothing since 2010. 

Kristine has applied for this loan to add more jeans to her inventory in her booth, as demand for such clothing has increased recently. This is important for Kristine to meet her clients' demand and increase sales. 

Kristine lives with her husband, Margar, and two children: an 8-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. 

Development of the business will bring more income for Kristine and help her to cover the family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for stocks of jeans.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es: Diana de 46 años,  está muy satisfecha porque con su credikiva  compró un carro de perros  y mucha materia prima, con lo  cual preparó las mas deliciosas comidas rápidas. Ahora vende mucho más refrescos acompañados de los nuevos productos que tiene para la venta. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará cervezas y materias primas como harina, e insumos como queso y carnes, para elaborar sus productos fritos, que son lo que mayor rotación tienen, porque les gusta mucho a la clientela. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : “Mis agradecimientos por apoyarme, a través de ustedes ha crecido mi negocio. “
texts.en:
Diana, 46 years old, is very satisfied because with her "credikiva" she bought a hot dog cart and many raw materials, with which she prepared the most delicious fast food.  Now she sells a lot more soft drinks accompanied by the new products that she has to sell.  

Currently, she is applying for a new Credikiva with which she will buy beer, raw materials like flour and supplies like cheese and meat in order to make her fried products, which have the best turnover because her customers like them very much.  She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders:  “My gratitude for supporting me, through you my business has grown.”

loans.use: to buy beer, raw materials like flour and supplies like cheese and meat in order to make her fried products.

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros runs a grocery store. He started this business in 2006. During the last few years, Petros has expanded his business and now aims to purchase more food to diversify product variety in the grocery. Unable to find sufficient means, Petros has applied for this loan. 
Petros lives with his mother, wife and 2 school-aged daughters. Development of the business is important for this entrepreneur to gather more income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for food for his grocery store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 49 years old and a widow from Panglao, Bohol.  She has five children; her eldest is 28, and her youngest is 13. 

Angelina operates a sari-sari store in her neighborhood. She sells basic household items like canned goods, chips, seasonings, and toiletries. She is also into making pots for sale.

She is asking for a loan to buy in bulk such merchandise as noodles, eggs, seasonings, toiletries, soft drinks, and rice. 

She is confident that with hard work and perseverance, she can continue to support her children. 

In the future, she would like to make her store bigger and sell items that she does not now carry. Any additional income will be for her family's daily consumption, savings, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy in bulk such merchandise as noodles, eggs, seasoning, toiletries, soft drinks, and rice

loans.name: Donesia

texts.en:
Donesia is 65 years old from Cortes, Bohol. She is married, with three adult children. 

Donesia is engaged in selling wood from coconut trees. This type of wood is usually used in building houses by the residents of her place. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wood to resell to her customers. Her income will be used to pay for a healthy diet and for savings for future use.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wood to resell to her customers

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush runs a little booth at one of the markets in Yerevan where she sells women's clothing. Siranush started this business in 2007. She has gained a large number of loyal clients due to her ability to choose fashionable clothing. Now Siranush wants to add a greater variety of clothing to her booth, which is why she has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, Siranush will increase her income and save money to invest in the expansion of her booth.

loans.use: To pay for clothing to sell

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is from Talibon, Bohol. She has been selling home-cooked meals in her restaurant for two years now.  She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasonings, rice, and soft drinks. Eugenie is optimistic that with her hard work and perseverance, she can make a difference in the life of her family, especially for her parents. Her profits will pay for healthy foods for her family.  She will also use some of her profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasonings, rice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Cresencia's Group

texts.en:
Cresencia is 58 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children. 

Cresencia has a store that sells groceries and other products. She has had this business for just one year. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more items for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Cresencia hopes to expand her business. Cresencia is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married, with one child. Teresita is 33 years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Teresita buys and sells charcoal to earn a living, and she has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Teresita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married, with five children. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase  seedlings and fertilizer for corn production.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to save for additional capital for her business .

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizer for corn production

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with two children.

To earn a living, Gina has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Gina has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 37 years old and married.  She describes herself as a patient and faithful woman. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits, such as cabbages, onions, bananas, and kale. She has been involved in this business for seven years and employs one staff member. 

Her business is located within a conducive shopping market, and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of permanent business premises for carrying out her business activities. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.  

Her business goal is to run a big grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a self-dependent woman.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Wairimu

texts.en: Wairimu is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 11 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be honest and industrious. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. Her business is located at a busy market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more kale to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business by opening many more similar grocery stores within her town. This is the first loan that Wairimu has received from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy kale to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 38-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be an honest and jovial woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more beauty products. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her hair salon

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells items such as kale, onions etc. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a good business environment and her primary customers are local residents and retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her grocery stall business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more kale for resale. Her business goal is to run another grocery stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy kale for resale

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
El señor David tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Desde hace doce años se dedica a la venta de sorbetes, actividad que aprendió de un amigo. Antes él realizaba actividades de jornalero; pero los ingresos no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia. Por ese motivo, se decidió por la venta ambulante en una bicicleta de sorbetes en las escuelas, partidos de fútbol, algún otro evento y en las calles de la comunidad.

Cada ocho días le llegan a dejar a su casa la mercadería, él los mantiene en un friser, luego saca cantidades pequeñas para salir a venderlas en su bicicleta. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio y la otra parte para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda en donde vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos.  Aumentando la mercadería podrá  recibir mejores ingresos, con el objetivo de brindar seguridad y comodidad a su familia.

Lo que él desea es comprar una tricimoto, debido a que por su edad se cansa pedalear en la bicicleta.
texts.en:
David is 65 years old, married, and has five children. For 12 years he has made a living by selling sorbets, an activity that he learned from a friend. Before he was a day laborer, but his income was not sufficient for the support of his family. For that reason, he decided on the traveling sorbet business on a bicycle to schools, soccer games, other events, and on the streets of the community. 

Every eight days the merchandise is dropped off at his house. He maintains it in a freezer, and later he takes out small quantities for going out to sell it on his bicycle. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to stock his business and to make improvements to his home, where he lives with his wife and five children. By increasing his stock of merchandise, he will be able to receive better income, with the objective of providing security and comfort for his family. 

What he wants is to buy a tricycle-style motorcycle, due to the fact that his age causes him to tire while pedaling on the bicycle.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store and to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene tiene 64 años de edad casado con la Sra. Valentina se dedican a la agricultura que es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, haba, con practica de rotación de cultivos en terreno de 3 Has en la comunidad de Santa Isabel y Liriuni, en la agricultura tiene bastante experiencia en cuanto manejo de los cultivos, tratamientos fitosanitarios, cosecha y mercadeo, viven en una comunidad rural Liriuni a 50 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Don Rene necesita dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) semilla de papa, el ahorro que tenia gasto en la construcción de su casa que su sueños era tener una casa cómoda con todo los servicios básicos, Don Rene nos comenta con el préstamo seguirá sembrando para garantizar la seguridad alimentaria para su familia y ahorrar dinero para ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene is 64 years old and married to Mrs. Valentina.  They make a living in agriculture; it is the source of their economic income.  They produce potatoes and lima beans and practice crop rotation on 3 hectares of land in the community of Santa Isabel y Liriuni.  He has considerable experience in agriculture in crop management, phytosanitary (plant health) treatments, harvesting and marketing.  They live in a rural community, Liriuni, 50 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. 
 
Don Rene needs the money to buy agricultural supplies, manure (hen droppings) and potato seeds.  He spent the savings that he had on the construction of his house.  His dream was to have a comfortable house with all of the basic services.  Rene comments to us that with this loan he will continue planting in order to guarantee the food security for his family and to save money to help his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy supplies, seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Thavy, aged 36, lives in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers who have engaged in this business to make a living for ten years. Together they can earn about KHR12,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. Low prices of the crop yield is the main challenge for her business.

This is the first micro loan for Thavy’s all-female group of four members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group members to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pesticides for protecting her rice paddy. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to better her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 43 años, vive en compañía de Fernando, su esposo, tienen siete hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cinco de ellos.
Gracias a los ahorros por el trabajo de su esposo, pudo adquirir una fábrica de ladrillos. Cuenta que su familia (sus hijas y yernos) le ayudan en el negocio y por eso se siente feliz, ya que puede brindar un apoyo a su familia. “El trabajo es muy duro y se necesita de muchas personas”, afirma. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia, es por ello que siempre cuenta con pedidos de sus clientes fijos, al mes realiza 22 millares de ladrillos. Ahora, lo que desea es comprar nuevos hornos, con una mejor tecnología, pues actualmente realiza el quemado de los ladrillos de manera rústica.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su crédito número 18 con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Zenaida invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más aserrín para la realización de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 43 years old. She lives with her husband Fernando, and they have seven children. But now they only live with five of them.

Thanks to savings from her husband's work, she was able to acquire a brick-making operation. She has her family (her daughters and sons-in-law) to help her in the business; that is why she feels happy, as she is able to offer support to her family. “The work is very hard and you need a lot of people," she says. 

She already has 20 years of experience; this is why she always has orders from her established customers. She makes 22 thousand bricks a month. Now she wishes to buy new ovens with better technology, as currently she fires the bricks in the traditional country way. 

She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” communal bank, and this is her 18th loan with MFP. Therefore she is grateful for the support they give her in meeting her objectives. She promises to make her installment payments, and is also thankful to be part of her communal bank, as she has known them for many years. 

Zenaida will invest the money applied for in the purchase of more sawdust for making the bricks.

loans.use: To buy more sawdust for making bricks.

loans.name: Chipotrer Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Maria esta soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria, se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda en general, inicio este negocio vendiendo gaseosas, y lleva hasta ahora 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para la tienda que tiene: jugos, aguas gaseosas, golosinas, lácteos, embutidos, etc. Espera seguir aumentando sus ganancias. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, y atención a tienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
