Señora Isabel Maria is single. She is 23 years old. She had two years of primary education. She works in business, tending to a general store. She began this business selling soft drinks, and she has now had 6 years of experience.

She organized a group to be able to apply for a loan that she will use to purchase products for her store: juices, sparkling waters, candies, milk products, sausages, etc. She hopes to continue increasing her earnings. The other members of the group work in raising animals and tending to a store with basic products for daily use.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Nayseng's Group

texts.en:
Nayseng is 53 years old and is living in a rural area in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for thirty years, she is able to earn about KHR12,000 per day and manages to save about KHR4,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Nayseng’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and this is their first micro loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group members are requesting a loan of KHR1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres  en el Municipio del Negrito, departamento de Yoro. 
Feliciano desde niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura a través de las enseñanzas de su padre.  Desde hace 3 años se  dedica a la producción del cultivo de arroz de excelente calidad, con el apoyo de su familia (padres).
Él comercializa su cosecha en el mercado regional de manera colectivo con otros productores.
En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la preparación del terreno (arado y rastreo del suelo), mano de obra para la siembra y en la fertilización del cultivo. 
Considera que el financiamiento le asegura el buen manejo del cultivo y una producción de calidad. Él espera obtener ganancias que le permitan mantener sus gastos personales y realizar la compra de activos.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 18 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the town of Negrito in the Department of Yoro.

From the time he was a boy, Feliciano has engaged in agriculture as a result of the lessons he learned from his father. For the past three years, he has been producing rice of excellent quality with the help of his parents. He sells his harvest at the regional market as part of collective with other producers.

At the moment, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 HNL. He plans to invest in the preparation of his farmland (plowing and dredging the soil) and labor (planting and fertilizing his crops). Feliciano expects to earn a profit so that he can maintain his personal expenses and purchase more assets.

loans.use: to invest in the preparation of his farmland and pay for labor.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 39 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 20 a 25 años. Ella se dedica a la actividad comercial desde el año 2003, la cual inició con el objetivo de apoyar los gastos de su hogar para conseguir un mayor bienestar familiar. En su negocio vende calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior y entre personas de su propio barrio, que se han convertido en su  principal clientela. Sus ventas las realiza en la modalidad de crédito, ajustado a las posibilidades de su clientela y sus compras las hace de contado en almacenes  del centro de la ciudad. Ella también vende productos cosméticos, que adquiere  mediante guías especializadas y que ofrece a sus clientes, con los descuentos especiales que tanto gustan a ellos. Gloria trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo y dedica  8 horas diarias a su negocio, con el fin de generar cada vez  más ingresos;  aunque necesita ampliar el surtido que ofrece, su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara calzado, cosméticos perfumería y ropa interior; con este nuevo surtido espera expandirse a otras zonas y ampliar el número de clientes que han sido referenciados por sus fíeles compradores y que aun no les ha podido dar respuesta, en ello justamente radica el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Gloria, 39, lives in the southwest of the city with her common law husband and their three children, aged 20 to 25 years old. She has been engaged in commercial activity since the year 2003, when she began her business with the goal of helping with household expenses in order to achieve greater family well-being. 

In her business, she sells shoes, cosmetics and underwear to people in her own neighborhood who have become her main customers. She sells on credit, adjusted to her customer’s abilities and she makes her purchases in cash at stores in the business center of the city. She also sells cosmetic products that she acquires through specialized catalogs and that she offers to her clients at special discounts, which they greatly appreciate.

Gloria works every day from Monday to Sunday and spends 8 hours daily at her business, with the goal of generating more and more income. However she needs to expand her inventory and her working capital is insufficient to do so. That is why she has come for a Kiva loan, her first funding request to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy shoes, toiletries and underwear. With this new merchandise she plans to branch out to other regions and expand her customer base through referrals from her faithful buyers. She still has orders she has been unable to fill and to do so only needs her request for a Kiva loan to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, toiletries and underwear.

loans.name: Gladis Esperanza

texts.es: Gladis, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, quien cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y amigos, ya que siempre se ha esforzado por dar lo mejor de sí y salir adelante. Ella es madre soltera y vive junto a un hijo menor de edad, por quien lucha para contar con todo lo necesario para su hogar. Gladis posee una venta de fruta congelada y de paletas de sabores que ella misma elabora, así también comercializa chocobananos, los cuales son hechos de bananos bañados de chocolate, lo cual es una golosina muy típica del país. Gladis solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: frutas, bolsas plásticas, chocolate, palillos para las paletas y otros más, lo que le permitirá incrementar su venta, lo cual sería de mucho beneficio para ella porque incrementara los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: Gladis is a very hard-working and responsible woman who has good references from her neighbors and friends, since she has always strived to give the best of herself and to advance. She is a single mother and lives with a son who is a minor, for whom she struggles to have everything necessary for her household. Gladis has a business selling frozen fruit and flavored popsicles that she herself makes. She also sells chocobananos, which are made from bananas dipped in chocolate, which is a very typical candy of the country. Gladis is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of basic materials such as fruits, plastic bags, chocolate, sticks for the popsicles, and other items that will allow her to increase her sales, which will be of great benefit to her because she will increase the income for her household.

loans.use: to buy fruits, plastic bags, chocolate, and other items for her business

loans.name: Chanly's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Chanly is 49 years old and is a married mother of six children: two daughters and four sons. Three of her children are dependent on her and help the family business in their spare time. 

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 20 years and she is usually able to earn about 20,000KH--but drought has ruined her rice field and the low selling price of the smaller crop yield is the main challenge of family’s business.

This is the first micro loan for Chanly’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of Chanly and another female member who lives in the same village. Chanly, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow more rice to earn more income than the current business so that she can make a good living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mujeres De Nicaja Group

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia esta casada, tiene 28 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, inicio este negocio vendiendo ropa para niños y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo negocio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos: Suéteres, playeras, camisa, ropa para bebes, gorras, bufanda, etc. Espera en el futuro tener varias tiendas para su venta. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la venta de ropa y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Lesbia is married and is 28 years old. She did not have an opportunity to attend school, but now one of her three children is studying. She works selling new clothing. She started out selling clothing for children and now has ten years of experience. She works alongside her husband who also sells clothing. 

She organized a group in order to apply for a loan that will be used to buy products: sweaters, t-shirts, dress shirts, clothing for infants, hats, scarves, etc. She hopes in the future to have various shops from which to sell her products. The other members of the group work selling clothing and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Soeurng's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district, Soeurng is 59 years old and has one dependent son who helps with the family’s business. Soeurng is rice farmer to support the family. She has been in this business for thirty years, earning about 10,000KHR per day and can manage to save about 4,000KHR each day. The main challenge for her business is low crop yield as a result of flooding.

This is the first micro loan for Soeurng’s group with VisionFund. She is leading her group of two women to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the current business income, allowing her to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y una hija quienes se dedican a la elaboración de tamales y venden de forma ambulante, juntos  trabajan  arduamente para  vivir mejor. Luis es joyero y se dedica a la elaboración de cadenas, pulseras, aritos y otros más, así mismo para obtener mayor capital de trabajo compra oro, su negocios está ubicado estratégicamente en el centro del pueblo en que reside por lo que  muchas personas lo conocen por ser responsable y confiable. Luis solicita un préstamo con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de mayor cantidad de oro en diferentes quilatajes y de esta forma incrementar la variedad en estilos y precios de las joyas que comercializa, lo cual le permitirá incrementar su mercado. El mayor deseo de Luis es poder aumentar sus ventas y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en: Luis is 62 years old. He lives with his wife and a daughter, who prepare tamales and sell them as walking vendors. They work hard together in order to live better. Luis is a jeweler and makes chains, bracelets, earrings, and other items.  Thus he buys gold to obtain more working capital. His business is located strategically in the center of the town where he lives, and for this reason many people know him to be responsible and trustworthy. Luis is applying for a loan with the desire to have the necessary money to buy a larger quantity of gold of different carats, and in this way he can increase the variety of styles and prices of the jewelry that he sells, which will allow him to increase his market. Luis greatest desire is to be able to increase his sales and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy gold as a basic material for his business.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca  de 61 años de edad,  vive junto a tres nietos  menores de edad, quienes dependen por completo del trabajo de Blanca. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual ha luchado mucho por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus nietos, desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se ha dedicado a trabajar haciendo tortillas, su negocio es muy rentable, en el cual se puede generar muy buenas ganancias. Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de masa para elaborar más tortillas, así mismo desea poder comprar varios cilindros de gas propano con el fin de poder contar con una reservar de estos, lo cual le permita ahorrar un poco de dinero, y así mismo invertir en su tienda. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Blanca ya que a través del crédito solicitado a INTEGRAL ella espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Blanca is 61 years old and lives with her three young grandchildren who completely depend on her. She is a very hard-working woman who has fought hard to provide everything her grandchildren need. For many years she has made a living making tortillas, and her business is very lucrative, generating very good profits. Blanca is requesting the loan so she can purchase a large quantity of dough to make more tortillas, and she also wants to buy some propane cylinders so she can have a reserve of them, which will save her money. Blanca is filled with excitement because with this loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn and propane gas to improve her business.

loans.name: Channin's Group

texts.en:
Channin is 45 years old and lives in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To make a living, she has been in rice farming for eighteen years and supplements her family’s income through raising pigs. The current business earns her approximately 18,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. The main challenge for her business is drought has ruined her crop yield.

Channin’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. This is the first loan for her group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Channin, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pig feed. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business income--allowing her to expand her current business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is a 27 year old married man with a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself to be faithful man. Humphrey operates a retail store where he sells items such as water, juice, margarine, flour, sugar, salt, tea leaves, soao, maize flour, rice, etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and is helped by his wife. In addition to the retail store, Humphrey also farms.

His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of sugar. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more household items for resale in his store. His business goal is to run a big retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell in his store

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de 30 años de edad, es una persona que trabaja desde muy joven, vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja como ama de hogar y dos hijos menores de edad. Manuel posee un pick up en el cual comercializa frutas y verduras de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias, cuenta con varios clientes fijos, por lo que desea mejorar en gran forma su negocio solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas, verduras y de esta forma brindarles el mejor servicio a sus clientes, quienes en muchas ocasiones le hacen pedidos a Manuel los cuales desea cumplir. Gracias a esto Manuel espera mejorar sus ganancias y así salir adelante.
texts.en: Manuel is 30 years old and has worked since he was very young. He lives with his spouse, who is a housewife, and their two young children. Manuel has a pick-up truck he uses to sell fruits in vegetables in different villages. He has a number of fixed customers, but wants to improve on a larger scale. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral so he can have the necessary money to purchase a larger quantity of fruit and vegetables and in this way provide a better service to his customers, who on many occasions places orders through Manuel that he wishes to fulfill. Thanks to this loan, Manuel hopes to increase his profits and keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. María posee una panadería, la cual desde hace varios años funciona en su casa, su esposo le ayuda a elaborar el pan, que posteriormente sale a repartir a todos sus clientes, quienes tienen negocios como tiendas, en donde obtiene pedidos muy grandes. El deseo de María es crecer aún más en el negocio, de manera que pueda atender mayor cantidad de clientes, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor, levadura y todos los productos que se utilizan para la elaboración del pan, en cantidades grandes para obtenerla a menores precios. Esto sería de mucho beneficio tanto para su negocio como para su familia quien depende absolutamente de la panadería, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen, razón por la cual se esfuerza día con día para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria Elena lives with her husband and two minor children, who are in school. Maria has a bakery, which she has operated in her house for a number of years. Her husband helps her make bread, which he later goes out to deliver to all their customers, who have businesses such as stores, from which they obtain very large orders. Maria's desire is to grow even more in her business, in such as way that she can serve a larger number of customers. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan with which she can buy flour wholesale, along with leavening and all the products that are used to make bread in large quantities so that she can obtain them at better prices. This will be of great benefit to her business as much as for her family, who depend absolutely on the bakery, since it is the only source of income that they possess. This is the reason why she strives day after day to offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en:
Orginally from the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Sochea is a 33 year-old married mother of six children, four daughters and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been involved in farming rice for ten years. She can earn about 15,000KHR per day from the current business. Low earnings due to poor crop yield continues to be the main challenge for her business.

This is the first loan for Sochea's group of two with VisionFund. She and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides to protect her rice paddy and use a portion of it to pay for labors. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and yield more crops. The additional income will allow her to run a new business and keep the children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice paddy

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chuisacaxacol Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina Francisca está casada, tiene 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos 1 de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la agropecuaria a la crianza de animales domésticos, inicio este negocio con la crianza de pollos, lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta el  apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la confección de prendas.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cerdos y así poder tener una buena recuperación de capital cuando venda los cerdos,  espera tener una granja grande, las demás integrantes se dedica al mismo oficio la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en: Paulina Francisca is married and 59 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has eight children, one of whom is still in school. Paulina makes a living raising domestic animals. She started the business raising chickens and has six years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband, a dressmaker. She organizes the group and is requesting a loan, which she plans to use to purchase pigs. She plans to have a good return on her investment when she resells them and hopes to have a big farm. The other members make a living in the same trade of raising domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: José Atiliano

texts.es: José  es una persona muy joven y responsable, quien trabaja muy duro por darle lo mejor a su esposa y su pequeña hija de tres años de edad, quien es la principal razón de salir adelante y esforzarse cada día más. José se dedica a la venta de leña la cual comercializa por mayor y por menor, este  negocio lo heredó de su padre trabajando en el desde que era muy pequeño por lo que conoce muy bien su mercado facilitando más el trabajo, razón también por la que desea mejor el negocio y obtener nuevos clientes. José solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la intención de poder comprar más leña y de esta forma atender a más personas y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Jose is a responsible young man who works very hard to provide the best for his wife and three-year-old daughter. His daughter is the main reason he keeps moving forward and strives each day to succeed. Jose works selling firewood both wholesale and retail, a business he inherited from his father after working for him ever since he was very young. He therefore knows the market very well, which helps facilitate business and is another reason he wishes to expand and obtain new customers. Jose is seeking a loan through INTEGRAL, with the intention of using it to buy more firewood so he can better serve his customers and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Kimnay's Group

texts.en:
Kimnay is a 53-year-old widowed mother of five children living in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. Of her five children, she still has three daughters to take care of. To support her family, Kimnay has been farming rice and raising pigs for thirty years. The current business earns her about KHR20,000 per day. Lower income due to poor crop yield continues to be the main challenge for her business.

Kimnay’s group consists of three members and she is the leader of this group. She is a return-borrower while the other two members are new borrowers with VisionFund. Kimnay will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pig raising business. She hopes to grow her current business to earn more income, improving her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Irma Angélica

texts.es: Irma se destaca por ser muy trabajadora, ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Irma trabaja comercializando ropa deportiva y casual para hombres y mujeres, las cuales vende de forma ambulante por diferentes zonas del país, así mismo comercializa productos de temporada como sombrillas, chumpas y suéteres, con lo que logra brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar . Irma solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más ropa como blusas y calzonetas las cuales por los lugares que transita tienen más demanda. Irma invierte largas horas a realizar su trabajo por lo que desea contar con más productos para incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma stands out as being very hardworking. She lives together with her husband and three younger children who are in school. Irma works selling sports and casual clothing for men and women. She sells them as a mobile vendor throughout different areas of the country. In the same way, she sells seasonal products like umbrellas, jackets, and sweaters. With this, she is able to give her husband the necessary help with all the household expenses. 

Irma is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, through which she can have the necessary money to invest in the purchase of more clothing - like blouses and swimsuits – which are in greater demand in the areas where she travels. Irma spends many hours carrying out her work, with which she hopes to have more products to increase her sales, and in this way give a better life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 12 años de edad quien se dedica a estudiar, y  por quien Ana se esfuerza día con día por dar lo mejor de sí. Ana posee una venta de tortillas, las cuales están hechas a base de maíz, su negocio está ubicado en su casa, en donde las personas llegan a comprarlas. Desde hace varios años que ella trabaja elaborando este alimento el cual es muy necesario en la dieta de las personas salvadoreñas, ya que se comen a diario hasta dos o tres veces al día, por lo que este es un negocio bastante estable. Ana  desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, debido a que las ganancias generadas de este, le permiten brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija, quien es la razón principal para querer mejorar y poder brindarle lo mejor. Es por esto que Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor y de esta manera atender a más personas y así  obtener más ganancias las cuales beneficien a su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and her 12 year old daughter, who is in school, and for whom Ana tries hard day after day to give more than she had herself. Ana has a business selling tortillas, which are made with corn. Her business is located in her house, where people come to buy them. She has worked for many years producing this food, which is a staple in the diet of the El Salvadoran people. They eat them every day up to two or three times a day, so this is a very stable business. 

Ana hopes very much to give her daughter everything that she needs; she is the main reason that Ana wants to improve and be able to offer her the best. For this reason, Ana is requesting a loan, through which she will have the necessary money to purchase corn in bulk. In this way, she can serve more people and therefore obtain more earnings to benefit her household.

loans.use: to purchase corn for producing tortillas and selling them.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun, 61, is from a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three children; two daughters and one son, and all are dependent on her and still in school. To feed the family, she and her husband work as rice farmers and supplement the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 10,000 KHR per day. Drought is the main challenge for her business. 

Sokun’s group consists of two members who live in the same village; this is the first micro loan for her group with VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and spend on labor costs. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from five to 10 years. He describes himself to be social man. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy environment and his primary customers are daily customers from environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for his family's household activities. His business goal is to run a boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. Amos also does farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district, Kea is 40 years old and married with seven children who have their own employment to make their living. To feed her big family, she and her husband farm rice and also plant cassava as the main source of the family's income; they have been in this business for twenty-two years. Together, they can earn about US $6 per day from the current business and can save about US $2 each day after expenses.

Kea has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve financial burden and sustain the main business. Now, she is applying for another loan of US $1,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for rice field and cassava plantation and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to gain more yields and increase her family's income to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice field and cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a single woman. She has two children who are 12 and 17 years old. She describes herself to be an honest and diligent woman. She operates a retail business where she sells wooden utensils such as serving and cooking spoons. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a densely populated estate, and her primary customers are its residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more wooden utensils to resell. Her business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of wooden utensils  within five years. In addition, Annah runs a rental estate where she provides accommodation to tenants.

loans.use: to buy more wooden utensils.

loans.name: Sreynat

texts.en:
Aged 32 years, Sreynat is married and lives with her husband and two sons in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. Both of her sons are dependent and are now attending school in the local area. She earns a living as a tailor; she has been in this business for twelve years while her husband is a rice farmer. He also runs a motor rickshaw during his spare time to gain additional income for the family. Together, they can earn about US $11 per day and afford to save about US $4 each day after deducting expenses. 

Sreynat has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and she successfully repaid the loans. She used the loans from VisionFund to improve her livelihood and improve her house. Given her husband's motor rickshaw is a bit old and out of date, she is requesting another loan of US $1,000 with VisionFund to buy a new motor rickshaw for her husband's business. This loan will enable her husband to have a new motor rickshaw to run and serve more people better. She hopes to increase her family's income to keep her sons in school to study furtfher.

loans.use: To buy a new motor rickshaw.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in a village of the Bati district of Takeo province, San is single and earns a living as a rice farmer on a 1.3 hectare area of farmland. She has been engaged in this business for 21 years earning about US $6 per day from the current business and can afford to save about US $4 each day after expenses. 

This is the first loan for San with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of US $600 with VisionFund to buy some materials such as cement, sand, and brick, etc. for house improvement and will use a portion of it on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy some materials for house improvement.

loans.name: Saroeut's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the village of the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province, Saroeut is 28 years old and married with only one daughter. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as paid workers in the local area for several years. The current work earns her family about 10,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about KHR 5,000 each day after the family's expenses. 

This is the first micro loan for Saroeut's group with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she is leading the other three members in her group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. She will use her portion to buy some materials to build a latrine for her family. This loan will enable her family to have a decent, clean latrine for consumption to improve living environment and have good health.

loans.use: To buy some materials to build a latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives in Artashat with her parents and sister. Her parents are both doctors. In 2008, the family founded a pharmacy, which is currently managed by Anzhela. 

She would like to purchase more medicines and expand the pharmacy. This loan will help Anzhela to implement this goal and to develop the business. Anzhela hopes to earn more income which is important for her to support her family to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Chekmach's Group

texts.en:
Chekmach is a 32-year-old mother of three children living in a rural area of the Dambe district, Cambodia. All of her children are still studying in the local area. She and her husband are peasants who have been planting cassava as their main business for twelve years. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR per day and they can save about 7,000 KHR each day after expenses. The main challenge for her family's business is the decrease of cassava's price, which has affected her family's income. 

This is the first micro loan for Checkmach's group of three members who are all female. As the leader, she and the other two members are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow her cassava business and earn more income to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik lives in Katnaghbyur village with her husband. They are involved in agriculture: they keep cows, pigs, turkeys, sheep and hens, as well as cultivating barley and growing apple trees. 

In order to increase the number of cattle, Sofik has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, she plans to purchase two cows as well as grass to feed them. This loan is important for Sofik so she can earn more income and improve her household's conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cows and grass to feed them

loans.name: Sovan's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in Kampong Cham province's Dambe district, Sovan, aged 40, earns a living as a rice farmer. She supplements her family's income by planting cassava to gain extra income to better feed and support her children, who are all in school in the local area. She has been in this business for twenty years earning about 16,400 KHR per day from the current business and managing to save about 9,000 KHR for future needs.

Sovan has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already while the other members are just beginning with VisionFund this loan cycle. As the leader, she and her group of four are applying for a loan after her successful previous loan repayment. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop business to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en: Burastan lives in Ashotavan village with her husband, Armen, and 24-year-old son, Arman. The family gathers main income from farming; they cultivate potatoes, beans, and grow fruit trees. In addition to farming, Burastan also would like to get involved in cattle breeding. She has applied for this loan to purchase three oxen. Such expansion will significantly increase profit from agriculture, which Burastan plans to use for purchasing more cattle in the future.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 40-year-old married woman who has two children aged 10 and 15. She describes herself as an optimistic woman. Salome operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a potential business estate and her primary customers are employees from nearby institutions and residents from estates. 

Salome describes her biggest business challenge as being the lack of sufficient capital for improving her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant. Salome's business goal is to attract more customers. She hopes that in the future, she will build permanent premises for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en: Wilfrida is a 49-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a patient and polite woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as snacks, bread, sugar, salt, and sodas, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase two bags of sugar, five crates of soda, and five bundles of maize flour. Her business goal is to run a mini shopping mall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a financially stable woman. She has previously received a loan of KES 20,000, which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of sugar, five crates of soda, and five bundles of maize flour.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman who has three children with ages ranging from six to 12. She describes herself as an assertive woman. Dorothy has operated a grocery stall where she sells onions, tomatoes, kale, etc. for the past six years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are residents from the immediate surroundings. 

Dorothy describes her biggest business challenge as being high transportation costs when purchasing vegetables from external sources. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to operate an additional grocery stall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 28-year-old married woman who has two children aged two and seven. She describes herself as a determined woman. Susan has operated a food market stall where she sells bananas for the past three years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. 

Susan describes her biggest business challenge as being stiff competition within the market. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bananas to sell. Her business goal is to venture into a new retail shop business within five years. Susan hopes that, in the future, she will be a successful business person.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband, Manvel, she raises cows, pigs, hens, cultivates wheat, potato, and garlic. Ruzanna plans to purchase two more cows and gather more milk. She also wants to purchase thread to collect the wheat harvest, diesel for the tractor, and to renovate it. In order to cover costs for these plans, Ruzanna has applied for this loan. Ruzanna lives with her husband and two sons: 17-year old Marzpetuni and 14-year-old Manuk. Development of the agriculture business will provide a stable income for Ruzanna and her family and allow her to make savings for her sons' education.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, thread, diesel and the renovation of a tractor.

loans.name: Mary Wangeci

texts.en: Mary is a 44-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells cereal such as maize, black beans, and beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for over 20 years. Her business is located within a competitive area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of cereals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy cereal for resale. Her business goal is to run a big cereal retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her retail stall.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Petik

texts.en: Petik lives in Mrgavan village with his wife, Ashkhen. The couple is involved in agriculture: they keep cows, pigs, hens, cultivate corn, tomato, as well as grow apricot trees and keep a grape orchard. Petik plans to purchase more chickens, which will allow him to raise them and keep more hens, as well as get income from their sales. With the requested amount Petik will purchase 1,000 chickens. Petik hopes to earn more income and invest in the further development of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for chickens.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old married woman who has three children with ages ranging from six to 13. She describes herself as a visionary and diligent woman. Jane has operated a retail business where she sells banana leaves for the past six years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge as being stiff competition in the market. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy banana leaves, fruits and vegetables so she can start a new grocery store business. Jane's business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be an inspirational businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy banana leaves, vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 38-year-old trader who sells cosmetics at Teshie. She is a single parent whose daughter is seven years old. She sells cosmetics to take care of her child. She buys her items from Accra and sells in Teshie. Cynthia has been doing this work for 10 years but still operates from a table top.

She hopes to have her own cosmetics shop after taking out loans up to a certain level with ID-Ghana. This is Cynthia's fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she has promptly repaid her previous loans. She previously took out a loan of 300 GHS and finished repaying it on 29/06/2012. Cynthia needs this new loan of 500 GHS to expand her business by buying more cosmetics products to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Zeddy is a 35-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from two to seven years. She describes herself to be a risk-taking woman. She operates a tailoring retail store where she provides clothes repair services and sells dresses she makes. She has been involved in this business for seven years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the tailoring shop. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to open more tailoring retail stores within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business by opening a retail shop. Zeddy managed to repay her loan amount of KES 15,000 that she had received from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Olega

texts.en:
Olega is a 37-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing cabbages, green beans and cucumbers to earn a living. 

Olega has requested a loan to buy bush knives, fertilizers, weed killer and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Olega will spend her profits to help support her children's education and on improvements for her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, fertilizers, weed killer and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en:
Loleta is 37 years old and is married with six children. She owns and operates a sewing business venture. Loleta has 23 years of experience in this line of business. 

Loleta joined SPBD in 2011. She needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, rolls of material, packets of needles, and cartons of thread. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business, to help support her children's education and also for family matters.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, rolls of material, packets of needles, and cartons of thread.

loans.name: Ologalei

texts.en:
Ologalei is a 42-year-old woman who is single with no children. She runs a business selling goods like sugar, salt, canned foods, snacks, washing soap, chicken quarter legs, mutton flaps, and flour in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Ologalei has requested a loan to buy more products like cartons of chicken quarter legs, cartons of mutton flaps, cartons of canned fish, cartons of corned beef, soap, and packets of snacks. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to help support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy chicken quarter legs, mutton flaps, canned fish, corned beef, soap, and snacks.

loans.name: Eseneiaso

texts.en:
Eseneiaso is a 44-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taros and bananas to earn a living. 

Eseneiaso has requested a loan to help her purchase tools, fertilizers, etc. She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Eseneiaso will spend her profits to support her children going to school and also to carry out home improvements.

loans.use: to buy tools, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nila es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración y venta de mantas, tejido de chompas, costura de pantalones, venta de verduras, elaboración de mantas de alpaca, tienda de barrio, hilado y venta de lana de vicuña.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nila es una integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de hilado y venta de lana de vicuña; nos cuenta que este negocio lo adquirió cuando se encontraba sin trabajo, pero sabía la elaboración de hilo de vicuña, desde esa fecha ella trabaja en ese negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de las provincias y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Angeles" [The Angels] is going to start its second round in Pro Mujer, as part of the regional hub of Villa Adela. It has eight members and it's run by a board where Nila is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them there are: making and selling blankets, weaving sweaters, pants sewing, selling vegetables, making alpaca blankets, grocery stores, sale and yarn of vicuna wool.

The loan that are requesting will benefit small micro businesses where Nila is a member. She says that she entered Pro Mujer six months ago, entering by invitation of a promoter of the institution who went to her home. She currently runs a business that yarns and sells vicuna wool. She states that she purchased this business when she was unemployed, because she knew to elaborate vicuna yarn. From that date, she works in the business.

The loan she will receive is to increase working capital (to buy vicuna wool). She buys it in fairs in the provinces and then she sells it in her stall. This way to work allows her to generate resources to support her family in whatever she can, because she cohabits and has two children. When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy vicuna wool.

loans.name: Laamauga

texts.en:
Laamauga is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has had two years of experience with this business. 

Laamauga needs a loan to buy new fishing nets for her operation. She plans to use her profits to support her children going to school and to help meet her family's needs. Laamauga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Tuafale

texts.en:
Tuafale is 40 years old and is single with four children. She has been running a small business selling pork buns in her community for the past two years. 

Tuafale has requested a loan to to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuafale will make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 48-year-old married woman with 11 children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Makerita needs a loan to buy new fishing nets for her operation. She plans to use her profits to support her children going to school and to help pay for her family's needs. Makerita has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Soo

texts.en:
Soo is 38 years old and is single with no children. She plans to start a business selling flour, sugar, canned fish, snacks, mutton flaps, chicken legs, bath soaps, detergent powder, etc. 

Soo has been a member of SPBD since 2012. She has requested a loan to buy corned beef, herrings, soaps, salt, noodles, etc. Soo will use her profits to help with her family's needs and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy corned beef, herrings, soaps, salt, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lipena

texts.en:
Lipena is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She has three years of experience making and selling pancakes in her community to earn a living. 

Lipena has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She needs a loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, a big new frying pan, and a cooking oven. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to help support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, a big new frying pan, and a cooking oven.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbages, green beans, and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sera has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, hoses, and vegetable seeds. With her profits, she hopes to support her children's education and her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, hoses, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Tiare

texts.en:
Tiare is a 37-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tiare needs a loan to buy sugar, cordials, a carton of flavors, foam cups and a small freezer. She plans to use her profits to help support her children's education and to improve her business. Tiare has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cordials, flavors, foam cups and a small freezer.

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima is a 39-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has four years of experience in her small DJ system business. 

Iemaima needs a loan to buy speakers, a set of CDs, a new amplifier system, and a set of system wiring. She will use her profits to improve her business and to help support her children's education. Iemaima joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy speakers, a set of CDs, a new amplifier system, and a set of system wiring.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabella is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from three to 18 years. She describes herself to be a risk-taker. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens, both layers and broilers. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her poultry business. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy layer and broiler chickens to resell. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer. Isabella also does farming from which she increases her income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en: Varditer lives in Kapan town with her husband, two sons and daughter. Varditer keeps pigs, hens, and colonies of bees. In order to expand the farm, Varditer wants to add more livestock. With the requested amount, she will purchase two mother-pigs and seven bee colonies. This will allow Varditer to make and sell more agricultural products and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and bee colonies.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a 34-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from two to 18 years. She describes herself to be a disciplined and faithful woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as potatoes and peas, etc. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are local residents and the general public passing by the road. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for restocking the grocery store. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy vegetables for resale. Her business goal is to diversify her business by opening a new retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve both businesses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a 38-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from four to 14 years. He describes himself to be a loving and caring man. He operates a farm where he sells items such as kale, paw paw, maize, mangoes, and tomatoes, etc. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a very productive land and his primary customers are the local and international market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for restocking the grocery store. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the last installment on his land; he has been saving on his profits so as to expand his farming business. His business goal is to diversify his business by running a fruit processing plant for selling final products rather than exporting them within five years. Dominic is a priest. Previously, he was self employed.

loans.use: to pay for the last installment on his land.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza runs a shop where she trades flowers, gifts, wedding dresses, and accessories. Tereza started this business in 2010. Due to good service, Tereza has gained her customers love and support and significantly expanded the business. Now Tereza wants to add more variety of goods to her shop. With the requested amount, she will purchase flowers, gifts, and wedding dresses. This will help Tereza attract more clients and stay competitive in the market.

loans.use: to pay for flowers, gifts, and wedding dresses.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine lives in Goris town with her husband, six-year-old daughter, and pensioner mother-in-law. Armine and her husband run a farm where they raise cows, keep 50 beehives, and cultivate potatoes and beans. Armine has applied for this loan to purchase two more cows. This will allow her to increase profit from cattle breeding and invest for purchasing more livestock.

loans.use: to pay for two cows.

loans.name: Hilda Margarita

texts.es: Hilda de 55 años de edad es una señora muy trabajadora y esforzada, la cual desea mucho salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos  quienes  le ayudan con el negocio. Hilda  posee una venta de desayunos y almuerzos, negocio en el que le va bien debido a que está rodeada de talleres y colegios, sus hijos le ayudan a repartir la comida cuando no están en la escuela. Hilda posee muy buena clientela, ya que tiene muchos años de ganarse la vida de la misma forma por lo que es muy conocida. Ella solicita un préstamo a ITEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, queso, carnes, embutidos, bebidas  y otros más. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Hilda, 55, is a very hard-working, strong woman who wants to get ahead and lead a better life, with her husband and two children who help in her business.  Hilda serves breakfasts and lunches, and business is doing well because she is surrounded by workshops and schools.  Her children help deliver her food when they are not in school.

Hilda has a good customer base because she has been earning her living this way for many years and is well-known.  She is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy ingredients such as corn, beans, cheese, meat, sausage, beverages and other items.  This is so she can increase sales and lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy beans, cheese, meat and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 35 años, su esposa es René, con quien tiene tres hijos. La cas donde viven es alquilada, desde hace 2 años.
A él le gusta mucho sembrar, sobre todo por las cosas nuevas que aprende de un ingeniero agrónomo; “es mi vecino y vende fertilizantes naturales, nos enseña a mejorar nuestros cultivos para tener productos orgánicos, naturales”, comenta. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, sus terrenos son propios y sus principales siembras son papa, maíz, habas y zanahoria, pero como le alcanza el espacio, tiene que alquilar otras tierras. Cada cosecha la comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, pero en ocasiones, lo hace desde su misma chacra, “todo depende el precio de compra”, afirma. Ahora desea volver a alquilar el espacio que tenía en el mercado de la ciudad, pues de esa manera obtendrá más ganancias. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le permite mejorar su negocio, además de aprender a ahorrar en su grupo, donde los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.  
Mario invertirá este dinero en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus siembras de papa y habas.
texts.en:
Mario, 35, and his wife René have three children.  They live in a rented house where they have been for two years.  He enjoys crop farming, especially when learning new things as an agronomy engineer.  "A neighbor of mine sells natural fertilizer and he teaches us how to improve our crops with natural, organic products.", he says.  He has been in agriculture for ten years and owns the land he farms on.  His main crops are potatoes, corn, lima beans and carrots, but since he has run out of space he must rent more land.  At harvest time he sells his produce at the wholesale market in the city, but sometimes he sells back on his land, "It all depends on the purchase price.", he says.  Now he wants to rent the space he had at the market in the city, to earn more money.

This is his second loan through MFP and he is grateful for the economic support that allows him to improve business.  Also, he is learning to save in his communal bank, where the members are responsible and supportive.

Mario will invest the money in several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on his potato and lima bean crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of natural fertilizer for his potato and lima bean crops.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 34 años, está casada con Isau, con quien tiene tres 3 hijos, a los que cuida en la que heredó de sus padres, hace 13 años.
Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la crianza de ganado vacuno y vende la leche que producen. Su trabajo diario comienza en horas de la madrugada, cuando comienza a alimentar a sus animales, limpiar su establo, ordeñar y todo el día darles cuidados especiales porque de eso dependen sus ganancias. Otro de los trabajos de Miriam, es la agricultura, posee terrenos de cultivo donde siembra  papa y maíz.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San santiago” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Está agradecida por la oportunidad de préstamo, pues podrá invertir en su negocio. Por ese motivo promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Miriam invertirá este dinero en la compra de un toro para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Miriam, 34, is married to Isau and they have three children, whom they care for in the house she inherited from her parents 13 years ago.  For 15 years she has been in the cattle raising business and sells the milk she produces.  Her work begins in the early morning hours when she begins feeding the livestock, cleaning the stable, milking the cows and spending the entire day giving them the special care they need in order to earn a profit.  Miriam also is a crop farmer and has land where she grows potatoes and corn.

She belongs to the communal bank "San Santiago" and this is her second loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the loan which she will invest in her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She will use it to buy a bull to increase her livestock.

loans.use: To buy a bull to increase her livestock.

loans.name: Baddy

texts.es:
Baddy tiene 26 años, vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanas.
Su principal ingreso económico es por el bordado de chalecos. Gracias a este arte que le enseñaron sus padres tiene muchos pedidos, pues ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en este negocio. “Tengo que aprovechar al máximo todos los pedidos que me hacen, ya que las ganancias son buenas”, comenta. Paralelo a ellos, trabaja como albañil, ahora tiene que techar y remodelar una escuela de la ciudad. Los planes de Baddy son mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a sus hermanas, a las que quiere pagar sus estudios de la universidad. 

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Mollecito” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio.
Baddy invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas, al por mayor, para los bordados y tablas de madera para la obra en construcción que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Baddy, 26, lives with his parents and two siblings.  His main source of income is making embroidered vests.  Thanks to this craft, that he learned from his parents, he has many orders.  He has been in business for three years.  "I must take full advantage of the orders that are placed, because profits are good.", he says.  In addition to this job he works as a bricklayer, and now is renovating and putting a roof on the city school.  Baddy's plan is to improve his income to help his sisters and pay for their university education.

He belongs to the communal bank "Mollecito" and this is his first loan through MFP, where he is happy to receive this financial support which makes him feel more secure in being able to advance in his business.

Baddy will use the money to buy fabric wholesale for his embroidery, as well as boards for the construction project that is still pending.

loans.use: To buy fabric wholesale for embroidery, and boards for the construction project that is still pending.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 49 años, su esposo hace 23 años es Armando, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con una de ellas, Karina. Su casa es propia, la compraron hace 30 años.
Su principal actividad económica es la confección de mandiles regionales para mujeres, por este negocio viaja a diferentes ciudades para vender las prendas por unidad, ya que de esa manera puede obtener mayores ganancias; pero cuando hay festividades recibe pedidos al por mayor. También se dedica a la venta de menestras en el mercado mayorista. Por su parte, su esposo trabaja en el trasporte público con un ómnibus que adquirió gracias a su esfuerzo, con el cual traslada a los pobladores desde su localidad hasta la ciudad principal. Además de ello, sus hijos mayores le mandan una mensualidad, y ella disfruta de verlos independientes y progresando.

Su grupo se llama “Mollecito” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy contenta de saber que cuanta con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por lo que promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Antonia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para realizar los mandiles. 	¿Qué es lo que comprará con este dinero?
texts.en:
Antonia, 49, has been married to Armando for 23 years and they have four children, although only Karina still lives with them.  They bought their house 30 years ago.

Her main source of income is making regional aprons for women.  In her business she travels to different cities to sell her products because she can earn a higher profit this way.  Around holidays she receives more wholesale orders.  She also sells vegetables to the wholesale market.  Her husband works in public transportation with a van he bought with his salary.  She likes the fact that they are independent and progressing.

Her communal bank is called "Mollecito" and this is her tenth loan through MFP, so she is very content knowing she can count on financial support to help her get ahead in business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Antonia will use to money to buy materials for her aprons.

loans.use: To buy material to make aprons.

loans.name: Gataiala

texts.en:
Gataiala is a 34-year-old married woman with 1 child.  She would like to start growing taro and taamu to earn a living. Gataiala has requested a loan to start a new plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Gataiala will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grass cutter, knives and weed killers

loans.name: Vinnie

texts.en:
Vinnie is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Vinnie needs a loan to buy farming tools to extend her business. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Vinnie will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy knives, wheelbarrow and grass cutter

loans.name: Male

texts.en:
Male is a 26-year-old married woman with 2 children. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. Male has requested a loan to start a new plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Male will spend her profits to buy more farming needs.

loans.use: to buy grass cutter, knives, weed killers and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Sugema

texts.en:
Sugema is a 50-year-old married woman with 8 children. She would like to start growing taro plants to earn a living. Sugema has requested a loan to start her plantation. 

She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Sugema will spend her profits to purchase more farming needs.

loans.use: to buy knives, wheelbarrow and grass cutter

loans.name: Fitu

texts.en: Fitu is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She would like to start a small business sewing items like lavalava (a traditional cloth worn as a skirt by men and women) and selling them in her community. In order to do this, Fitu needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine, roll of material and packets of needles to start her business. She hopes to use her profits to save in her account for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, roll of material and packets of needles

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 27-year-old married man and the father of two children. 

He works in the construction business and has specialized in cement work since 2000. He was only 15 years old when he started doing this kind of work, whereas he was even younger when he used to work in car body repair to help his family make their living.

Just like every Palestinian living in Lebanon, they don't have a lot of working choices especially inside the camp, so in order to improve his family's living conditions, Rabih started working in repairing car bodies from home in a small place next to his house. To improve this job, Rabih applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary machines and tools required for this business. 

He is working hard to provide his children and family with the best education and living conditions possible. He hopes to open his own car repair shop to expand his work place and increase his income.

loans.use: To start a new business, in order to buy the necessary machines and tools required for this business.

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en:
Samet is 33 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on her as they are still in school. She and her husband provide for their family from the one hectare of farmland, planting cassava, and one hectare and a half area growing paddy. She has been in this business for fifteen years. 

Samet is a third loan cycle client with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has managed her past loans with success in obtaining better living conditions, especially daily decent food for her family. Now, she is forming a group of two members to apply for a new loan. She and her member are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for a tractor’s leasing fee (plowing fee). She hopes to receive better yields so as to earn more income in order to maintain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a tractor’s leasing fee (plowing fee).

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Kalala needs a loan to buy more tools and chemicals to expand her plantation. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Kalala will use the profits from her sales to pay her kids' school fees.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knives, a bush cutter and chemicals.

loans.name: Mavaega

texts.en: Mavaega is a 54-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a business selling foods in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Mavaega has requested a loan to purchase more goods to expand her business. She plans to save her profits in her account for her business needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, flour, salt, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Yoeurn is a mother of four children: two sons who are helping with the family's business, while the remaining two are working for others for a fee. To strive for a living, she has been planting paddy rice on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income. Her husband helps to earn additional income via producing sugar palm for sale. Having been with this business for 26 years, she is able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day in average.  The main challenges which lower her yields are the drought, insects, and the declining price of rice. 

To tackle these challenges, she is forming a group of two female members to seek a new loan. For this cycle, she is the fifth loan cycle and her member is the third loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. The past loans, which she has completely repaid back, have helped her manage her standard of living and helped her husband’s business (buying a high ladder for climbing palm trees and the containers for storing palm juice). 

Now, both of them are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR. Yoeurn, as the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She expects to grow her crop timely so as to earn more income in order to save some money to build a new decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is 32 years old and a widow mother of one child living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To provide the daily basic needs of her family as the single mother, she makes income from one hectare of cassava planting farmland. Besides this main source of income, she also raises pigs additionally. She has been with these businesses for 10 years. 

San's group consists of two female members. Both of them are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva partner) and are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan's portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice crop, while a portion of it will be used to buy pig feed. She hopes that the price of pigs and cassava will soon be increased so she can generate more income so as to attain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice crop, and to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 78-year-old woman who is widowed with 12 children. She runs a business selling foods in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Malia has requested a loan to purchase more goods to expand her shop. She plans to use her profits to pay her kids' fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy snacks, corned beef, chicken legs, sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Moerng's Group

texts.en:
Moerng is a citizen from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. There are three members in his family, including his one daughter. To sustain his household, he and his wife work on one hectare of cassava field and are able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. Moerng took his first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and has paid back the entire loan with success. The past loan has helped him to relieve his burden and improve his family's livelihood. 

Now, he leads a group of two to seek a new loan. The other member is female and a first loan cycle borrower. Both of them are seeking 500,000 KHR each. For Moerng, he will use his portion to pay for weeding fees for his cassava field. Moreover, he will use a portion of it to buy piglets for raising as extra income. He hopes to make more income from his current business so as to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for weeding fees for his cassava field and to buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Leiu

texts.en: Leiu is a 56-year-old married woman with 6 children. She would like to start growing taro and taamu (a common root vegetable) to earn a living. Leiu has requested a loan to start her new plantation. She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Leiu will spend her profits to buy more tools for her farming needs.

loans.use: to buy a bush cutter, a wheelbarrow, knives, etc.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She wants to start a small business catching and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase fishing gear to start her business. In the future, Miriama hopes to continue her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a canoe, spears, etc.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes and chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to start her new business. In the future, Mareta hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, a frying pan, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Khoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Khoeurn, 57, is a mother of two children who currently are independent. She and her family are residing in a rural area of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She earns a living through cassava planting, the business which she has beewicking for 30 years and is able to earn about 12,000 KHR per day.
