This is her first loan with VisionFund, the same as her group member.  Her group consists of two and she is the group leader. She and her fellow member are seeking a new loan of 500,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her cassava field. She hopes to double her income via her high yields in order to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her cassava field.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old and has two children. For the past seven years he has operated a small general store for a living. The family also benefits from his wife’s income as a casual worker. 

Through Faulu Kenya Daniel learned how to run his shop through business management training. He is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and maize flour to stock his shop.

Daniel’s ambition is to expand his business and hire shop workers.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, cooking oil and maize flour

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi operates a provisions store in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a sprayer for a local farm. Esi has owned her provisions store for 4 years now. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs in bulk for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells limes and also prepares kenkey (local food made out of maize) for sale in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Esi has a junior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Esi has been selling kenkey and limes for five years. She is responsible for paying school fees, as her husband pays for other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy maize and limes in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and limes in bulk.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married and has three children. She sells banku (fermented maize and cassava dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for the past three years. Her husband is a farmer. Araba uses her income for paying school fees. Araba will use the loan to purchase cassava and maize in bulk. With the new profits, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Fuaselela

texts.en:
Fuaselela is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. For the past three years, she had made and sold pork buns and donuts in her community to earn a living. Fuaselela has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

Fuaselela is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients and supplies for her business. She plans to save her profits in her account to provide for her kid's fees.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, vanilla, and other ingredients

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 29 years old and has one child. For a living, he runs a motorcycle transport business. He has been in the business for four years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his saving skills because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a piece of land in the future. Charles has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en:
Faleseu is 49 years old and married with nine children. For many years, she has owned and operated a tailoring business. Faleseu joined SPBD in 2009.

Faleseu is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing tools. She hopes to use her profits to save in her account to provide for her business needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, material, packets of needles and other tools

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli is a 41-year-old woman who is married with six children.  For the past two years, she has run a business where she sells sugar, rice, flour and other items in her community. Kalameli has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

Kalameli is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to expand her business. She plans to save her profits to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, snacks, chicken legs, flour, oil and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old. He is married to Ruth and they are blessed with three children aged eight, five and two years. He owns a cereal and retail shop; he has been in this business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of KES.15,250.


He has applied for his first loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD. The loan will be used to buy  more cereals and stock for general shop e.g. cooking oil, flour.

The anticipated profits will be used to boost the business and also support the family. His hopes and dreams are to grow the business and also become a wholesale supplier for cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals and other merchandise for the shop, e.g., cooking oil, flour, rice

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in both motorcycle transport business and a clothing business for about four years now , and the businesses are doing well. He wants to purchase 20 bags of beans from the farmers for sale to venture into a new line of business, so he has requested a second loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) for that purpose.

The profit he makes will aid him in buying maize and opening a cereals shop. His dream is to see his businesses prosper and to venture into many other forms of business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of beans for sale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, aged 23 years old, is a resident in Kitale, western Kenya. He produces maize and beans for the local market. He also runs a retails shop within the local market. He is single.

Alex has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo and will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. He also plans to increase his farm by buying more land to accommodate more dairy cows. He adds the income will also help him focus on having the best breed of cows in future.

He says his major challenge remains access to better breeds.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rangua

texts.en:
Rangua is 29 years. He is married and a father of three children aged eight, six and four years.

He has been in the transport business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. The loan acquired will be used to repair his motorbike. The anticipated profits will be used in paying school fees for his children.


This is his third loan with KADET LTD and he has successfully repaid the previous loans. His dreams and hopes are to grow his business and also provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to  repair his motorbike

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
Sreytouch is 41 years old. She is originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Her family consists of five members including her three children. However, Sreytouch only needs to support two out of her three children who are still in school. She and her husband work farming rice and cassava on their six hectares of farmland and are able to earn about 56,000 KHR per day. Sreytouch's main business challenge is the dwindling price of cassava as this affects her daily income.

Sreytouch is the leader of a two-person female loan group. Her group is a new client of the Kiva partner VisionFund. Sreytouch is requesting a 1,000,000 KHR loan and her fellow member is seeking 900,000 KHR. She will use her loan to pay the weeding fee for her cassava and will use a portion to buy rubber tree seedlings to sell for additional income. Sreytouch expects to upgrade to a better lifestyle for her family via increasing her income from her current businesses.

loans.use: to pay the weeding fee for her cassava and to buy rubber tree seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for opperating expenses to open a skate shop.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children  go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She sells popcorn  from home. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of maize for making popcorn. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and asipiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and her family has no access to piped water or electricity.  Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more maize for making popcorn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is widowed with four children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 
Nuru has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX)  from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. In addition to her charcoal business she generates additional income through selling piped water and rental rooms. She works from home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 
Nuru aspires to become a wholesaler and to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food for the family and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 27-year-old married woman without children. For years, she has been cultivating a small vegetable garden where she grows tomatoes, peas, and cabbages to earn a living. Maria has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy some new veggie seeds, chicken manure, and chemicals. With her profits, Maria hopes to buy some new curtains for her house.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure, chemicals, and veggie seeds

loans.name: Moemoe

texts.en:
Moemoe is 43 years old and married with five children. For the past two years, she has grown taro and banana in her small garden. Moemoe sells her produce in her community or at the local market. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011.

Moemoe is requesting a loan to purchase more tools and chemicals to expand her production. She will the use the profit from her loan to save for her kid's education.

loans.use: to purchase knives, a wheel barrow, a bush cutter, and weed killers

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 40-year-old married woman. She has five children whose ages range from four to 21 years. She describes herself as an influential woman. She operates a farm where she sells vegetables such as cabbage, kale and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a less-competitive area and her primary customers are local residents, hotels, and wholesalers. She identifies her biggest business challenge as problems of transporting her vegetables to the customers. In addition, Emmy also runs a retail shop where she sells flour, sugar, salt etc  and a tailoring business. 

Emmy will use the KES 5,800 loan she has requested to buy a solar lantern for use in her house for lightning. Her business goal is to improve her business by exporting her vegetables to other countries within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 61-year-old married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be an ambitious man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as sugar, flour, rice, etc.  He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of transportation.

James will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy three bales of flour.  His business goal is to run a retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have opened another retail shop .

loans.use: buy flour to resell

loans.name: Fiaoo

texts.en:
Fiaoo is 31 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other products. Fiaoo became a member of SPBD gain access to capital for her business.

Fiaoo is requesting a loan to stock her shop. She hopes to use her profit to buy her children new stationery.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, soft drinks, snacks, and other items

loans.name: Saele

texts.en:
Saele is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. For the past two years, she has had a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes to earn a living. Saele joined SPBC at the start of this month.

Saele is requesting a loan to buy seeds and new equipment. She hopes to rebuild her Samoan fale (house) with her profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a shovel, and a bush cutter

loans.name: Faivavale

texts.en:
Faivavale is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers to earn a living. 

Faivavale has requested a loan to buy a bush cutter, seeds, knives and weed killers. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Faivavale will spend her profits on paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bush cutter, seeds, knives and weed killers.

loans.name: Mafa

texts.en:
Mafa is a 58-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small sewing business. She has had this business for two years. 

Mafa needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread and fabric. She will use her profits to expand the business. Mafa joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread and fabric.

loans.name: Leydi Carolina

texts.es: Leydi, de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive en Olanchito, Yoro junto a su hijo y una hermana. Hace 8 meses que Leydi, inicio su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, vende blusas, pantalones jeans, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior. También algunos productos de achinería. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privada y por necesidad de obtener más ingresos decidió establecer este negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar más ropa nueva e incrementar las ventas. Con esta inversión se fortalecerá el negocio y va satisfacer a sus clientes. Su meta es mejorar cada día que pasa y llegar a tener una tienda fuerte.
texts.en:
Leydi, age 26, is a single mother.  She lives in Olanchito, Yoro, with her son and a sister.  Leydi started her own business of selling used clothes eight months ago.  She sells blouses, pants, jeans, shorts, t-shirts, and underwear.  She also sells some knick-knacks.

She previously worked for a private company.  However, she needed more income, so she decided to establish this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and increase her sales.  This investment will strengthen her business and satisfy her customers.  Her goal is to improve each day and to have a stable store.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 20 años, es soltera, pero tiene una pequeña hija llamada Verónica. Vive en la casa de sus padres.
Ella se dedica a la confección y bordado de faldas típicas, desde muy pequeña aprendió el oficio familiar. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en hacerlo independientemente y en este tiempo logró obtener una máquina industrial. “Tengo mayor ingreso económico con los bordados de faldas a mano, me tardo un promedio de un mes y logro ganar mil soles, promedio, por falda”, comenta. Ahora ya comenzó la temporada festiva donde tiene muchos más pedidos de faldas para que bailen los pobladores en la festividad, por lo que contrató a su tía para que le ayude, espera obtener buenas ganancias.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mollecito” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio.
Elizabeth invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de hilos y telas, al por mayor, para la elaboración de sus bordados.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 20 years old and is single but she has a small daughter named Verónica.  She lives in her parent’s home.  She makes a living in the tailoring and embroidery of traditional skirts; from a very young age she learned the family trade.  She already has three years of experience in doing so independently and at this time she managed to obtain an industrial machine.  “I have a greater income with the hand-embroidered skirts, it takes me an average of a month and I manage to earn a thousand soles (PEN), on average, per skirt,” she comments.  Now she has already begun the holiday season during which she has many more orders for skirts for the inhabitants of her town to dance in the festivities, for which she hired her aunt to help her.  She hopes to obtain a good profit.

She belongs to the communal bank “Mollecito” and this is her first loan with MFP, for which she is very happy to know that she will have financial support in order to move forward with her business.  Elizabeth will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of wholesale threads and fabrics for the production of her embroidery.

loans.use: to buy wholesale threads and fabrics for the production of her embroidery.

loans.name: Mataloa

texts.en:
Matalaoa is 32 years old and married. She has four children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumber and pi that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Matalaoa needs a loan to purchase more seeds and tools to expand her business. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Matalaoa will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for the business's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a wheelbarrow, a bush cutter and knives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a married man. He has 8 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 24 years. He describes himself to be a focused and committed man. 

Johnson operates a retail business where he sells building bricks. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an agricultural area and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of bricks. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for his family use. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.  

Johnson also has a farm where he sells cereals such as maize, coffee, etc. He plans to export his cereals and practice horticultural farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
La is a 50-year-old mother of four children; one son still depends on her as he is still in school. The rest of her family is living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province in which both rice and cassava planting are the common business for the villagers. Not much different from her neighbors, she also manages two hectares of farmland for growing rice and another one hectare area for growing cassava. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day. 

Her main challenge is the dropping price of cassava. La has been with VisionFund since 2010 as the first loan cycle. She has used her past loan with success in better supporting her family. Now, La is in a group of two taking out a new loan. She and her co-member are applying for the same amount, 500,000 KHR each. 

As the group leader, La will use her loan portion to pay the weeding fee for her cassava field. She hopes to grow her cash crop healthfully so as to make a larger income to support her family.

loans.use: To pay the weeding fee for her cassava field.

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en:
Maryann is 31 years old and married with a child. For the past three years, she has been making and selling elei (traditional printed cloth) to earn a living. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

Maryann is requesting a loan to buy paint, fabric, and brushes. She plans to use her profit to help with her child's education.

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes and fabric

loans.name: Sofai

texts.en:
Sofai is a 60-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Sofai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, shovels and fertilizers.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Sofai hopes to buy new school uniforms for her children.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, shovels and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lavalenesi

texts.en:
Lavalenesi is 40 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling popcorn in her community. She has been doing this for four years. 

Lavalenesi has requested a loan to buy corn seeds, oil, salt and plastic bags for her popcorn-selling business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lavalenesi will help pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, oil, salt and plastic bags for her popcorn-selling business.

loans.name: Petronella

texts.en:
Petronella is a 33-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Petronella has requested a loan to buy chemicals, crops and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Petronella hopes to renew her family's home.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, crops and shovels.

loans.name: Tusigaigoa

texts.en:
Tusigaigoa is 39 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as snacks, soft drinks, rice, sugar, and other products. Tusigaigoa became a member of SPBD gain access to capital for her business.

Tusigaigoa is requesting a loan to buy some more stock. She hopes to use her profit to re-paint her shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, salt, and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and determined. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 6 staff members. Her business is located in a high-traffic area, and her primary customers are schools, churches, business owners, and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of cow food. She will use the Kes 74,800 loan to buy a water tank for family use and cow feeding. Her business goal is to own 100 cows for milk within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and grow it into a dairy company. Helen also does farming. She had taken out five loans from SMEP DTM which she managed to repay.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 21 años, vive con su madre, Felicitas, y su hermana Carmen.
Su principal actividad económica la realiza gracias a que tiene dos vacas que le brindan la leche necesaria para la elaboración de queso, mantequilla y yogurt,  los cuales envasa para comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad. Recién tiene 6 meses en este negocio, le está yendo muy bien, tanto que no se abastece con su propia producción por lo que tiene que comprar productos lácteos de otras personas. Ahora desea ahorrar todo el dinero necesario, pues tiene planeando estudiar una carrera superior el próximo año y de esa manera ser un ejemplo para su hermana menor.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está segura que con este apoyo financiero podrá continuar con sus objetivos. Promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Sonia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una máquina para envasar sus productos lácteos, ya que hasta ahora lo hace de forma artesanal.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 21, lives with her mother, Felicitas, and her sister, Carmen.  Her main business activity, which she does thanks to having two cows that provide the needed milk, is making cheese, butter, and yogurt.  She packages them and sells them at a market in the city.  She has had this business for six months, and it is going very well for her.  It is going so well that she cannot stock up with her own production.  Therefore, she has to buy dairy products from other people.

She now wishes to save all of the money she needs.  She plans to study for an advanced career next year.  This way she will be an example for her younger sister.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is sure that with this financial support she will be able to continue with her objectives.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.

Sonia will use the requested money to buy a machine to package her daily products.  Up until now she has been doing it by hand.

loans.use: to buy a machine to package her daily products because up until now she has been doing it by hand.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 4 children whose ages range from 10 years to 17 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as sugarcane, onions, and kale. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as weather changes the can lead to quick spoiling of vegetables. She will use the requested KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for her family use and business in cleaning the vegetables. Her business goal is to diversify her business into charcoal selling within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will run a big retail store for her charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
Seutaatia is 31 years old and married. She has five children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Seutaatia needs a loan to buy more tools to expand her plantation.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Seutaatia will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weed killer, bush cutters and knives.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 49-year-old married man. He has 3 children whose ages range from 5 years to 9 years. He describes himself as an aggressive man. He operates a motorcycle transportation service. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a busy town, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for his family household activities. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. Edward previously received a loan of KES 20,000, which he managed to pay. He also does farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha, 34, is a mother two children, one daughter and one son, who are still in school. To strive for her family, she has been growing rice for 16 years as the main source of income. Her husband also helps to generate additional income through cow raising and working for others for a fee. She can earn about 21,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

This is her second loan with Kiva partner,VisionFund. With success, she has managed to pay back the entire past loan, which has enabled her to better support her family, especially by keeping her children in school. 

Now, she leads a group of two female members to apply for a new loan. Her requesting amount is 1,200,000 KHR, while her co-member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, Pha will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the harvesting fee. She hopes to receive more yields and earn more income in order to keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata is 38 years old and married. She has one child. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling BBQ in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to start her new business. 

In the future, Pamata hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, soy sauce, sausages and onions.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 15 to 30 years.

Priscilla describes herself to be an aggressive woman. She operates a farm where she sells maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs two staff members. Her business is located within an agriculturally fertile area and her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure of roads, leading to poor accessibility of her business premise.

She will use the loan of 8,700 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a water tank for her family household activities. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely tiene 36 años, esta casada con Denis, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cuatro de ellos, en la casa que compraron hace 7 años.
Ella es una mujer empresaria, alquila un local en el primer piso de su casa y además tiene una fábrica de ladrillos que ella misma administra. Ya tiene 3 años de elaborar ladrillos y en todo este tiempo logró hacer de 30 a 35 millares de ladrillos al mes. Trabaja sin parar, desde las primeras horas del día; “hace días estuve remojando la tierra para realizar los ladrillos, me resbalé y caí, fracturándome la mano”, cuenta. Espera pronto recuperarse, pues le gusta trabajar, además tiene que aprovechar la temporada de verano, cuando los ladrillos secan con mayor rapidez y puede producir el doble de millares al mes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y espera mejorar su negocio con el dinero adquirido, ya que tiene muchas ideas. 
Nely invertirá este dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los ladrillos, como aserrín, arena y material para encender el horno.
texts.en:
Nely, age 36, is married to Denis, and they have five children.  However, they now only live with four of them in the house they bought seven years ago.

She is a businesswoman.  She rents a place on the first floor of her house, and she also has a brick factory, which she manages herself.  She has been making bricks for three years.  In all of this time she managed to make between 30 and 35 thousand bricks a month.  Starting in the first hours of the day, she works without stopping.

“Some days ago I was soaking the land to make the bricks.  I slipped and fell, fracturing my hand,” she says.  She hopes to recovery quickly; she likes to work.  Also, she has to take advantage of the summer season when the bricks dry more rapidly, and she is able to produce double the thousands she makes a month.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes to improve her business with the money obtained.  She has a lot of ideas.  Nely will use the money to buy supplies to make bricks.  She will buy things like sawdust, sand, and material to ignite the oven.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sawdust, sand, and material to ignite the oven in order to make bricks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 16 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be a humble and faithful woman. 

Jane operates a general store where she sells items such charcoal and kerosene. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough space for storage of charcoal and kerosene. 

Jane will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank for her family household chores such as cooking etc .  This is her second loan, and she has managed to repay her earlier loan of KES 20,000. Her business goal is to run a petrol station within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business. Jane also does farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of four children. She resides with her husband in Kisauni, Coast Province, Kenya. She has been running a dressmaking shop for more than seven years, earning approximately 200 KES per day. Her husband is a plumber and he contributes to the family's basic needs with his earnings. Her child is still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her business, Rehema is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase more cloth to produce more clothes to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to produce more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa continues her mat and basket selling business which she intends to expand using the requested loan. She is always active and helping her children. Her husband also continues working as a farmer. They are both improving their house.

With this new loan Mejumaa will buy mats and baskets for sale. She is anticipating for high profits that will enable her to expand her business. This will make the family more comfortable and safer.

She lives in her mud and thatched house that lacks electricity; neither does it have piped water. However, Mejumaa has faith that she will one day own a permanent house with all facilities.

loans.use: to buy mats and baskets for sale.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a retailer by trade. She carries out her business alone in her store and sells charcoal and firewood. Since her last loan, she has been able to open a vegetable stall to diversify her businesses. 

In order to strengthen her capacity and become the best in her neighborhood, Esha, who has already had two micro-loans from Yehu, is requesting a third loan so that she can buy more stock of charcoal and firewood, as well as vegetables for resale. With what remains of her income, she would like to save enough to continue diversifying her sources of income and ensure a good future for all her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood, as well as vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Bahati. She is widowed and has eight children, six of whom are in school.

In 2000, Bahati established her butcher business. She began her business because she wants to support her children’s education. This business is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about KES 15,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of KES 30,000. Bahati requires a loan in order to buy more meat for sale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. 

In the future, Bahati plans to open other butcher shops.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn is 35 years old. She has four sons who are students in the local public school. 

To make a living, she is a paid worker and her husband is a security guard. Having been in the job for 10 years, she is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. 

She wants to have a proper shelter for her family, so she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund. Her group consists of two members and both of them are first loan cycle clients. They are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Chhorn will use her loan portion to buy necessary construction materials for building her house (cement, roof, bricks, sand, wooden boards etc.). She hopes to own a decent house for her family so she can focus on earning income for her children.

loans.use: To buy material for constructing a decent house.

loans.name: Aimalefoa

texts.en:
Aimalefoa is 40 years old and married. She has four children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Aimalefoa needs a loan to purchase more seeds and tools to expand her business.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Aimalefoa will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables seeds, knives and plastic bags.

loans.name: Limalau

texts.en: Limalau is 32 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns and donuts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to purchase more ingredients. In the future, Limalau hopes to continue her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pork buns and donuts, such as oil and flour.

loans.name: Autasia

texts.en:
Autasia is 28 years old and married. She has three children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling donuts and pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to begin her business. 

In the future, Autasia hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, vanilla flavour and yeast.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 64-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Akenese has requested a loan to buy some insect poison, shovels, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Akenese hopes to buy her children some new uniforms for school.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, shovels, and a wheel barrow for her cabbage farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 45 años, vive junto a sus padres y su hermana menor, en la casa de su madre.
Tiene 23 años de experiencia en la venta de abarrotes, su tienda es una de las más antiguas de su localidad. Pero su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en la siembra de productos como alverja, maíz, papa y alfalfa (básicamente para la alimentación de sus animales). Sus terrenos agrícolas son herencia de su madre y durante la siembra contrata peones para que le ayuden en el trabajo de la tierra. Ya en la cosecha vende sus productos a los compradores que llegan a su propio terreno, pero hay temporadas en las que baja el precio y ella tiene que llevar a vender sus productos al mercado.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San santiago” y este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, por lo que agradece el préstamo, pues podrá invertir en su negocio. Promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas y además le gusta trabajar con su grupo, pues todas son vecinas de su barrio y se apoyan entres sí.
Marisol invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Marisol is 45 years old and lives with her parents and younger sister in her mother’s house. She has 23 years of experience selling groceries. Her store is one of the longest-established in her area. Her principal economic activity, however, is farming and she has 15 years of experience cultivating products such as peas, corn, potatoes and alfalfa (basically as feed for her animals). Her agricultural lands are a bequest from her mother and during the planting season she contracts laborers to help her work the land. During the harvest she sells her products to buyers who come to her, however there are seasons when the price falls and she has to take her crops to sell at the market.

She belongs to the San Santiago Communal Bank and this is her eleventh loan from MFP. Thus she is grateful for the loan since she will be able to invest in her business. She promises to make her payments on time and enjoys working with her group since all are her neighbors and they are mutually supportive of one another. Marisol will invest this money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread in her potato and maize fields.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer to spread in her potato and maize fields.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Vaaitino

texts.en:
Vaaitino is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Vaaitino has requested a loan to buy crops, chicken manure, seeds and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Vaaitino hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy crops, chicken manure, seeds, and gloves.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows long and short beans, tomatoes and cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Anne has requested a loan to buy some seeds, chemicals and equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Anne hopes to expand her business within her village.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical, shovels, and gloves.

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es:
Yanett tiene 40 años, vive con sus dos hijos: Milagros y Sharon, en la casa que le heredaron sus padres.
Desde niña aprendió a trabajar con esfuerzo y coraje en la agricultura, aún no posee terrenos propios, pero ya tiene 14 años de experiencia; sus principales sembríos constan de papa, maíz y zanahoria, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, todos los días, desde las primeras horas hasta el anochecer. “Ya tengo compradores fijos, quienes llegan a mis chacra para comprar la cosecha íntegra”, afirma. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Santiago” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece la oportunidad brindada y por ese motivo promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. 
Yanett invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semilla de maíz y fertilizantes orgánicos para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Yanett is 40 years old and lives with her two children, Milagros and Sharon, in the house she inherited from her parents. As a child she learned how to do hard agricultural work, however she still does not own her own agricultural land although she has 14 years of experience as a farmer. Her principal crops are potatoes, maize and carrots, which she very carefully tends every day from the early hours until dusk. “I have established buyers who come to the farm to buy the entire harvest,” she states.

She belongs to the San Santiago Communal Bank and this is her first loan from MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to make her payments on time. Yanett will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of corn seeds and organic fertilizer to spread in her potato and corn fields.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is a 51-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Peka has requested a loan to buy some chemicals, gloves, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Peka hopes to buy her child a new uniform.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, gloves, and seeds.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small veggie garden and grows pumpkins to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Paula has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, plastic bags, pot plants and seeds. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Paula hopes to help pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plastic bags, pot plants and seeds.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. 

Barbara has requested a loan to buy some chemicals, shovels and sprayers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Barbara hopes to refurnish her entire house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, shovels and sprayers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 22-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Rosita has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Rosita hopes to buy new roofing iron for her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals and shovels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his parents' house by putting in floors and painting it

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 50 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling ice cake in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Sofia has requested a loan to buy sugar, foam cups, cordial and a mixer. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sofia will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, form cups and cordial.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 33 years old and lives in Rambutan, Jakarta. She has two children of school age.

Laila has a game arena at a night carnival. She established her business in 2004, and her husband helps her to run this business. She has good experience in this field and a good reputation in her local community. 

She is requesting a 7,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiahs) loan to buy a generator set. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she can be able to provide her family with a better life. She dreams of having her own night carnival. 

This photo was taken with her husband as her partner in her business.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her game arena.

loans.name: Olomian

texts.en:
Olomian is in her 30s, is married and lives in Jakarta. She is blessed with two children.

Olomian explains that her grocery store is situated for stability and growth.

She is requesting a loan 3,500,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiahs) to purchase more and varied food items (e.g., rice, eggs, sugar, oil) to sell in the store. She expects that the loan proceeds will allow her to bring in more customers and to thereby generate more sales. 

She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman so that she will be able to give her children a good future, which is why she works so hard. In the future, she hopes to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy more food items, rice, gas, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mahoudjro 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUDJRO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Djima Marthe est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Djima Marthe est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Djima Marthe vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différentes charges, Djima Marthe vend de la nourriture (haricot préparé) à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Djima Marthe s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Djima Marthe sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDJRO 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAHOUDJRO 1 consists of three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Djima Marthe, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Djima Marthe, age 44, is married to a man named Paul, and the couple have five dependent children, some of whom go to school. They support another child in addition to their own children. Djima Marthe and her husband live together with their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Djima Marthe sells a bean dish from her home. This activity allows her to support herself fairly easily. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to bolster her sales and revenue, Djima Marthe is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group MAHOUDJRO 1. This credit will help them to strengthen their activities, expand their customer base and increase their revenue. Both past loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy beans, palm oil, and groundnut oil.

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 5 Group

texts.en:
Nilawati is in her late 50s with three children. Nilawati has a small business selling cooked food and cookies at a stand in front of her home. She has been operating this business for 12 years. She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, seasonings and eggs for her bakery and catering business. Her business strategy is to be friendly and helpful to all of her customers. 

Her husband is a retired civil worker and his income is very helpful. She enjoys her business because can help her jobless neighbors work with her. Some of the other group members will use this loan for selling clothes on credit, selling cell phone card refills, and selling daily basic needs in grocery stores.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, eggs, butter and seasonings for catering.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 45 años, vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos, en la casa que heredó de sus padres.
Ella no cuenta con una fábrica para la elaboración de ladrillos, pero ello no fue un impedimento, pues alquilo una. De esa manera comenzó a realizar ladrillos y tejas por ella misma y con la ayuda de su esposo. Espera aumentar la cantidad conforme avance el tiempo y adquieran más experiencia y sobre todo capital de trabajo. Sabe que lo logrará pues ya tiene éxito en la venta de los millares que hacen ahora. Su deseo es comprar la tierra donde elabora los ladrillos y así no tener más que alquilarla.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número18 con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Dominga invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de arena y aserrín, en grandes cantidades, para la elaboración de los ladrillos y tejas.
texts.en:
Dominga is 45 years old and lives with her husband and children in the house she inherited from her parents. She doesn't have a workshop of her own for making bricks, but this hasn't been a problem as she rents one. She makes bricks and tiles with help from her husband.

Dominga hopes to increase production as time goes on and they get more experience and have more working capital. She knows that the business will do well as she has already successfully sold the thousands of bricks they've made to date. Her greatest wish is to buy the land where the bricks are made and no longer have to rent the space. 

Dominga belongs to to the 'Barrio Oriental' Community Bank and this is her 18th loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the assistance she has received to reach her goals and promises to make the repayments on time. She is also grateful to be part of her group as she has known the other members for a long time.

Dominga will use the money from this loan to buy large quantities of sand and sawdust to make the bricks and tiles.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of sand and sawdust to make bricks and tiles

loans.name: Nilam Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
Isa lives in East Jakarta. Her husband is a private employee whose salary is just enough to provide food for the family. Together they have two children, both in school.

She has been running her food business for two years and is part of a group seeking a loan. Isa is wearing an orange dress in this photo.

Income from her business will help support the children's education. She is going to increase her capital and buy a large amount of instant drinks to resell so as to earn more. 

In the next few years, she would like to buy a vehicle from business profits.

loans.use: to buy instant drinks, ice and beverage powders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a trading booth, furniture, and pay for ground rates.

loans.name: Seroja Indah 2 Group

texts.en: Nina lives in Ciracas east of Jakarta. She has one child in primary school. With her group, Nina is borrowing 2,000,000 IDR to fund her business of selling kids' toys and to fix her refrigerator, She started her business in 2005. Her business does not always run smoothly. During the month of Ramadan, her business decreases. She wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy. She is very interested in her business because she loves children so much. She hopes someday she will have a shop and send her child to college. Nina wears a long blue dress in this photo.

loans.use: to purchase toys and fix the refrigerator.

loans.name: Elizabeth Sara

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 69 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de nazca, Ica, Perú. Nazca es una ciudad cuyos pobladores son muy generosos y hospitalarios, tiene un legado en cuanto a cultura, como peruanos estamos muy orgullosos de esta ciudad ya que alberga las líneas de nazca, estas han sido dibujadas en un extenso campo y que eran utilizadas por la cultura Nazca para la agricultura ya que eran una especie de calendario en donde ellos podían saber cuando era la época de lluvia, debido a estas majestuosas líneas esta ciudad alberga cada año infinidad de turistas, asimismo el Perú es muy conocido por su exquisita gastronomía, pero el platillo que le agrada mas a Elizabeth es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”, ella nos comenta que comería ese platillo todos los días sin cansarse; Elizabeth estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, pero ella hubiera querido estudiar en la universidad administración, debido a que sus padres no tenían los suficientes medios económicos y ella tuvo que trabajar desde pequeña para apoyar en casa. Tiene 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 12, 20, 22 el menor cursa el primer año de secundaria y los mayores estudian en la universidad, Elizabeth lucha mucho por sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y con dedicación los está sacando adelante, ya que ella quiere que sean mejores que ella y que se sientan orgullosos de tener una profesión, así como también que no pasen las penurias que ella vivió desde pequeña.

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, anteriormente ella vendía sus productos solo en su triciclo pero ahorro y ahora tiene unas mesas para que los clientes tomen asiento, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias, puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día y pueden ganar hasta S/. 100, en un día muy bueno puede ganar S/.250, con lo que le ayuda en los gastos adicionales del hogar o los gastos adicionales de estudios de sus hijos. Ella cree que le va bien en su negocio por su dedicación y porque atiende muy bien a los clientes para que siempre vuelvan a comprar sus productos.

Actualmente está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como golosinas, conservas, sacos de arroz, sacos de azucar, entre otros y con ello obtener mayores ingresos  para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer, así como también seguir ahorrando para cumplir sus mas grandes sueños:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos” y “Terminar la construcción de su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 69 years old and lives in the city of Nazca, Ica, Perü. Nazca is one of the cities whose inhabitants are very generous and hospitable. It has a cultural heritage that we Peruvians are very proud of because it contains the Nazca Lines, which were drawn on an extensive field and used in early  Nazca culture for farming since they were a kind of calendar that foretold the coming of the rainy season. Because of these majestic lines, the city welcomes an infinite number of tourists every year. Perú is also very well known for its gastronomy, however the dish that Elizabeth enjoys most is the delicious “Aji de Gallina,”: she says that she could eat this dish every day without ever getting tired of it. 

Elizabeth studied until the fifth year of secondary school although she would have liked to have studied university administration, however her parents did not have sufficient means and she had to work since very young to help support the household. She has three children, who are 12, 20 and 22 years old. The youngest is in the first year of secondary school and the older ones are studying at the university. Elizabeth struggles greatly to move her children ahead because she is a single mother and through her dedication is helping them succeed. She wants them to be better than she is and feel pride in having a profession and not experience the hardships she has lived through since childhood.

Elizabeth sells sweets, carbonated beverages and beer. Previously she only sold her products from her tricycle but she saved her money and now has tables so her customers can take a seat. She works about 10 hours a day and can wait on up to 30 customers a day and earn up to S/.100. On a very good day she may earn S/. 250, which helps to pay additional household expenses or the additional educational expenses of her children. She believes that her business is doing well because of her dedication and the very good service she provides to her customers so they will always return to buy her products. 

Currently she is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the support provided her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as sweets, canned food and sacks of rice and sugar, among other items and thus earn more income to improve her quality of life and have a greater variety of products to sell. As well, she can also continue saving to fulfill her greatest dreams: To help her children become professionals and to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sweets, canned goods and sacks of rice and sugar, among other items).

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda tiene 33 años, tiene tres hijos: Janela, Merari y Omar.
A pesar de no contar con una fábrica para la elaboración de ladrillos, se esfuerza en trabajar día  a día en el terreno que alquiló para realizar ladrillos por ella misma, con ayuda de su esposo. Recién están comenzando, hacen 10 millares al mes, pero esperan aumentar conforme avance el tiempo y adquieran más experiencia, saben que lo lograrán, pues ya están teniendo éxito en sus ventas. También tienen terrenos agrícolas donde siembran alfalfa y los alquila a los ganaderos para alimentar a sus animales. El deseo de Rosalinda es comprar la tierra donde elabora sus ladrillos para no seguir pagando un alquiler.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número 9  con MFP, por tanto agradece este apoyo con el que podrá cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Rosalinda invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ladrillos, chapla y aserrín, además de contratar peones para el quemado de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Rosalinda is 33 years old and has 3 children: Janela, Merari, and Omar. Despite her lack of facilities for making bricks, she exerts herself day after day, working  on rented land, to make bricks herself, with her husband's help. Recently, they are making 10,000 bricks a month, but they hope to increase this as time passes and they acquire more experience. They know this can be achieved because of their success in sales.

They also have agricultural land where they sow alfalfa and rent their fields to cattle raisers to feed their animals. It is Rosalinda's desire to buy the land where they make bricks so they will no longer have to pay rent.

Rosalinda belongs to the “Eastern Barrio” solidarity group and this is her 9th loan through MFP. She is grateful for this help in meeting her objectives. She promises to comply with her payment schedule and she is glad to be a member of her association, after many years of knowing her fellow members. 

Rosalinda will invest the money in purchasing mud bricks, firewood and sawdust, plus hiring laborers for the brick-baking process.

loans.use: to buy mud bricks, firewood and sawdust, plus hiring laborers for the baking process.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy eggs, meat, and fish to produce cooked food and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: Ousseynou est un jeune célibataire qui exerce l'activité d'embouche ovine.Il achète des moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires  de sa localité, les engraisse puis les revend au bout de quatre mois.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille ainsi qu'à ses propres besoins.Il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 10 béliers.Son ambition est de toujours renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Ousseynou is a young single man who is in the business of fattening sheep.  He buys his sheep in local weekly markets, then fattens and resells them at the end of four months.  This endeavor allows him to help support his family as well as care for his own needs.  He is seeking a loan of 400,000 XOF in order to purchase ten rams.  It is Ousseynou's ambition to continually strengthen his business.

loans.use: to purchase ten rams

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay her child's school fees and add inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 45 años, está casada con Raúl desde hace 19 años, tienen tres hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con dos de ellos: Ángel y Salí.
Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, siembra maíz y papa. Cuenta con una parcela de terreno agrícola, pero como no es suficiente, por lo que alquila otras para sembrar en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 12 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo pudo adquirir buenos compradores de sus cosechas. Paralelo a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de toros y gallinas; mientras su esposo trabaja en una mina donde percibe un salario mensual y llega a casa cada 20 días. Por lo que Esther es la que se encarga de los negocios de la familia.

Pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece este apoyo con el que logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Esther invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales que le servirán en su próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old, she has been married to Raul for 19 years, they have three children but currently they only live with two of them: Ángel and Salí. Her primary economic activity is agriculture, planting corn and potatoes. She has her own parcel of agricultural land, but it is not sufficient, that is why she rents other lands to plant larger quantities. She already has 12 years of experience and has been able to find good buyers for her harvests. Along with this work, she also raises cows and chickens while her husband works in a mine where he receives a monthly salary and returns home every 20 days. And so, Esther is also in charge of family business. 

She belongs to a group called "Barrio oriental" and this is her tenth loan with MFP and she is thankful for the help she has received with which she has been able to achieve her objectives. She promises to pay all her quotas and she is thankful for being part of this association because she has known them for many years. Esther will invest her money by purchasing natural fertilizers that will help her in the next planting season for corn.

loans.use: purchase natural fertilizers for her next corn crop.

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
Elbrus is a 46-year-old man who is married and has five children. He is an internally-displaced person. He is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his own garden. He has 10 years of experience in this field. The crops he grows are organic; that's why market vendors respect Elbrus and always come to his place. 

He usually sells crops in the central market or from his yard. He is also a driver, and sometimes takes people from his village to the city. But this is additional work, the main financial income is from farming. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy: many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family's table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. His monthly income is 80 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). 

Now he would like to increase his monthly turnover, and for this purpose he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil is a 46-year-old man and IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 14 years. During these years, Fazil gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan families and also make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

As these products are in high demand, Fazil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,300 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.en:
Gulpari is 41 years old, married and has two sons. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who earns a living by raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has been in this field for seven years, which makes her experienced and skilled. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air can be difficult, which is why Gulpari relies on help from her family. She is also a teacher in the local school, but her salary is too low to cover her family's needs.

Gulpari usually sells her crop in the central bazaar once every two weeks, and earns 130 AZN a month. In Azerbaijan, people use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are also served on every table in Azerbaijan and are used to make fresh punch. 

She is requesting a loan for 800 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase monthly output. This will be her third loan, and she has repaid the others fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Groupe Jubo Ngodjleme

texts.fr: Le groupe "GROUPE JUBO NGODJLEME" se compose de cinq femmes.Elles sont toutes mariées et mères de familles.Elles mènent une activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine.Elles achètent un bœuf qu'elle engraissent et revendent une fois arrivé à maturation.Le chef de groupe (en avant , en blanc)est mère de trois enfants.Elle mène en plus de l'activité du groupe, une activité secondaire d'embouche ovine.Cette activité d'élevage permet aux membres du groupe de subvenir aux besoins de leurs familles ainsi qu'à leurs propres besoins.Elles sollicitent un pret de 750000f pour acheter 2 bœufs.
texts.en: The Jubo Ngodjleme group is composed of five women. They all married, with children. They raise livestock, particularly cattle. They buy cattle to fatten and resell  once the animals are ready for the market. The group’s leader (in the foreground on the photo, wearing white) is the mother of three. In addition to being in the same business as the rest of the group, she also raises sheep as a secondary activity. Raising livestock allows group members to provide for their families’ needs as well as their own. They are requesting a loan of 750,000 West African francs to buy two bulls.

loans.use: to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Magbule

texts.en:
Magbule is 22 years old. She is married and has three children ranging from seven months old to 6 years old. She and her family live in unacceptable  conditions in a small village in the Ashkali community. 

The Ashkali community is extremely poor and subject to unhealthy conditions. Magbule cannot even afford to send her children to school, as the cost of school supplies is very high. Traditionally, some residents of this community provide transportation services using a horse. Her husband provides this service and uses his horse to transport goods within the neighborhood. This is currently the only source of income for the family, and he works hard to improve the life of his family.

Recently, they had to sell the horse that they owned in order to generate money they needed. Now, for the third time, they are asking for a loan to buy a new horse. Magbule’s goal is to improve the living conditions of her family and save money for her children’s education. 

She is very happy for this help!

loans.use: To buy a new horse to provide transportation services

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 22 and 20. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. Sarita has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Sarita plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Tala needs a loan to buy chemicals, taro crops, a plant sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Tala will use the profits from her sales to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, taro crops, a plant sprayer and other items

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 17 years old, single and has no children. For the last two years, she has run a small business making ava, a popular local beverage. She is requesting a loan to buy items she needs for her business, including plastic bags, ava samoa powder and labels. She will use the profit she earns to build up the store where she sells ava powder. She joined SPBD earlier this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beverage-making business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a very hardworking and friendly man of 29. He is married and is an internally displaced person (IDP). Ahmad is cattle breeder and has six years of experience in this field. He gets financial support from government as an IDP but it is too low to cover the family's needs. 

Ahmad usually buys small cattle, raising and fattening them for five to six months, and resells them at the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings in 110 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. 

This is the only income for his family and not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved children. Ahmad applied for 1500 AZN to purchase four calves. This will be his second loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años, tiene dos hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con una, la última. Viven en la casa de su hermana.
Cuidar de sus hijas sola, fue difícil, pero con la ayuda de su familia pudo salir adelante. Su principal actividad económica es el bordado de fustanes, que son trajes típicos, cada uno lo vende a 200 nuevos soles y a la semana realiza dos. Pero como buena mujer del campo, por temporadas, siembra papa y olluco en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, cada cosecha la comercializa en la feria de uno de los distritos de la ciudad, también aprovecha esa oportunidad para vender los animales que cría (toros y cerdos). 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número 15  con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que ha recibido por tantos años (más de 6), y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
María invertirá este dinero en la compra de telas y paños para el bordado, además de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, she has two children but now she only lives with one of them, her youngest. They live in her sister's house. She cares for her daughters alone, it was difficult, but with her family's help she was able to be successful. Her primary economic activity is embroidering slips/skirts, typical dress of the region, each one sells for 200 Peruvian soles and she can make two a week. But like a good country woman, during the right seasons, she also plants potatoes and olluco (a Peruvian tuber plant) on her own land, each season she sells her harvest at a festival in one of the districts of her city, she also takes advantage of this opportunity to sell the animals she raises (cows and pigs). 

She belongs to a group called "Barrio oriental"  and this is her 15th loan with MFP and she is thankful for the help she has received from this group over the years (more than 6 ) and she promises to make her payments punctually. María will invest this money in purchasing cloth and skirts to embroider as well as natural fertilizers for her next harvest.

loans.use: purchase cloth and skirts to embroider and natural fertilizers for her next harvest.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She owns and operates a business making elei (hand printed fabric). She has two years of experience in this line of business. Salome needs a loan to buy materials, paints, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand the business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy materials and paint for making elei (hand printed fabric)

loans.name: Faalataina

texts.en: Faalataina is 45 years old, married and has three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by running a small canteen in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy bread, buns, snacks, flour and other items. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. Faalataina will use the additional earnings made possible by this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her canteen.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en: Pola is 36 years old, married and has six children. For the last three years, she has run a small business selling food in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, fish, bananas, taro, sacks of flour and other items. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pola will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en: Tolotea is 25 years old, married and has two children. For the last four years, she has run a small plantation where she earns a living by growing taro and bananas. She has requested a loan to buy supplies for her farm, including fertilizer, a plant sprayer and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009 and plans to use her profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 48 años, su esposo, desde hace 16 años, es Moisés, con quien tienen seis hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con tres de ellos.
Ella se siente dichosa de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien la ayuda cada vez que puede. Mientras él trabaja como peón en diferentes chacras, ella se dedica al cuidado de sus tres toros y ocho vacas, de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para venderla a los pobladores de su localidad. Su secreto es sembrar ella misma la alfalfa con la que las alimenta, pero también les da comida balanceada y vitaminas para mantenerlas fuertes. Paralelo a esto siembra maíz y papa en terrenos alquilados, sus cosechas las comercializa a los compradores mayoristas. Su deseo es comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas y depender de ella misma.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Barrio oriental” y este es su crédito número 16  con MFP, por lo que agradece este apoyo financiero durante casi 8 años. Por eso promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, como en sus anteriores créditos.
Esta vez Antonia invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 48 years old, she has been married to her husband, Moisés, for 16 years, with whom she has 6 children but now they only live with three of them. She is happy to have her husband's support, who helps her any time he can.
