texts.en: The Mahugnon 12 group is composed of three individuals who are friends and members of the same communal savings group. The group’s representative, by the name of Sophia, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Sophia is 48 years old and married to Maxim. They have two dependent children, both in school. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. To contribute to the family budget, Sophia sells food items (such as rice and bread) out of her home. This business allows her to cover her needs without great difficulty. Sophia stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Sophia, along with the other members of the Mahugnon 12 group, is seeking her first loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to expand their business, increasing their customer base as well their revenues.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments and peanut oil.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 22 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells pork and beer. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks to sell and will help Pauline to generate greater profits and will be able to educate her children. Pauline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more drinks to sell at her pork shop

loans.name: Soli-Ero Group

texts.fr: Commerçante de profession, Madame Awah vit avec son mari cultivateur et leurs 05 enfants qui sont scolarisés à SOKODE. Elle est âgée de 45ans. Son premier enfant a 25ans et le dernier 15ans. C’est en 1983 qu’elle est dans ce domaine et elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale, des bijoux et des articles scolaires en REGION CENTRALE lieu où elle s’approvisionne aussi. Elle veut augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et rendre pérenne son activité c’est pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES un quatrième pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif. Elle voudrait assurer la santé  et scolarisation des enfants. Madame Awah est la responsable de leur groupement constitué que de femmes commerçantes qui sont dans la vente des habits, des charbons de bois, des produits de beauté, des céréales et autres. Elles espèrent avec ce crédit réaliser des bénéfices et voir leurs familles s’épanouir.
texts.en:
A merchant by trade, Ms. Awah lives with  her husband, who is a farmer, and their five children, who are in school, in SOKODE. She is 45 years old. Her first child is 25 years old, and the last is 15. She has been in this domain since 1983, and she sells groceries, jewelry, and school supplies in REGION CENTRALE, where she also gets her inventory. 

She wants to increase her sales and sustain her business, so she is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES to reach her goals. She would like to ensure her children's health care and education. 

Ms. Awah is the official of the group made up of businesswomen who sell clothing, charcoal, beauty products, grains, and more. They hope to use this loan to make profits and to see their families thrive.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, jewelry, and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase large amounts of clothing, shoes, and handbags to resell

loans.name: Buheta Group

texts.fr:
Juvénal fait partie du groupe Buheta et habite à Gitaga. Il a 44 ans et  a perdu sa femme et ses enfants. 

Il fait le commerce de la bière Primus, vin de banane,  des brochettes dans son bar depuis  13 ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière Primus, une grande quantité de vin de banane et de  viande pour la préparation de brochettes,  à revendre  dans son bar, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années,  grâce aux  bénéfices de son commerce, il voudrait entreprendre l’élevage moderne et acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Juvénal is part of the group Buheta and lives in Gitaga. He is a 44 years old and has lost his wife and children.

Juvénal has been selling Primus beer, banana wine, and meat kebabs in his pub for thirteen years. 

He is on his eighth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many cases of Primus beer, a large quantity of banana wine, and some meat for making kebabs to sell in his pub, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, thanks to the profit from his business, he would like to start a modern livestock farming enterprise and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase many cases of Primus beer, a large quantity of banana wine, and some meat for making kebabs to sell in his pub

loans.name: Cooperative Essofa Group

texts.fr: Aidé par 04 personnes dans l’exercice de son activité, Mr Saibou est cultivateur de profession. Il exerce son activité en REGION CENTRALE  depuis 2011. Homme de 41ans, père de 05 enfants dont 04 scolarisés et ayant pour femme une ménagère, Mr Saibou responsable du groupement ESSOFA dont il fait partie il y a un moment sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail. Il voudrait à l’avenir épargner, se prendre en charge en cas de maladie et acheter un tracteur pour le labour. Les autres membres sont des femmes et des hommes qui sont dans le domaine de l’agriculture.
texts.en:
Saibou is a farmer who is helped by four people to carry out his professional duties.  He has been working in the Central Region since 2011.

He is 41 years old, the father of five children, four of whom are in school.  His wife is a homemaker.

Saibou is the leading member of the ESSOFA group, and he is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy some farming equipment. 

In the future, he would like to save some money, be able to support himself if he becomes ill, and buy a tractor for plowing.

The other members (of the group) are men and women who also work in the field of agriculture.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Ron is 51 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are living with her. Of the rest, some of them have jobs while the others help out in the family’s rice paddy.

For the past ten years Ron has farmed four hectares of rice. She and her husband are also raising two pigs for extra income. She earns about 17,000 KHR a day.

Ron is a borrower with VisionFund. She and another borrower comprise a two-member group (her co-member has taken loans three times). Past loans have successfully improved her lifestyle.

Now Ron is applying for a fourth loan of 1,400,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for 1,300,000 KHR. As the group leader Ron will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes to accrue more income so she can maintain living conditions, especially with decent food for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr: Dieudonné est âgé de 44 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Chimène. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Dieudonné vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différentes charges, Dieudonné a appris la mécanique et l’exerce depuis près de vingt ans. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Dieudonné s’approvisionne en matériels  de travail dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Dieudonné sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Dieudonné is 44 years old and married to a merchant named Chimène. The couple have five children, not all in school but all in their care. In addition to their children, the couple have another child to support. Dieudonné lives together with his wife and children. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered.

To help with different expenses, Dieudonné learned mechanics and has been working at it for nearly twenty years. This business enables him to meet his needs without much problem. He gets his work supplies and equipment from a  region in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Dieudonné is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable him to boost the level of his business and to increase his customer base and income. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Jeanne Mèwèmonsè

texts.fr: Jeanne Mèwèmonsè est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Jérôme. Jeanne Mèwèmonsè est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Jeanne Mèwèmonsè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Jeanne Mèwèmonsè vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des tissus et des bijoux à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Jeanne Mèwèmonsè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne Mèwèmonsè sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en:
Jeanne Mèwèmonsè is 43 years old and married to man named Jérôme. She is the mother of two children, both in school and in the couple's care. She lives together with her husband and children, and along with him, she ensures that the diverse household needs are met.

To help with different needs at home, Jeanne Mèwèmonsè has been selling cloth and jewelry out of her home and door to door for about ten years. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Jeanne Mèwèmonsè is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time. This loan will allow her to boost the level of her business and to grow her customer base and her income.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, 50, is a widowed mother of four children. Three out of her four children are living with her; some of them are helping with the family's business and some are paid workers. The rest of her family is originally from Kror Kor district of Pursat province where rice farming is the common business to generate income for villagers as well as for Nat. She has been in rice farming with four hectares of farmland for 30 years. 

For Nat, the main challenges are low yield caused by insects and the dwindling price of rice. Nat has just joined VisionFund for this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is taking this new loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing. She hopes to receive a good yield and double her income, so she can set aside some money in order to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy 12 sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 50 years old and lives with her parents in Gardabani district. Her parents are pensioners. Lia is very hardworking woman, but she still doesn’t make enough money to put into savings and improve her family’s living conditions.

Lia has a dairy with two milk cows. She makes yogurt with the daily milk production and sells it locally. The family’s average monthly income is 220 GEL, which is barely enough for food and everyday expenses.

Lia is applying for a 1500 GEL loan to repair the family’s house, which is old and rundown. She will use the loan to buy building materials. By renovating the house the family’s living conditions will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard day’s work in comfort. Lia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Haxhi

texts.en:
Haxhi is a 63-year-old married male with three grown children. He lives in the southwestern part of Kosovo in the Ashkali Community. The Ashkali community in Kosovo suffers from great poverty. It is uncommon for a family from this community to deal with livestock such as Haxhi does; he is one of the rare cases. More than four years ago Haxhi started an agricultural business for the family needs and to provide for them. Now by demand of the neighborhood he has started to sell milk for others in his community. 

He has been selling fresh milk to the local dairy farm and has made a good living and profit from this so far. To generate even more income he also works on viticulture. He is requesting a loan to buy a cow. In the future he plans to add more cows and to increase his business and milk production. He is aware that without KosInvest’s / Kiva support his goal will be difficult to achieve. He really appreciates all the support from the lenders.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rokhaya habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et soutien de famille qui supporte les charges de 2 enfants âgés de 9 et 12 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 30 ans et pratique la vente d’habits de friperie devant chez elle. Elle est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de la localité ou elle vit et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs,  prévu pour   l’approvisionnement de balles de friperie destinées à la vente.Elle a déjà remboursé 6 prets antérieurs dans la dite institution. Son objectif est d’augmenter son fond de roulement. A travers ce financement et mieux développer son activité de commerce. Ainsi elle pourra mieux supporter ses charges familiales et améliorer davantage les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle souhaite dans l’avenir pouvoir disposer d’un grand magasin de vente de friperie et de prêts à porter.
texts.en:
Ms. Rokhaya lives in Senegal. She is married and is the breadwinner, who supports two children, aged 9 and 12 years old. She has been working in the commercial sector for over thirty years and sells secondhand clothing in front of her home. 

She is a member of the U-IMCEC branch office in the town where she lives and is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for stocking up on bales of used clothing for resale. She has already repaid six previous loans in the aforementioned institution. Her goal is to increase her working capital through this financing and to develop her business further. Thus, she will be able to do better in covering family expenses and improving her family's living conditions.

In the future, she would like to have a large store for selling secondhand and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to stock up on secondhand clothing for business purposes

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Aged 47 and a rural villager from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Sok is married and one of the breadwinners of the family with five children who are dependent on him as they are still in school. He makes a living via rice farming and pig raising. His wife also assists in earning more income through sugarcane juice selling. 

Sok can earn about 11,000 KHR per day from the business that he has been with for 21 years. To continue supporting his business, he is applying for a first loan cycle with Kiva partner VisoinFund in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and to pay for harvesting for his farmland. He expects to make more income so as to make his living conditions become more prosperous and better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for harvesting for his farmland

loans.name: Zade

texts.en:
Zade is a sixty-one-year-old widow. She has five grown children and lives with her children and grandchildren in the Ashkali community. Zade owns a small old house that is need of renovation and has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. The current main source of income comes from their boys who are working for a very low salary. 

Her house has an insulation problem in which it loses much heat. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy the coal to keep the house warm. Zade’s family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter due to the lack of heat. 

Zade needs a loan to renovate her house. Renovation in this manner will allow her family to live a normal and healthy life. 

She really appreciate this help!

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Hoai

texts.en:
Hoai, 39 years old, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her husband and her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoai and her husband have been in business for ten years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish.

loans.name: Noudehou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NOUDEHOU 1 est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Denise Hounsi est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Denise Hounsi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Denise Hounsi est âgée de 63 ans et est mariée à un certain Félicien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Denise Hounsi et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Denise Hounsi vend depuis quatre ans, de la nourriture (riz, haricot, pâte de maïs, accompagnés de la sauce) à son domicile et dans un marché du Bénin. Denise Hounsi s'approvisionne dans un village du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Denise Hounsi et les autres membres du groupement NOUDEHOU 1 sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group NOUDEHOU 1 is composed of thirteen persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Denise Hounsi, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. With the goal of boosting business in order to cope better with customer demands, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a second time. 

Denise Hounsi did not attend school. She is 63 years old and married to a man named Félicien. The couple have four children, not all in school but all in their care. She and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered.

To help with diverse family needs, Denise Hounsi has been selling food (rice, beans, corn polenta, served with sauces) for four years out of her home and at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a village in Benin.

With the goal of bolstering their business and satisfying their customers further, Denise Hounsi and the other members of the group NOUDEHOU 1 are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of  rice, corn, and beans to cook and sell

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 48-year-old married woman. She has three children and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. For six years Van and her husband have operated a food stall selling meals to people in their community.

Van would like a loan to purchase good quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase good quality food and rice in bulk

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is 32 years old and is married. She lives with husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband earn an income to support their family running a business of making shoe molds. She intends to use her loan to expand her business by buying metal materials for making shoe molds.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy metal materials for making shoe molds

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 22 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past three years Rose has been working hard to manage her food stall where she sells bananas, cassava and other local foods.

This group is comprised of two hardworking women, Rose and her co-member, Jackline. As head of the group Rose is applying for a 1200000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda. Her loan portion will be 70,0000 UGX, which will be used to buy increased amounts of cassava to sell. This will help her generate greater profits and help pay for school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house.

Rose’s group loan falls under BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Hanife

texts.en:
Hanife is forty-eight years old. She is married and has three adult children ranging from twenty-eight years old to thirty-one years old. She lives in the southwestern part of Kosovo. 

Hanife operates a tailoring business from her home and has been a seamstress for the past 15 years. She is very professional and really enjoys her work, and she has many requests from her customers. 

Hanife needs a loan in order to buy the needed materials for her work. Her goal is to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the near future. 

She is happy about the financial support from KosInvest/KIVA because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family, improving their living conditions and saving money towards her children’s future. 

She really appreciates this support!

loans.use: to buy the needed materials for her work.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen, a 40-year-old divorced woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She supports her family by running a business of making and selling clothing. Quyen requests a loan to purchase more products, such as cloth, needles, and thread, to make more clothing and stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, needles, and thread, to make clothing and stock her store.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is a 34 year old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Hong earns a living by running a general store, which she has done for 8 years. Hong would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery items.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 33 years old and she is married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hong and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a business of making slipper molds. Hong intends to use her loan to expand her business by buying metals and materials for making  the slipper molds.

Thao hopes for her business run to smoothly and, in turn, help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy metal materials for making slipper molds.

loans.name: Flurije

texts.en:
Flurije is 45 years old and has two children, ages 13 and 15 years old. She lives in the Roma community of Kosovo. The Roma community in the Balkan region is extremely poverty-ridden and every day more people are working hard for the improvement of their lives. Flurije and her family live in these very poor conditions. 

Flurije suffers from chronic headaches due to these conditions. Her house does not possess the elementary basic things, making life difficult for them. Based on the picture, it appears that her stove for cooking is even located outside of the house. She is now requesting a loan of 600 Euros to make a small kitchen and to buy some kitchen tools and supplies. 

She hopes that in this way it will improve her family’s life. She is very happy for this opportunity!

loans.use: to make a small kitchen and to buy some kitchen tools and supplies.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc, 41, is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a guard. Ngoc supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business four years ago. She sells snack foods, shampoos and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions. She hopes to set aside some money for facing difficulty in the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, specifically foods and household items.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong, a 62-year-old widowed woman, lives with her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been operating a beauty shop in the local community for six years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is 45 years old and he is a married father with three children, one is a daughter who is dependent on him and still in school. He lives in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. To support his family, he has been farming rice and sometimes working as a construction worker and his wife works as a garment worker to earn additional income. Having been in this business for 10 years, he and his wife can earn about US$4 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Chantha’s group consists of four members who live in the same village; Chantha and two fellow group members have been with VisionFund for one cycle while the remaining member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Chantha completely paid back the past loan which has helped him with sufficient food and has supported his child in school. Now he and his group members are applying for the same loan amount, KHR 1,000,000 each. Chantha is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his farmland and use a portion of it to pay for plowing. He hopes to increase his income from the current business so as to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for his farmland

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Sohoueto 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOHOUETO 1 est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Félicienne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Félicienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Félicienne est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Félicienne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Félicienne prépare des savons (à base de soude et d'huile de palme) qu'elle vend par livraison et aussi de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Félicienne vend des produits de soins (dentifrices et brosses à dents) depuis deux ans environs. Félicienne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Félicienne et les autres membres du groupement SOHOUETO 1 sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group SOHOUETO 1 is composed of fifteen persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Félicienne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. With the goal of boosting business in order to cope better with customer demands, this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé for a second time. 

Félicienne did not attend school. She is 41 years old and married to a man named Christophe. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. She and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered.

To help with diverse family needs, Félicienne has been making soap (made from soda and palm oil) which she sells by delivery and by going door to door. Parallel to this business, she has been selling personal care products (toothpaste and toothbrushes) for about two years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin and in her region.

With the goal of bolstering their business and satisfying their customers further, Félicienne and the other members of the group SOHOUETO 1 are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase their level of business. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase soda and palm oil for making soap

loans.name: Juan Dionicio

texts.es: Juan es originario de la  comarca el Balsamo,Teustepe es acompañado progenitor de 2 hijos de 10 años y  3 meses. El empezó a trabajar a la edad de 8 años los niños sobre todo en el área rural aprenden con sus padres a cultivar la tierra es por eso que es la única actividad que  aprenden en vez de finalizar la escuela  es trabajar en el campo sembrando granos básicos frijol, maíz y trigo. Juan con la producción que vende  compra insumos para seguir trabajando y otras cosa para el hogar, su familia lo apoya vende su producto en la misma comarca. La época cuando las siembras estas bajas el viaja a Costa Rica buscar trabajo como jornalero. A él le gustaría vender su producto donde le paguen mejor su producción de granos básicos. El solicito el crédito para compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar frijoles y maíz. Este crédito le será de mucha ayuda pues le dará  un mejor mantenimiento a su cultivo y sacar una producción de calidad y tener mejores ingresos. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta comprar 2 manzanas de tierras y su meta próxima sacar su cosecha con éxito y pagar su préstamo.
texts.en: Juan is from the community of Balsamo,Teustepe. He is the married father of 2 children, aged 10 years and 3 months. He started working when he was 8 years old. Children, especially rural children, learn from their parents how to cultivate the land. That is why it is the only activity they learn, instead of finishing school. They work in the fields planting basic grains such as beans, corn and wheat. With what Juan sells, he buys materials to keep working as well as other things for his home.His family helps him by selling the products in the same community. When the crops are at their lowest he travels to Costa Rica to seek work as a laborer. He would like to sell his products where they pay more for basic grains. He asked for the loan to buy materials and pay for the labor to plant beans and corn. This loan will be a big help because it will give him better maintenance of the crop and obtain a quality harvest and have more income. Among his plans for the future are buying 2 plots of land. His next goal is to have a succesful harvest and pay off his loan.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor to plant beans and corn.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram is a 33-year-old woman. She has one child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business selling clothes for ten years. 

Tram would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials. Ha's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials to make and sell clothing.

loans.name: Saluom's Group

texts.en:
Saluom is a villager from a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is 43 years old and married with three children; one daughter is dependent on her and still in school. To feed the family, Saluom has been involved in rice farming and supplements their income by growing cucumbers and cabbages while her husband is a construction worker in the local area. Saluom has been in this business for fifteen years. The current businesses earn them approximately 40,000 KHR per day, however, drought is still the main challenge for the rice growing business. 

Saluom’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and she is in her second cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Saluom will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy insecticide for protecting the crop yield. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Sohoueto Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOHOUETO est composé de dix neuf personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Thomasia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Thomasia est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Thomasia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Thomasia a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Afin de subvenir aux diverses charges du ménage, Thomasia vend depuis sept ans, des boissons dans une buvette et à son domicile. Cette activité lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Thomasia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Thomasia sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement SOHOUETO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group SOHOUETO is composed of nineteen persons who reside in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Thomasia, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 54 years old and married to a man named Antoine. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. In addition to their children, the couple have another child to support. Thomasia lives together with her children and husband. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. 

Thomasia dropped out of secondary school. To cover diverse household expenses, she has been selling beverages at a refreshment stand and at her home for seven years. This is a business that brings in significant revenues. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Thomasia is requesting, along with the other members of the group SOHOUETO, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase cases of beverages to sell

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino es de la comarca Potrerillo, en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, de oficio agricultor, casado, padre de familia. El   dice que desde que tenía 20 años se ha  dedicado a la agricultura de maíz, frijol y trigo, en ese entonces eran pequeña las área de siembra costos que  cubría con dinero que ganaba como jornalero  después saco un crédito  para compra y venta de carne, también  para  cultivar tomate lo cual lo realiza con ayuda de mozos y una vez que saca la cosecha la vende donde este mejor la plaza y paguen mejor.
 Gabino está solicitando este crédito para comprar abono, insumos para  sembrar tomates. El dice que este crédito le será de ayuda ya que necesita abonar el tomate que pronto saldrá la cosecha a la venta y dice que una vez que saque la cosecha del tomate pagara el crédito y sacara otro crédito para sembrar un poco mas ya que es rentable .
texts.en:
Gabino is from the community of Potrerillo. It is outside of  Teustepe. He is a marrried father and a farmer by trade. He says that since he was 20 years old he has worked farming corn and beans. Back then his planting area was small and he covered his costs with the money he made as a laborer. Afterwards, he took out a loan to buy and sell meat as well as to grow tomatoes. He does with with some workers, and once the harvest is in he sells it wherever the payment terms are the best.

Gabino is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer and materials to plant tomatoes. He says that this loan will help him since he needs to fertilize the tomatoes. He will pay off the loan and take out another loan to plant a little more since it is profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and materials to plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en: Ninh is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store. Ninh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son would like to take a further loan to buy more materials to produce parts for polishing furniture to sell from his shop. Son's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to produce parts for polishing furniture.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of foods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is 40 years old and living in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer while her husband works as a paid worker to earn additional income. Having been in this business for almost twenty years, they are able to earn about KHR 36,000 per day. Low crop yields caused by drought are still the main challenge for her paddy-field. 

This is the first microloan for Channy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan with VisionFund of US$1,000. Channy is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to plow the rice paddy. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Mouhamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mouhamadou vit au Sénégal dans une de ses localités villageoises. Il est marié et s’active dans le secteur de l’artisanat. Son activité de menuiserie lui donne l’opportunité de fabriquer des meubles (lits, armoires et autres) qu’il expose a la vente. Il capitalise une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs. Présentement  il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs qui lui permettra de renforcer le nombre de ses meubles a exposer et par conséquent a mieux rentabiliser son activer et accroitre ses revenus dans le but de mieux prendre en charges les dépenses de son foyer. Son plus grand rêve est de disposer d’une grande usine de fabrique de bois pour la menuiserie.
texts.en:
Mr. Mouhamadou lives in Senegal in a village. He is married and active in the artisanal sector. His carpentry business gives him the chance to make furniture (beds, armoires, and more), which he displays for sale. He capitalizes on over ten years of experience in this business.

He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch office where he has already repaid two previous loans. He is presently requesting a loan of 500,000 francs enabling him to boost the number of pieces of furniture on display and thus to make his business more profitable, as well as to increase his revenues. His goal is to do better in covering household expenses. 

His greatest dream is to have a large factory for making wood furniture.

loans.use: to finance the construction of additional furniture to sell

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (brother and sister). 

Resty sells second-hand clothes and charcoal at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include power and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Hugo Ruben

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 38años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sus pobladores tiene un don en la preparación de platillos ya que lo hacen de manera muy deliciosa. Hugo es padre de un pequeño de 10 años a quien quiere muchísimo y sobre todo trabaja para darle una vida digna y llena de amor; cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con su hijo y también en algunas ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo”Arroz chaufa”.

Día a día Hugo trabaja en un policlínico de su ciudad como odontólogo, trabaja alrededor de  10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes  en el día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy paciente con los clientes y sobre todo porque es cumplido y responsable.

Hugo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño cuarto y también construir su cocina ya que actualmente es de abobe; de esta manera el podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y así poder seguir luchando por conseguir hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Hugo, 38, lives in the city of Chincha; a city noted for having a hot, welcoming climate and for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  Its residents are very good cooks and prepare very delicious dishes. 

Hugo is the father of a ten-year-old son who he loves very much and above all works very hard to provide with a proper life that’s full of love.  When he has any free time available, Hugo likes to play soccer with his son and also sometimes very much enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz Chaufa.”

Hugo works day to day as an orthodontist in a local clinic.  He works about 10 hours daily and can see up to ten patients daily.  He believes he does well at work because he’s very patient with his patients and above all because he’s responsible and follows through.

Hugo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to build a small room and his kitchen which is currently of adobe.  In this way he will be able to give his family improved quality of life and continue striving towards making his greatest dream a reality: to finish building his house and provide a good education for his son.

loans.use: to build a bedroom and a kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria es tiene 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Maria vive al lado de su esposo y junto a el tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero por quienes ha luchando mucho para darles una vida digna. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho lee y también en algunas ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Pollo”.  Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Secretariado.

Día a día Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de chocotejas, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón y atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad.

Maria esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina a gas, ya que actualmente su cocina es de Kerosene y podra elaborar sus productos de mejor manera; de esta manera podrá tener los utensilios necesarios y podra seguir luchando para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su empresa de Chocotejas”.
texts.en:
María, 53, lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture, especially the growing of cotton, grapes and asparagus, among others, is also common here.  

María lives with her husband and she has two children who are adults now and for whom she strives to provide with a proper life.  When she has free time available she likes to read very much and also sometimes enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Seco de Pollo.”  Due to her family’s limited economic resources she was only able to go to 11th grade but would have liked to have studied to become a secretary.

María works day to day in her small business selling ‘chocotejas’ [traditional chocolate candies from Ica].  She works around 8 hours daily and is able to help her husband cover household expenses with what she earns from her work.  She believes she does well in her business because she makes tasty items and tends to her customers with kindness

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy a gas stove.  The one she uses at present burns kerosene so she will be able to make her products in a better way and she will have the necessary tools to continue working towards making her greatest dream a reality: to have a chocoteja company.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Jesus Benit Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUS BENIT est composé de dix huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Françoise est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Françoise a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Françoise est âgée de 42 ans et est marié à un chauffeur du nom de Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Françoise vit avec son enfant et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Françoise vend depuis quinze ans, des bijoux et des vêtements à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Françoise s'approvisionne au Nigeria. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Françoise et les autres membres du groupement JESUS BENIT sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The group JESUS BENIT has 18 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Françoise has her hand raised in the photo. With a goal to improve business and better respond to client demand, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé. Francoise only studied through primary school. Françoise is 42 years old and married to a driver named Albert. The couple has three children who are all in school. Françoise lives with her children and together with her husband takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, Françoise has been selling jewelry and clothing from her home and through a distribution system for the past 15 years. She buys her inventory in Nigeria. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Françoise together with the group JESUS BENIT are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Eladia Efemia

texts.es:
Eladia es una joven de 24 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de tuna, maíz, algodón, entre otros, así mismo se encuentra uno de los atractivos turísticos muy visitado por los turistas en todo el año como lo son “Las Líneas de Nazca”. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, pero lo que las le gusta es disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Eladia trabaja en como técnica farmacéutica en una farmacia de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo atenta con los clientes.

Eladia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que va realizar refacción de paredes agrietadas, mejoramiento de las ventanas, lo cual mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, así ella seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propia Farmacia”.
texts.en:
Eladia, 24, is a young woman living in the city of Nazca that’s noted for having a hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture, especially growing prickly pears, corn and cotton, among others is also notable here.  One of the most popular year-round tourist sites is also found here: the Nazca Lines.  When she has free time available she likes to watch television very much but what she likes most is enjoying one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Lomo Saltado.” [Steak sautéed in Olive Oil with Onions and Tomatoes served over French Fries and Rice.]

With much enthusiasm, Eladia works as a pharmacy technician in a pharmacy in her city.  She works around 8 hours daily and can tend to up to 15 customers daily.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very responsible and above all attentive to her customers.

Eladia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to make some home improvements since she will repair cracked walls and improve the windows which will improve her and her family’s quality of life and she will continue working every day towards making her greatest dream a reality: to have her own pharmacy.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Roddy Alfredo

texts.es:
Roddy vive en el distrito de Tinguiña, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Tinguiña se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también porque es un distrito que ha ido mejorando cada día y sobre todo creciendo gracias al esfuerzo de sus pobladores.  Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Roddy le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta disfrutar de pasar un tiempo de familia con su pequeño hijo, al cual quiere mucho y por el cual cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante para darle una vida digna a pesar de todas las dificultades del día a dia. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo dedicación Roddy trabaja como taxista, ya que con los frutos de este trabajo puedo solventar los gastos de su hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo es muy amable con los clientes.

Roddy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, especialmente retirar el motor para realizar una revisión, asimismo reparar el tanque de combustible a gas de su vehículo, ya que ha presentado mucho inconvenientes, de esta manera el podrá tener un vehículo más seguro y también darle seguridad a sus clientes y evitar accidentes graves; así el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando muy duro para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Roddy lives in Tinguiña District in Ica, Perú.  Tinguiña District is noted for its hot climate as well as for being a district that’s been improving every day and above all growing thanks to the efforts of its residents.  When Roddy has free time available he very much enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors in his neighborhood.  He also likes spending family time with his little boy who he loves very much and strives daily to get ahead to provide him with a dignified life despite daily difficulties that arise.  Due to his family’s limited economic resources he was only able to go to 11th grade but would have liked to attend university.

With much effort and dedication above all, Roddy works as a taxi driver because with earnings from this job he’s able to cover household expenses.  
He works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 30 customers per day.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s a hardworking and above all very kind to his customers.

Roddy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to service his vehicle, especially remove the motor to check it out.  He will also be able to repair the vehicle’s gas tank because he’s been having many breakdowns and now he will be able to have a safer vehicle and provide safety for his customers and avoid serious accidents so that he can continue striving towards making his greatest dream a reality: to provide his son with a profession.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Farhad

texts.ru: Farhadu 60 let, on jivet s jenoy I trema detmi. On prodaet ovoshi kotorie rastit u seba v ferme. Farhad zanimaetsa etim uje 20 let, ego jena vmeste s sinom pomogayut emu.  Krome etogo oni s jenoy poluchayut pensiyu chto ochen pomogaet im soderjat semyu. Farhad xochet sdelat remont doma, emu neobxodimi dengi v summe 1000 AZN. Farhad zabotliviy otec I xoroshiy chelovek I on nadeyetsa na pomosh.
texts.en: Farhad is 60 years old, and he lives with his wife and three children.  He sells vegetables that he grows on his farm.  Farhad has been involved in this business for 20 years.  His wife and son help him with this business.  Besides this, he and his wife earn a pension, which helps them very much to support the family.  Farhad wants to make repairs at home and needs a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN.  Farhad is a caring father and a good person, and relies on your help.

loans.use: to make repairs at home

loans.name: Idalides

texts.es: Idalides con su credikiva anterior, compró ranchos, vivieres y abarrotes con los que surtió su tienda y logró rotar rápidamente su mercancía. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el  comprará tubérculos, cereales, refrescos y víveres, con esta inversión su tienda se verá surtida y atraerá a sus clientes con la mercancía que estos usualmente buscan para su consumo diario. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Ustedes son unos ángeles  de Dios dedicados a proporcionar  el bien a los demás, no decaigan en tan magna labor, continúen adelante y Dios los bendiga. “
texts.en: Idalides used her previous Kiva loan to buy snacks, foodstuffs and groceries she used to stock her store; she sold her merchandise quickly.  She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy tubers, cereals, soft-drinks and foodstuffs.  With this investment she’ll have her store stocked and will attract customers with the merchandise they’ve been looking for lately for their daily consumption.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “You are angels from God dedicated to doing good for others.   Don’t ever falter in such great work.  Continue forward and may God bless you.”

loans.use: to buy tubers, cereals, softo-drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.ru: Reyhan rabotaet portnixoy u seba doma. Ona delaet raznie shveynie dela I ochen lubit svoyu rabotu. Ona zamujem, u nee 3 detey, 2 iz nix xodat v shkolu. Reyhan planiruet kupit novie shveynie mashini, nanyat pomoshnikov I rasshirit svoye delo.  Segodna ona obratilas za summoy 600 AZN dla remonta doma. U nix doma siro I steni nujdayutsa v novoy pokraske.
texts.en: Reyhan works as a seamstress at home.  She sews various things and loves her work very much.  She is married and has three children, two of whom attend a school.  Reyhan plans to purchase a new sewing machine, hire helpers and expand her business.  Today, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 AZN to repair her home.  There is a lot of moisture in their house, and the walls need new paint.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Arley

texts.es:
Arley se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 12 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar tiene una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar y snack. Arley tiene experiencia de varios años en la actividad y gracias a esta experiencia ha decido montar desde hace unos 4 años su propio negocio para poder mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar. Su principal fortaleza es la experiencia que tiene en la actividad, pero su debilidad principal son las condiciones locativas de su negocio, es por esto que busca un préstamo para realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio y mejorar las condiciones para aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Arley’s married and has two children who are 3 and 12 years of age and to generate income needed in his home he has a general store where he sells basic staples and snacks.  Arley has several years’ experience in this activity and thanks to this experience decided four years ago to open his own business in order to improve his family’s economic condition.  

His main strength is the experienced he has in this activity but his main weakness is the physical condition of his shop which is why he’s looking for financing to make improvements to his shop and improve its conditions to increase his sales.  His dream is to move the business forward so that it will make it possible for him to provide his children with better quality of life and access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to improve the physical conditions of his sales spot.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La socia Maria De Los Angeles tiene 20 años de edad, es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene una hija (Alexandra de dos años de edad), ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se dedica a su hogar pues es una excelente ama de casa pero también en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ademas, Maria De Los Angeles por las mañanas estudia la carrera profesional de administración en una instituto  privado de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad la socia Maria De Los Angeles requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes, collares, pulseras, y otras cosas más. 

La socia Maria De Los Angeles se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Maria De Los Angeles is 20 years old and lives with her partner.  Together they have a little girl, Alexandra, who is two years old.  Maria De Los Angeles belongs to the communal bank “Mi Perú” (My Perú), a part of Asociación Arariwa.  She is a native of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  She dedicates her time to her home and is an excellent housewife.  She dedicates her free time to selling cosmetics.  She has earned her living in this business for two years, and it has been going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  In addition, Maria De Los Angeles spends her mornings studying Administration in a private school in Cusco.  At this time, the member Maria De Los Angeles needs the loan to purchase merchandise such as perfumes, earrings, necklaces, bracelets and other items.

The member Maria De Los Angeles feels grateful for the opportunity offered through this program.  She promises to comply with the scheduled re-payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as perfumes, earrings, necklaces, bracelets and other items.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona villa exaltación en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como compaginadora en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de alquileres.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que le será de mucha ayuda en sus estudios.
El sueño de Sara es terminar sus estudios, pues estudia Psicología y está en 4to año de la carrera, y mejorar sus ingresos para posteriormente adquirir una casa en anticrético para ahorrar en el pago de alquileres de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sara is single and has no children.  She lives in a rented house occupying a single room with brick walls and a dirt floor located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Exaltación zone.  She currently works as a file clerk in a private firm for more than 8 hours daily and with the income she earns is able to pay for food, schooling and rent.  She needs the loan to buy a computer because it would be of much help to her in her classes.

Sara’s dream is to complete her studies because she's studying psychology and is in the fourth year of her career and to improve her income so that later on she can acquire a house using the ‘anticrético’ modality to save on rent costs and thus improve her quality of life. [Transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you].  This is the second time she’s asked for an IMPRO and KIVA loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her phychology classes.

loans.name: Arturo Wilfredo

texts.es: El socio Arturo tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, él es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él es un joven responsable que se dedica a la atender su pequeña librería pero hay mismo también brinda servicio de internet o sea tiene varias computadoras conectadas a internet. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien. Además, él está estudiando en un instituto privado la carrera profesional de barman. Su sueño del socio Arturo es abrir una cadena de librerías. En esta oportunidad el socio Arturo requiere el préstamo para comprar una computadora. El socio Arturo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Arturo, 20, is single and has no children yet.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Mi Perú” (My Peru) communal bank.  He is originally from the city of Cusco and still lives in the city of his birth.  He is a responsible young man who tends to his small bookstore where he also provides Internet access services, that is, he has computers always connected to the Internet.  He’s been in these businesses for three years now and does very well.  He’s also 
studying in a private institute to become a barman.

Arturo’s dream is to open a chain of bookstores.  On this occasion, Arturo needs the loan to buy a computer.  He is grateful for the opportunity provided him by this means and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el ciclo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de pantalones, venta de dulces, venta de coca, venta de verduras, macramé, venta de carne, venta de artículos plásticos, chofer, venta de plantillas, fabricación de tenis.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que vino a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de productos artesanales (mantas con tejido a macramé) mismo que emprendió desde los 16 años de edad y que en la actualidad le ayuda a sustentar su economía.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento del capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la las reuniones de su Banca Comunal.

En la fotografía podemos percibir que la Señora Juana se agacho y la señora Roxana alza la mano para que la ubiquen.
texts.en:
The "Flor Naciente" Communal Bank is starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Regional Office. The group is made up of twelve members and is governed by a board of directors, the president of which is Señora Verónica. The members' businesses are varied and include: pant-making, selling candy, selling coca leaves, selling vegetables, macrame, selling meat, selling plastic items, selling stencils, making sneakers, and driving.
This loan will benefit these little microbusinesses. Veronica joined Pro Mujer one cycle ago at the invitation of a promoter who came to her home to invite her. She currently has a business making artisanal products (blankets with macrame weaving). She started this business at the age of sixteen, and the business is currently helping her by bringing in an income.
This loan is to be used to increase capital (buying wool). She will buy the wool from the wholesale stores and, after making her products, will sell based on orders. This work allows her to generate an income in order to support her family where possible. She is single and has two children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the Communal Bank meetings.
In the photo we can see Señora Juana crouching down and Señora Roxana raising her hand to identify herself.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Karla Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Karla Angélica de 21 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos, es una mujer emprendedora a la que le gustan los retos y no se detiene por nada ante la vida. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la  localidad y Karla está dedicada a las ventas. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, calzado, artículos usados y nuevos es la manera en la que ella ayuda al ingreso familiar. Es por eso que en esta ocasión ella pide de nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía para hacer crecer su negocio y así poder aportar más a su casa. Karla agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Karla Angélica, 21, is married and has two children.  She’s an enterprising woman who enjoys challenges and does not let anything get in her way.  Her husband works in a local factory and Karla works in sales.  She buys and sells clothes, footwear, used and new goods; this is how she contributes to family income and why on this occasion she’s asking for help to buy merchandise so that her business will grow and she can contribute even more to her home.  Karla will be grateful for any help that can be given her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Kulmairam

texts.ru:
Кулмайрам 49 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей, ее младший сын учится в 5 классе.  Кулмайрам, оставшись одна после смерти мужа, в качестве источника дохода для семьи, решила заняться торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Кулмайрам, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная выручка составляет около 10,000 сом. Кроме того, Кулмайрам занимается изготовлением пирожков и выпечки, что также приносит небольшой доход.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулмайрам обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение товарооборота за счет закупа чая, растительного и сливочного масел, сахара для изготовления джемов .  Доходы от кредита Кулмайрам планирует вложить в расширение своей бизнес – деятельности за счет услуг кафетерия.
texts.en: Kulmairam is 49 years old, a widow and a mother of three children.   Her youngest son attends a fifth grade.  Kulmairam, left alone after her husband's death, decided to get involved in sales of food products to provide a source of income for her family.  She started this business with a sum of 50,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Kulmairam's hard work, today her monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som.  Besides this, she is involved in making pies and baked goods, which also bring in a small income.  In order to further develop her business, Kulmairam requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase her product turnover by purchasing tea, vegetable oil, butter and sugar for making jams.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business by adding a cafe.

loans.use: to increase product turnover

loans.name: Eriosi

texts.en:
Eriosi is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members.  

She has a business selling second-hand clothes and has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also gets additional income through roasting maize from home. 

Eriosi has been in this business for six years and works seven days a week from her home. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she becomes a wholesaler and also will be able to build rental rooms. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.
